review_title: ... a slim body type and the SMALL fit me perfect. I usually wear medium for most clothes but ...
review_body: I am 5'9 and weigh 165 and have a slim body type and the SMALL fit me perfect.  I usually wear medium for most clothes but these come a little bigger.  Some people have complained of how flimsy these are but actually that's what make them great that they are light and thin, that doesn't mean it is cheap and I believe they can hold their own.

review_title: Great lightweight shirt that first true to size and doesn't smell
review_body: I bought this in green because it was super cheap compared to the other colors. It's great as I stay visible when working out outside but it is quite the statement under the harsh fluorescents in my gym. Anyway, it's a great lightweight shirt that doesn't hold in smell that is common to other quick-drying shirts. I got an XL and it fits true to size. My only complaint is that the seams around the arms fall a little weird and it almost feels like the sleeves are just a smidge too short. For instance, when I lift a barbell over my head, the whole shirt rides up more than usual. Not a detrimental flaw, just something to keep in mind.

review_title: Doesn't Appear To Be Genuine UA
review_body: I have purchased quite a few UA items in the past, a few on Amazon, but most from UA's website. I am always worried about buying items such as this here, for fear that I might be getting a knock-off product. I have been lucky with the few items I had bought from Amazon so far, so I took a chance and purchased 4 of these UA tech tees when they had a 25% off sale. Unfortunately, this time I was not so lucky, and I really feel like these aren't official UA shirts. The material is extremely thin, with less sheen, and a tiny bit less stretch/give and/or natural movement than other tees of this type I've purchased in the past. The UA logo is flat white, not grey/silver/reflective, and it just looks cheap/fake. The overall appearance of the shirt suffers far more than the money I saved. I won't buy these on Amazon in the future, nor would I recommend others purchase them here.

review_title: Careful, quality is not consistent between colors!!
review_body: Royal/White is inferior quality, it is made in Nicaragua. Avoid. Fabric is scratchy, seams don't lie flat and about 1/2" shorted than other identical colors.

I really like these shirts.  They have the same great quality that you'd expect from UA and the fit was perfect.  In fact I love them so much, I order 2 more in different colors. If I had to nitpick (and it's the nature of the fabric, not Under Armour or this particular shirt), it's the static cling issues. Obviously if I'm wearing the shirt to exercise or work in the yard, I sweat enough that static cling doesn't pose a problem.  But if I'm just lounging around the house (not sweating), this fabric does have a tendency to develop cling (and generate static shocks).  But again, I have similar issues with other brands/makers...not just UA.

Not a good shirt. It feels very cheap and the seams are fraying too. I does not sick my sweat away either. So after experiencing this shirt, I went to 3 other stores to find replacements. Target, Kohls and Old navy. Target had the C9 Champion Tech t shirt for only 10 dollars that was more lightweight than this one. Old Navy had a lightweight and breathable shirt that was better than the Under Armour too. Kohls had the best shirt that was lightweight, breathable, well made and it wicked my sweat away too. The C9 champion Duo Dry Tech Tee shirt, the Old Navy Active Go Dry shirt and the Tek Gear Drytek shirt from kohls were all cheaper and better than this Under Armour shirt.

review_title: Really nice quality for a good price
review_body: Really nice quality for a good price.

Not Impressed. Scratchy material and hardly even soaks up sweat. Sticks to  back during intense workouts. Better off just wearing a regular T-Shirt. Also the sleeves are a bit short. It does look nice though.

I had another shirt of the "same cloth" I got last year that I loved. It was dry wick but had a nice stretchy cotton feel to it. I ordered this one because it said it had the same composition, but despite that it had a more typical plasticky dry wick feel to it that I'm not crazy about. It's still a good shirt that I'll wear to work out in and fits fine.

review_title: I own 5 and 3 out of the 5 have great collars. The other 2 are too loose
review_body: This isn't an Amazon problem, but a UA consistency problem! The Tech Short Sleeve T is all over the board when it comes to consistency. I own 5 and 3 out of the 5 have great collars. The other 2 are too loose! It's like rolling the dice when ordering one of these shirts. And the fit is a bit inconsistent as well. 3 are perfect Larges for me. The other 2, again, inconsistent. Love the shirts. Need better quality control!

review_title: Great pair of casual dress pants
review_body: These are great, if not perfect, dress slacks. I purchased the blue pair and they fit comfortable, give just enough room to be comfy and not too tight, but damn do they ever collect hairs and random bits and pieces of fluff. I have worn them a handful of times and had to run a lint collector over them twice a day to ensure I do not look like a homeless guy who walked through a petting zoo. I would not call these Wrinkle-Free but certainly Wrinkle-Resistant, by the afternoon of sitting at a desk you will have wrinkles.

review_title: Good for working where appearance doesn't matter
review_body: Soft, durable pants that have faded beyond all reason. We ordered black and now they're gray. I only wash in child with Tide.  My son wore them to work as a server and after a month he was told he couldn't wear them anymore. If color doesn't matter, the material had held up.  Good for working where appearance doesn't matter.

review_title: Great value in business casual pants
review_body: For $20, the Amazon Essentials Men's Classic-Fit pants are a real bargain! I have been disappointed to note that Dockers is getting away from cotton chinos, instead using a stretchy fabric that I don't care for. The Amazon Essentials chinos are similar in style, weight, and color choices as the older Dockers chinos, not to mention at a much lower price!

Pretty good fit, maybe a little long. I usually wear 30 inseam and sent back first pair for 29 L. But overall soft and comfy. Hopefully they will shrink just a bit in length and hold up through wearing and washing. If so it's great value for $20. Update: after two wearings and washings, these pants have held up fine, shrunk up just a bit 1/4 to 1/2 inch maybe in legs and held wrinkle free crease. I bought black, khaki, and navy, great casual/office pants. I'm a teacher so perfectly fine for that setting.  Cotton is also fairly lightweight and breathable.

review_title: Good buy, great fit, decent enough quality
review_body: These are a bargain! I wanted to wait to write a review until after I washed and dried them. After being washed and thrown in the dryer, they come out and look nice and seems like they didn't shrink much or at all. They might be ready to wear right out of the dryer, maybe touch them up a little with an iron. As far as fit, I am 6 ft. 2 in. or so and around 220 lbs. I bought the 38 waist and 34 length. The 34 length seems a little longer than other 34 length pants I own. The fit is definitely not a slim fit, pretty much straight and standard fit which I like. The material is not too bad, definitely not as nice as my $79 Eddie Bauer pants, but I'm sure I'll wear these once or twice a week for a couple of years and get my money's worth for sure. If you are looking for decent quality and an inexpensive option for work khakis, these are the ones.

Fit as expected, decent quality. Nothing too fancy like stain resistance or stretch waists, but those are more gimmicky than anything. If you're looking for a standard pair of dress pants, they'll work.

review_title: A TALE OF THREE CHINOS. ALL BOUGHT ON THE SAME DAY
review_body: I ordered and received 3 pairs of Chinos

These fit true to size or at least they do for me.  They are slightly smaller in the legs than lets say a pair of regular fit jeans.  So keep that is mind if you lift weights or do anything that builds leg muscles.  I use to cycle a lot so my thighs are slightly larger than if I did not do anything.  The length is spot on and the waist like I stated is true to fit.  I have washed mine a few times with no ill effects of shrinkage.  I like these and for $20, they are impossible to beat almost.

Lint Magnet. It is a shame this otherwise decent pair of pants becomes unwearable due to the dust, lint, animal hairs, etc that collect immediately on this fabric. Especially problematic on the black pants which hides nothing. Come on Amazon, spec a smoother fabric.!

review_title: A nice, clean pair of slacks that wash and wear perfectly
review_body: I have a problem - I've added an inch to my waistline. Sigh.
Very soft needed more hoodies for work love the metal zipper
Every year I buy a hoodie that is above the rest, I'm talking

These fit as I expect a XXL to fit. I wear XXL T-shirts and other clothing in that size. I'm 6' 225lbs with a bulky muscular build. Not a defined build :( Anyways for the price this is an awesome zip up hoodie. It looks very nice and is plenty affordable. Thanks!

After 2 washes the pull strings turned into a ratty mess.  This is a picture after the 5th wash.  The material is cheap and falls apart.  I will be cutting the strings off so it doesn't look so bad.  Also, the material is turning rough on the inside.

I like this hoodie and I will buy another one. I have reached an age where I no longer seem to have to buy clothes very often, so it has been a while since I bought one of these. I swear the Hanes ones are always better fitting than the competition. They make a nice standard hoodie at a great price. It has been a few years since I bought one of these and Hanes has changed them a bit. The gray was lighter than my old one and then inner lining is different. The lining is soft, nice to touch, and a bit linty. I do not recall my old one being as soft and linty, but I could be wrong. It definitely needs a wash and dry cycle to get the initial lintiness off. That is the only reason I would not give it 5 stars. I usually just wear Hanes black tees underneath these and lint is noticeable. I suspect that will eventually go away, but still I suspect Hanes could have produced it with less lint and simply choose not too. Still I like the hoodie and you should buy it.

I love this Hanes hoodie. The light blue color is so pretty & it is very soft & warm. The hood size is good & actually covers my whole head, unlike some others that are too small. I ordered the LARGE size because of the chest measurement, my chest is 44 inches. Of course, the sleeves are too long since it's a men's jacket & I'm a short female. 5'2" and 175-ish. Everything fits good except the sleeves. I'm going to wash it & hope it shrinks a little. Overall, I am very happy with this purchase & at $14 it was a great bargain. I will order another color in the MEDIUM & see if that fits better. Still I love it.

review_title: great for when he needs something a little lighter than ...
review_body: This was used for a San the skeleton costume and he actually wears it every day now. It's surprisingly thick and soft on the inside, great for when he needs something a little lighter than a coat. It doesn't get THAT cold in CA.

Bought this in men's size "small" for my son, who is 5'3" and weighs 114 lbs, waist is about 30" and this hoodie fits him PERFECTLY.  He LOVES it.  It won't fit him in a month, but it is unbelievably nice and a wonderful fit, for $10 and free Prime shipping... I feel like it's a total WIN.

Speaking as a female who prefers men’s hoodies, 5’4, 134 lbs, 36 “up top,”  usually wear a women’s Medium. I bought this to wear when it’s cold in the house or cool outside, like a sweater but I’d rather toss on a hoodie. I got a red size Small, and it fits perfectly though not a lot of extra roominess. I ordered another in my other favorite color, maroon, in a Medium for a more oversized fit when I want to layer it over something heavier,. I think the two of them will cover my needs perfectly.

review_title: Great hoodie at a great price.
review_body: I really love this hoodie. I bought this one for my fiancé and the women's one for me.  By far, I prefer this one to the Hanes women version of this hoodie. The fleece feels nicer and super soft on the inside. I also like that the strings kind of look like shoe laces/ropes rather than the typical knot at the end. I feel it's sturdier.

review_title: Levi's ain't what they used to be--by a long shot
review_body: I've worn Levi's for 50 years but since production was moved offshore the quality has gotten terrible. Used to be, their jeans would last a decade.  Now, with cheaper, thinner denim, I can't even get a year out of them. Today the belt loop on a pair I bought in July ripped off. No trauma. Not hooked on anything. The fabric just gave way. Over the past several years, I've noticed the fabric ripping at the rear pocket inside corners. When I bought these pairs I reinforced the fabric there, but this torn belt loop is the final straw. I'm moving on, Levi's. (Don't bother reaching out. This review stays as is.)

review_title: WEIGHT IS ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLOR, NOT THE STYLE
review_body: First of all, I'd like to congratulate the gentleman in the picture on his choice of footwear. Boat shoes never go out of style.

550's have a fundamental design problem with the belt loops that causes them to fail and rip out.  On 505 jeans the loops are anchored to a reinforced seam but in the 550's they are stitched into thin fabric above the seam and every pair I have own they have ripped out of .  If this were a car it would be a recall item .  It is a design flaw that does not appear in 505 style or Wrangler jeans

review_title: These Must Be Knock-Offs! I Call Bull@%!
review_body: I have heard in the past that jeans are a popular item for knock-off manufacturers, and so I believe I've been had. I have only worn them one day and they are so uncomfortable. They are suppose to be "relaxed fit" but fit like skinny jeans. My other pants this size fit comfortably, so it's not me! Also, the material is very thin. After reading other negative reviews, I can see that this material won't last very long, as I suspected. I'm going to go to a Levis outlet store and see if all of their quality is this bad. If they are not knock-offs, they must be factory seconds. These are nothing like other 550 relaxed fit Levis I've had, and I've been wearing them my whole life.

I ordered a few pairs of these jeans a few months back in a size 30x32 and they fit flawless for "cheap" work pants. I recently ordered another pair since I'm really starting to wear the old ones out. The pair I ordered matched identically to the ones I had before and they fit more like a 32x34. As much as I didn't want to go along with the 1 star bandwagon, I feel it is highly necessary. Levi's are not true to fit and are made with extremely low craftsmanship. If I pulled something similar at my job I'd get fired. I swear the jeans seem like they are made by children in a factory raking in $0.15 an hour. Worst way to spend $40 is on Levi jeans.

review_title: Raw Denim is best, if you can find it.
review_body: For all those that complain about the quality, What color did you buy?  I have learned the hard way that it color makes a big difference in quality.  Doing actual  a stone washing is expensive.  I think often they use a fabric that already looks stone washed.  It is often much lighter weight to make it feel softer to.  Some of the dark streaky ones are even worse.  Stick with the plain rinsed finish and wear it in naturally.

review_title: Black was more snug that same size 550 stonewashed blue, and a tad more costly, but they fit and were delivered to my door.
review_body: I don't know why the same model and size pant should fit differently, but this black pair of Levi Men's 550 Relaxed Fit Jean (36x32) fit much more snugly than the stonewashed blue pair of Levi Men's 550 Relaxed Fit Jeans (36x32) I purchased at the same time at Amazon.  Curiously, the pants came in different packages on different days.

review_title: Never buying again!  Levi's quality down the tubes
review_body: Update 5/25/17.  Amazon only giving me 80% of the cost of the levis.  Never buying them again if quality issue costs me after a few wears.

review_title: Fabric is thinner, will it hold up?
review_body: Levis, like most things, have changed. Since Levis has been historically reliable and our "go-to" jeans, we bought 3 new pairs. My partner does oil field work, so durable is appreciated. We last purchased Levis about a year ago, so we can compare "then" and "now". These jeans are definitely thinner than the other pairs we bought a year ago. Everything else looks the same. We're wondering if they are going to hold up, since other reviewers also noted that the jeans are thinner than previous editions. We bought these on Amazon after looking at the same product in the local department store which had them for $10 more. Products seem identical in every way, fabric thinner on both versions. Seems like we're going to have to find a new and different brand. End of an era, I'm afraid.

review_title: Correct sizes for once but still can't get right color sent
review_body: I don't have a close brick and mortar store so I'm stuck ordering online. Ordered 2 of these and much to my surprise, both pairs actually fit. Usually if I order 2 pairs of the same size, one is too big and the other too small. As with every online retailer I've tried, got sent medium stone wash instead of light stone wash. Not Amazon's fault though, Levi's uses the same item number for all their jeans of each style, light stone wash has the same item number as dark or medium, etc. Makes it hard for the warehouse to send out the correct color if they all have the same item number.

This shirt was defenitly a good buy, I use it mostly to go out sometimes to chill with friends and it is also nice to wear in familly gatterings. It is made out of a really good product, it's a pretty strong material and it is comfortable to wear.
Used as a top for my husbands Linda Belcher Costume, worked perfectly.

review_title: Good quality, good density, fits a little small but you're aware of that going in
review_body: Ok, I'm probably going to keep this one.  I've been trying different low priced Henley's, and have recently sent a couple back (I won't go into why), but these are reasonably high quality and reasonably heavy (about like a heavy duty T-shirt).  I rated the fit as "somewhat small", because I paid attention to what other reviewers had said in that regard, and I went ahead and ordered an extra large, where I usually get a large.  That seems to be the right call, as the extra large seems to fit comfortably (before washing), I'll update if there's any significant shrinkage later.  I checked the Hanes website, and it says all are 100% cotton except the Heather which is 75% ... so I ordered the green body with heather sleeves, and the tag says pretty close to what the website says ... the body is 100% cotton, while the sleeves are 60/40.  I'm still looking for a good thermal version of a Henley, if anyone has any suggestions, but I do like this one and I will be ordering more.

I bought this top for me. I like henley necklines but prefer men's shirts. I generally find women's tops too flimsy, clingy and mainly in horrid colours. I work in a farm with horses and prefer clothes that give me room for movement and are hard wearing. This top feels just the ticket and hope it will resist some bramble pruning.

I bought the Oxford Gray/Slate Heather in grey. I wear medium in virtually every shirt/jacket and when I got the shirt it fit great. But after a wash in cold, Knit/Low heat, it shrunk quite a bit, enough to be uncomfortable. I will try again with a Large this time.

Awesome shirt -- my new go-to long sleeve shirt. I'm an athletically-built 6'0" /170 lbs. (broader shoulders, narrower waist), and this shirt in a medium fits perfectly. It has plenty of room through the chest and shoulders yet is snug around the midsection for a nicer, slimming look. Also, the length is perfect for wearing untucked. It falls about halfway down the zipper on my pants. The cotton is definitely a heavy-weight cotton, and it feels very nice. The only thing I dislike is the contrasting fabric under the section of the shirt wear it buttons. On the black shirt, there is gray fabric that is visible unless you button all three buttons. Same with the navy blue shirt. It looks okay, but I'd prefer if it was just monochromatic. Overall, this is a fantastic shirt. Highly recommended.

Fit is excellent. I think these run true to size. My chest measures about 38" and a 32" waist. I chose a medium and this shirt fits perfectly. The material is not actually beefy to me. I just purchased some similar Dockers shirts that are beefy, but the Hanes is what I would call medium thick. Hope this description helps.

review_title: Poor seam allowances lead to early failure
review_body: I bought three of these and all of them have failed by separating under the armpit. I have always bought shirts to fit loosely as I find a loose fit far more comfortable and allows for an unrestricted full range of movement. (No Spandex for this kid) And I have never had shirts fail this way. The fabric is still more or less intact, but the seam allowances are so close that the stitching does not hold.

review_title: Good Quality for the Price - A Bit Large
review_body: For the price they are well constructed and seem to hold up well after washing. My only beef, pardon the pun, is that they run a bit large. Not a lot, mind you, but I am one of those guys whose size falls right at the large and medium border. Some things are perfect in the large size and some are perfect in medium. The fact that I prefer things a bit large makes these a keeper.

I have always liked long-sleeve T-shirts with buttons. Very versatile, useful, and comfortable. This Hanes Long-sleeve T-shirt is great for my daily casuals AND as a sleepwear. I primarily use this as a sleepwear because it is comfortable (75% cotton & 25% polyester). And when the elbow section wears out (creating a hole) then I just cut both sleeves above the elbow and use it as a workout t-shirt. Love the design and comfort. Recommended!
Under Armour has four different fit models:  Compression, Fitted, Regular and Loose.  These shirts are the Loose model.

Was excited when I saw this shirt on Prime day, and couldn’t wait to add this to my collection of UA Tech shirts that I use for the gym, and boxing. I have at least 13 of these in different colors, and was excited to finally add a black shirt to my collection. Upon opening he package I immediately noticed a difference. Material is super thin, stitching is rough, and fits differently to my other UA shirts. One thing I noticed is that my good shirts are made in Jordan, but this one is made in Nicaragua. Definitely sending back, and ordering straight from UA’s website.

This shirt was reasonably priced for an under armor shirt which are normally expensive. Its not a form fitting shirt but it fits true to size. Its great at wicking moisture, i mowed my yard in 100 degree heat and it stayed pretty much dry, although it was very windy that day. The shirt is extremely thin and lightweight. Im not sure how durable it will be but its a very comfortable shirt. I would recommended it as a lightweight summer shirt or workout shirt.
The shirt is very thin, perfect for the summer heat. Fits as expected. However mine does not have the green line on the sleeves, only the print is green. Keeping it anyway.

review_title: OK, need a breeze, and magnifies BO quite a bit, lol YIKES!!
review_body: These are expensive, but actually help a little if you can get a breeze. And one other thing, since it is a wicking type cloth, it will store under arm B.O. quite well, I had to apologize to a client when we had to lift a window in together. These shirts have a way of magnifying the fragrance to a much higher degree. May want to up the deodorant while wearing these.

review_title: The shirt I received is a nice color, fits as expected
review_body: Not convinced this is the shirt I got....more of a deep burgundy closet to the “raisin red” of the Siro line, but hard to say if the stock photo or the delivered product is wrong.

I bought this shirt and chose this color as a high visibility shirt for bike riding in Florida.  It's a very comfortable fabric for athletic activity -- nice ventilation (aspiration of sweat).  The shirt I received was made in Jordan and the fabric seems to hold its color well without "pilling", unlike some of the similar Under Armour shirts I have that were made in Vietnam.

I usually go with Nike’s dri-fit shirts for my exercise gear but I wanted to give Under Armour a try. What I noticed was the chest is a bit wider for these (Nike grips me a lil better) and also the length is about 1-1.5 inches shorter than the Nike brand im used to. When I lift my arms over my head I expose my stomach (6’ 2” 215lbs)  Overall a great shirt that im happy with but in the future i think I’ll stick to Nike

Not thick enough and shows chest hair (not just a little bit).  I read another reviewer state he bought 4 of these, and they were varying in quality.  I remember he said Tourmaline was good quality, but I preferred the Tuorqoise.  I wish I bought based on his recommendation, because the quality of the tuorqoise sucks, and the Under Armor label on it is cheap.

It is loose fit. I read the review and people said to get a size smaller. I end up getting 2 large my normal size and 1 medium.  The large fit nicely. The medium, I can fit in but it hug against the skin. Not too comfortable until I get back in shape. The fabric is on the breathable side but also a bit thin. I like it overall.

Don't know if these are authentic Levi's jeans but I surely bought it thinking they were. I had the exact same model, size, and color that I bought a year ago that ripped. Since I like it so much, I decided to buy me a new one and got them on the expected date, as usual, but then, when I tried them on, what a bummer; the pants were NOT the same size (36W x 32L, if that matter), even though it said so on the label. Either these are not authentic Levi's jeans or the quality is no longer on the list of things the company cares for. Perhaps a third option is that Amazon is selling parts that did not meet the Levi's Quality Check (if they still have such a thing), but then they are kind of overpriced, aren't they?

review_title: Fake Levi's.  These are a knock-off product!
review_body: I have a long history with this cut of Levi's, and this particular pair, made in Cambodia, are just a bit slimmer than the last pair that came from Mexico.  These are cheaply made pants without the characteristic orange stitching, sold under the Levi name and made out of lightweight denim.  The fabric is obviously thinner and woven less densely than the Levi's I grew up with and have come to expect, and I fear that they will wear out quickly.  I am glad that a worker in Cambodia has a job making clothing.  That seems reasonable to me.  I just wish that the "used-to-be" American company Levi Strauss would hold to their old standards, and when they contract out to the global market insist on fabrics that meet American standards.  At the very least, this product should be described as "levi's" with a lower case "L" and being of lightweight, and not middleweight, material!

I have worn Levis in some form for as long as I can remember but these were different. After about 2 weeks, bothe side rear belt looks broke off on the bottom stitching area, this is product defect a should be returnable, but they aren't and I am not happy with this. I would just sew it back on but as you can see there is nothing there to sew it to, it just shredded the spot it connects.

I bought 5 pairs of jeans in different colors but the same style (559 relaxed straight stretch) and the same size (36 x 36).  Out of those 5 pairs, no 2 had the same measurements.  The waist and inseam varied by as much as a couple inches in either direction.  One pair fir perfectly, so I kept it.  For the next 6 months, I wore that pair and a second pair of Levi's in a slightly different style that I bought in a store.  After about 6 months, each pair catastrophically failed when the material (not the seam) got a huge rip near the crotch.  I'm done with Levi's forever.

Jeans are only a couple months old and holes developed at the upper corners of the rear pockets resulting in a tear on one side. These jeans are toast only a couple months after purchasing. Pretty disappointing after having other pairs for well over a year with no problems.

review_title: Terrible, avoid buying Levi's jeans online. Go find them in store somewhere and try on EVERY PAIR.
review_body: I am flat out pissed at Levi's at this point. The SEVENTH pair of Levi's 559 jeans ordered from Amazon. Different colors, but even worse, DIFFERENT COUNTRIES OF ORIGIN. My goodness, the only pair that fit me half decently were the pair from Pakistan. They at least had a decent fit, look like relaxed straight leg jeans, and have a material very similar to denim. The rest... god the rest... the rest are just pure trash. A pair from Mexico that claim to be size 38 but fit like size 34's with super tight thighs and bell bottom like ends. A pair from Egypt that have an almost fake feel to the denim and an over sized waist with very tight calve sections. A pair from Vietnam that just don't fit at all due to a really weird 'poof' feel to the back side. I'm so fed up with this. What happened to this company? What happened to Levis making denim jeans for the everyday man and woman? Is your manufacturing process so scattered that you can't even pull together the same materials?? Or roughly the same measurements? I mean come on, how does a size 44 equal a size 38 but a size 38 equals a size 42? Bah hum bug is right, Levis should be ashamed that they are even offering jeans for sale online with this type of quality and manufacturing differences.

review_title: absolutely NOT the levis i know and love!
review_body: so i like my levis 559's very much. i order a few pairs a year. this last batch, CRAP. They immediately felt VERY thin, not the heavy and durable thick denim we expect from them. They felt like el cheepo mall jeans. i have had them for a few months now, and havent done anything with them other then wear them at work, (sales) and out to the bars, just normal everyday stuff! back of the crotch and butt, are BLOWING out. not ripping, they are literally separating into a thin sheet of cotton that at an given moment, show the WORLD more than i would like lol.

I have been exclusively wearing Levi's 559's for my denim for many years and I have always loved them. One thing that I didn't pay much attention too when ordering my most recent pair, is that it said "stretch" in the size. Stretchable jeans are new to me, but they are still comfortable. If you decide to go the stretch route, I suggest buying a size that is 1 size smaller than you typically wear, as these things are cut big.

I am wearing a pair of 559's that I bought a few years ago, it says 36x30 right on the outside leather label.  They fit fine, so I went ahead and ordered a similar style and sized (different color) pair of jeans.  They are too tight, and not just by a little, so I'm exchanging them.  I can accept I've put on weight, but whatever my current waist size, a pair that fits should be the same fit as the same style similarly sized.  Two stars.

review_title: Perfectly fine jean, but no consistency in what is shipped via Amazon
review_body: Placed two separate orders, reordering the first and got 2 different weight jeans as a result. The first order the jeans were great, good weight denim with slight stretch, really liked. So went back to the original order and reordered 2 more pairs. The next 2 pairs were a heavy denim, still a light stretch, but heavier denim and a bit looser fit overall. They make for a good work jean for a manual labor type job, but a bit heavier than what I would want for everyday. Amazon seems to have at least 2 SKUs in the same location and this was close enough for them. Will not order another pair via Amazon

review_title: No reason to spend more than twice as much on Dockers.
review_body: Wow! I had been paying about $50 for Dockers. Now, I can get the same fit, style and quality for only $20. I love it! They have deep pockets. Yes! They even have that little spare change sub-pocket in the right front pocket - although I don't really use it.

review_title: The pants are way too loose and the length is ...
review_body: The pants are way too loose and the length is not the 30" size I am used to. Too long.

review_title: Don't even get what you pay for
review_body: You're probably expecting me to say "you get what you pay for" but in this case you get even less than that. The material is heavy and thick, not at all like the common golf style you'd see with this kind of pant. The fit in the waist is too small, while the fit on the leg is too wide and too long. I cannot recommend anybody buy these pants.

review_title: One wash, it is all it took to destroy them.
review_body: Absolutely awful. Arrived wrinkled, after ironing they looked and felt OK, but after one wash they turned in to shriveled misshapen mess. I don't think ironing will fix them. Definitely does not stand up to "wrinkle free" title. Never had this happen to any other pants I own.

Great until they are washed. As a slender 6'1" guy, I was so happy to find someone who made 31 x 34 pants. I've always dealt  with  this  frustrating issue where I'm too big for off the rack, but too small for big and tall. These were great first,  however once washed, they fit weird. It seemed like the length was the only thing that shrunk, so they are oddly baggy while not quite long enough. I guess I'm just cursed to pay exorbitant prices for tailored pants that have to be dry cleaned.

review_title: A win for shoppers is a win.
review_body: This is a great product satisfies my expectations.  I didn't think much of buying clothing items online but the idea of providing "essentials" that are actually decent quality and appropriately priced is genius.  Accurate descriptions are critical and a full on no bones return policy is essential and Amazon meets the criteria well enough. I hope this program expands and thrives.

review_title: I would caution everyone not to buy this product until better testing can be done on this product
review_body: Label says it is 60/40 cotton/poly. In no way is there any polyester in this pants. Within 5-10 minutes of wearing the merchandise, everything starts to balloon and lose it's shape. The two pants I received are defective and possibly are intentionally meant to deceive the public.

I bought these for my boyfriend and they were an instant hit. He ordered his normal size and said they fit perfectly, not too tight or too loose. I like them because I iron his clothes every morning for him and these remain wrinkle free (hallelujah!!). Makes my life easier not having to iron him, makes his life easier because they fit great! Definitely a win, win!

review_title: Good pants for work.  Probably better as weekend pants.
review_body: I use these as work pants. They are soft and comfortable. They don't hold their shape as well as other more well known brands but they look good.  They fit a little loose like pants before skinny jeans became the norm.  I prefer this type of fit as my legs don't fit into skinny pants or some slim fit dress pants. I am 5"10 185lbs so I'm not a big guy.  Yet I feel like I'm shopping in the women's section when I try to find pants nowadays.

review_title: Remember you get what you pay for
review_body: I bought these on a whim when another pair of pants started wearing out. Mostly because they were cheap. And I learned (yet again) that you get what you pay for. These pants are perfectly fine but don't look particularly sharp and the material feels cheap. The pants feel awkwardly large especially if you are skinny guy. I would wear them on the weekends and maybe a Friday to work but they're really not that great.

This hoodie was even better than I had hoped for. After reading some of the reviews, I wasn't sure exactly what it would end up looking like. I ordered it in a men's small for my son and I was actually quite surprised how well it fit him. He's really thin at about 75 lbs (going on 13 and wears size 12 slim in boys clothing) and the men's small wasn't nearly as baggy on him as I expected it would be. At 75 lbs, he should be swimming in this hoodie, but it was a great fit. I personally wear a small in men's hoodies (medium in women's) and this one would be fairly fitted on me. So if you're a woman and looking to buy this, buy your normal size. Men I would suggest sizing up unless you prefer a more fitted hoodie.
Good quality for the price. Full-size hood on this mid-weight hoodie which is kind of rare these days.
It's rather thin, but I didn't expect soft thick fleece lining at this price. This will NOT keep you warm if you live in cold winter weather area, but for California winter, it works.

I've had this sweater for well over a year. Definitely a men's fit, narrower torso and larger sleeves (both around and slightly longer). Shed lint upon first wearing and now the inside is pilled after many many washes. Zipper isn't super smooth and the hoodie string is cheap. Good sized hood and the green I ordered was true to color and still is.

As far as plain black hoodies go, this one is fine. It keeps me warm in the cool Virginia fall and winter and is not bulky like most jackets. It stretches and is baggy in all the right places, so it is even comfortable to wear while driving a car. I normally need to take off my jacket or coat if I am driving. I have 2 very minor complaints. The first is that the hoodie could have been about an inch or two longer at the waist. It hits right at my belt. Anyone with a long torso might find it too short. The other complaint is that there seems to be a lot of extra thread at some of the seams. This isn't anything a pair of scissors can't take care of.

This is a nicely made and did fit but was a little tight for me for work.  This is a light weight Hoodie.  I have a single layer hoodie 4 years old that is still warmer than this,  At 40 degrees and a stiff breeze went right through the sleeves.  If you are looking for a light weight Hoodie this is it.  I needed it to be just a bit heavier.  I like to pull the sleeves up and nothing doing with this.  I gave it to my 17 yo granddaughter and it fit her just fine,  Was just a little big and she could pull the sleeves up past her elbow.  She loves it and wears it all day at school.

review_title: Mid-weight hoodie with no room to spare
review_body: Purchased and received a Large size hoodie.  It fits fine, although with no room to spare in chest and abdomen area.  I relatively slim with no gut; just comparing it with an older hoodie I'm replacing.  Sleeves are long enough.  Good weight material - would need additional layer(s) on a really cold day though.

Update, 12/18/17: just ordered a second one, my first failed because of my own error, got it caught in a grinder, yikes. It had some discoloration at the pockets but was still comfortable after 2 winters of use. My job is usually very hard on clothes, cotton shirts usually can only be worn 10-15x before throwing away. This jacket lasted 2 winters of 3x a week wear washing after each time worn.

I washed it in cold and it didn’t seem to bleed or shrink which is always the first issue but it’s also a light color so don’t take my word for the bleeding part.  So it didn’t shrink and it’s very soft, very comfy.  We live in FL and it gets cold in the house sometimes at night when we have the AC on 73, so we need a soft cozy yet thin hoodie to wear from time to time.  I wear it all the time and I’m ordering more colors and sizes for gifts.  I’ll also wear it outside during the 4 weeks that it gets a little chilly here in December or January.

Reliably made and expected fit. Sturdy metal zipper. Only downside is the cheap cord that runs through the hood...like a loosely wound shoelace. Even double-knotted it's thin enough to slip up into the opening in the hood.

review_title: Beware:  These jeans are of poor quality and are potentially knockoffs.  Don't expect more than 6 months of casual wear.
review_body: I ordered a pair of these Levi's relaxed fit mid-year in 2016 and they had a rip in the crotch area before the end of the year.  I then ordered another pair (same exact ones) in early 2017.  I wear these occasionally and don't use them as work pants (i.e. I am very easy on them). I use them for casual attire at work.  Yesterday, I had a belt loop pull out of the pants leaving a hole.  I read some of the recent reviews and I agree these jeans being sold on Amazon must be knockoffs.  Either that or the manufacturer has decided that quality is no longer important.  I grew up with Levis but these last two pairs I purchased from Amazon were of poor quality.  Be careful buying Levis off of Amazon.  I wouldn't spend more than about $20 a pair.  You probably get your moneys worth for that amount  but you will feel had if you spend more than that.  The last two pairs I purchased seem to last about 6 months with only occasional wear and washing.  Be prepared for that when you buy.

review_title: Just like Levi’s Used to Be.
review_body: I’ve never found the sizing chart in retail stores like I’ve found on Amazon. Usually I can’t find a 29” length.

review_title: Sizing is way off for these...
review_body: Advertised as 36x29 size, tags say 36x29 but they are actually 36x31.  I compared them to 8 other pairs and the legs are way longer than any of them.  They look nice but I have no clue why Levis has gotten so sloppy with their jeans in the past few years.  Maybe Trump will get them being made in the USA again and quality will go up.

review_title: Under NO circumstances buy jeans from Amazon
review_body: The first time I wore them the rear most belt loop became detached.  I wasn't happy but I sewed it back on.  After one laundering I bent over to tie my shoe (for the record these were fairly loose fitting on me) and the jeans tore from the seam below the zipper inward from seam down the middle of the leg for a tear of about 4 inches.  As I further examined them I could see that both back pockets were starting to tear a hole in the seat of the jeans where the pockets are stitched to the seat.

review_title: A little undersized but great selection, price and color options.
review_body: I know its risky buying clothes online and I have been exclusive with this size and style for some time but the pair I have on now are noticeably smaller in the waist than my others.  I took the labels off so can't return them but will try to others I bought on before I take the tags off.  I'm a little worried that after washing they won't fit at all.

review_title: like the upper thigh or just above the bottom cuffs
review_body: First off, they use vanity sizing, so if your waist measures 40", you should probably get the 38"

Buyer beware. After nearly three months the two pairs of 550 Levi jeans I purchased still smell like a petroleum product. I should have returned them but felt the smell would probably wash out. After at least 10 or more washes it has not. This leads me to believe these were not authentic Levi products. I've been buying Levis at least 30 years and never had this problem. Amazon should confirm the products stated on their website are authentic and come from valid sources... bummer!

review_title: Used to get more like 1. 5 to 2 years but that is ...
review_body: Don't know what the deal is with these. I have been buying these for years and every year they get a little crappier. I measure crappyness by life. I expect to get a year out of a pair of these - yes wearing them regularly, yes being hard on them. Used to get more like 1.5 to 2 years but that is steadily shrinking.

review_title: On to the next pair of levis in search for a pair that fits. These are not it.
review_body: way to small. Short and below the waist. Also way too tight. I have no complaints about the quality of levis, but it certainly is not the same as it used to be. I just hate the fact that all their jeans fit like shhhh now days. Can we get some normal fitting jeans please? I have tried 569, which fit like low rise bootcut for curvy women, 550, these ones that are the same but tighter in the legs and not bootcut, and 541, which are basically skinny jeans they identify as more roomy. I exchanged each one and will keep trying. My next pair is 505 and I suspect they may be the most decent ones for what I am looking for. I am willing to keep trying considering that I have tried wranglers that are even worse, carhartts that are ugly all around but fit good, and everything in between from condor tacticool pants, dickies, and riggs workwears too.

review_title: Levis 550 Jeans me and my budget well.
review_body: I was in the market for a pair of jeans considering that my current pairs of jeans a bit big for me.

For the price, a decent Henley but the medium is snug, and the cotton is thin. I also ordered a large in a different color  and that Henley is much too big. Odd, I am an 'off-the-rack' 40" shoulder, 170 lbs, 5'11". I guess I don't 'fit' with this brand. I usually order from higher priced mail order vendors, but 'everyone' seems to have gone over to the dark side and started using very thin, insubstantial, almost slippery (?) cotton for men's tees. Disappointing.

review_title: Had it fit better, it would have been a great shirt.
review_body: This one happens to be 100% cotton, and the large was awfully snug on me out of the bag.  With it being 100% cotton, I knew one wash would shrink it.  I bought a few sweatshirts with this order, all large, and this was the only snug and returned one.  I am 6' and 210 pounds. Had it fit, it would have been a great shirt.  I have not quite gotten around to reordering an extra large.  I may just look for a blend, and order a large.

review_title: The generous room in the "Beefy" sizing makes them extra comfortable. The muted color choices were right up my ...
review_body: Because of my build, wide shoulders with thin hips, I don't fit off the rack clothes very well but Henleys always do the trick. The generous room in the "Beefy" sizing makes them extra comfortable. The muted color choices were right up my alley. They go with slacks and a jacket, jeans and a v-neck sweater or even alone with a pair of "up-casual" shorts for an evening at the beach.

review_title: Hands Down Highest Quality Henley by Hanes
review_body: Man, it's hard to find a good henley, but this one is awesome. Most henleys seem to have one or more of the following issues: (a) material is too thin, (b) torso is too short / long, (c) the fit sucks, usually the sleeves are too short or I'm swimming in it or both. But this Hanes Henley rocks.
I like the shirt and fit but It is not 100% cotton.

The sleeves are long enough for men with long arms! My husband has really long arms, and these don't ride up on him. He's always shoving sleeves up because they usually don't fit him right, he's lanky. It's exciting to find shirts that he can wear when it's cold without being annoyed by short sleeves.

Pretty good quality shirt, moderately thick material and true to color. It was slightly too large for my husband (we ordered a large since that's normally what he wears), and there were some loose strings we had to trim, but it's held up to several washings and it is now his favorite shirt. Will be purchasing more in other colors and the correct size.

review_title: Great Cotton Feel With Teensy Flaw
review_body: Nice style, decent workmanship, great cotton feel. It has worn thin after half a dozen washings or so (it's 100% cotton) and has shrunk a teensy bit, but the nitpick I have is the alignment of the seams. The bottom of the shirt feels / looks ever so slightly twisted now after half a dozen wears/washes. But I'm being picky. You get what you pay for, and this shirt has a nice cotton feel and is a good shirt for the price, I'd recommend it (might get another in the spring).

My t-shirt and work jeans husband loves these. They are his "nice" shirts. He gets to wear a t-shirt without it looking like he's dressed for work. He is tall and slim. 6'4 180lb and the large fits well but cannot dry it or it would be too short. The XL fit in length but was way too wide.

These are great shirts.  I'm 6'1 and was thinking about getting the tall size but the regular XL fits perfectly.  The material is soft and warm, perfect for Fall weather.  I have washed them several times and they have held their shape and size.  After purchasing one, I ordered three more in different colors.

review_title: Globalized production product quality assurance and designFAIL.
review_body: So, as with everything I order more than once, the product inconsistencies are what stand out most. It's ALMOST the proper size(the torso fit IS smaller), and the material is different and LESS SOFT than the first order, and the neck finishing and neck hole are BAD. The finished neck is VERY thin, not at all crew, which is what I was expecting. And the neck hole is MUCH bigger than my first order which fit perfectly.  I note that the first shirt was made in Jordan and the second in Nicaragua.  Global product quality assurance is a FAIL.  Hope UA straightens out the problems before I go elsewhere.
This shirt is perfect except for the collar doesn't stretch like the Nike Dri-Fit shirts do. Pretty strange, but will continue to buy for some activities. An elastic neckband would make it perfect.

review_title: they were of great quality and I especially liked the fit as UA ...
review_body: For years, I wore nothing but these UA Tech T-shirts for my workouts. In the past, they were of great quality and I especially liked the fit as UA seemed to cater towards those with a more muscular physique. In recent years, their quality has significantly dropped and their sizing has become absolutely atrocious. I'm a medium in just about all other brands but a medium UA Tech T-shirt was too short in the torso, way too wide in the torso, and too tight in the shoulders and arms. If you're 5'5" with a huge beer belly and noodle arms, these in medium will fit you great.

review_title: No surprises, a VERY  good thing.
review_body: I'm somewhat surprised it didn't shrink more than it did!  I've noticed the "UA" products tend to last longer as well, and it feels good.  Beware of the differences between anything branded "Under Armor" vs. "UA"...even if the former are legit and actually made by Under Armor, they're best used as rags after being washed once.  But this shirt I'd buy again.

I have many of these shirts and needed another one. I noticed all of mine were black or grey. I ordered a light blue one and a white one. These shirts are all I wear when I workout. They are light, breath very well, and comfortable. Sometimes you pay for what you get. Especially if they are on sale like these.

quality has dropped.  I will not be purchasing tech shirts going forward.  this is my 10th under armour tech shirt.  They have changed the sizing on the medium and the material itself is now so thin its transparent.  I have also notice under armour quality has dropped on their cold gear shirts and I will not be purchasing those anymore as well.  Has this happened to anyone else?

review_title: UnderArmour products seem to be different everytime I get one
review_body: These aren't like the shirts I ordered in the past. The fit is off and they feel more plasticky. If I could order again I'd get the  charged cotton ones, I prefer those in terms of fit and function but it looks like they are phasing those out as well. I'm quickly becoming a not-fan of underarmour for basic gym and underwear uses.

Not your normal under armour shirt, nearly see through! Was highly disappointed as I’ve gotten several of this exact shirt and this one was the only thin one. Selling poor quality but saying it’s standard. Bad business

These are my newest favorite shirts. So comfortable and they will not wrinkle. Keeps active people dry in the hot weather and Underarmor gives employment to the wonderful people of Maryland. Great company that gives back to the community.

Excellent product, I use for running in approx 50-65F depending on strength of sunlight and wind. Feels good even when sweaty. Wicks better than some others I have tried and stays cooler. I could use for general t-shirt, too, as it's that good. Wished I'd ordered a couple more. Good bang for the buck. Very comfortable, loose but not too lose, perfect to size for me -- XL was fine for me. I usually run between XL and a XXL, at 5'10"x205#

review_title: What the hell Levi's??? I buy three ...
review_body: What the hell Levi's???  I buy three pairs of these jeans and all three fit differently even though they are all the same size. One was loose, the other one was just right and the last pair I could barely get on!  It's apparent that all of these jeans are made in third-world countries for pennies. You would think Levi's would spend just a little money on quality control to maintain some level of consistency.  Yet another example of corporate greed!!!

review_title: Sizing not consistent between color options, shrinks a lot after first wash.
review_body: I'm rating these 3 out of 5, as I had 2 major issues that resulted in me not being totally satisfied.

review_title: Nice pants, but tighter fit than in the store.
review_body: 4 Stars. Shipping was prompt, pants were well constructed, nicely packaged and in new condition. Buying pants off the internet can be tricky for fit. And so it goes. I recently purchased a pair of 559 denims from a brick and mortar store in the same size as I ordered here. They fit great. Not too loose, not too tight and a comfortable relaxed straight leg construction. I wanted a comfy summer khaki colored jean to offset the blue jeans and cargo shorts, so I thought I'd knock it out of the park with these. For reference, if these are denim, they are a particularly light weight/thin denim (which is fine, they are meant for summer wear so lighter isnt bad imo), yet not quite the sort of classic chinos twill pant light weight. Most notably however, they run tighter than the jeans i bought 20 days ago in the store. Maybe they are supposed to be more form fitting, but if the site model is an indicator these are too tight (not even room for speculation). I've sent them back anticipating ordering a waist size larger. Hope this helps.

review_title: So there is some man-made spandex like material in these pants - something like only 3-5% ...
review_body: Spandex...ugh.  So there is some man-made spandex like material in these pants - something like only 3-5% but enough to make this feel weird compared to the 100% cotton previous versions of the 559.  Kinda ticks me off as this was my go to Levi's model and now that stupid spandex feel is across all their jean models practically.  Feels like you're wearing Mom pants.  I may need to find another brand after decades of being a dedicated Levi's wearer..they keep messing with what works and going the wrong way with cheaper feel and wear.

review_title: I had a pair of 505s and even if I bought them 2-3 sizes larger in the waist I still couldn't get them comfortably on my legs
review_body: These are the only style that Levi's makes anymore that will fit a guy that doesn't have toothpicks for legs. You still might need to buy the next waist size larger (if you have larger legs or are athletic), but at least you can actually get these jeans on. I had a pair of 505s and even if I bought them 2-3 sizes larger in the waist I still couldn't get them comfortably on my legs. These fit as expected, and they look good. Be careful, however, because some of the washes are actually not 100% cotton. This wash is a 100% cotton wash.

This is the 3rd pair in a row that I've had the belt loops break on within a month plus the back pocket ripped at the corner within 2 months. Not sure if these are some knockoff brand or something. Going to try the actual Levis store next I guess since these are the only comfortable pair of jeans I've found over the last few years. So infuriating!
Update 4/2017

My husband bought these jeans in store a few years ago and he finally has worn them out. He wore them ALL the time, saying they are his most comfortable fitting jeans. The loops finally started to come loose and he wore out the edges on the pockets so I bought these exact same ones online (for less than I remember it being in store).

I also just assumed the model number will get me the exact same fit and fabric as the 559 I already had. It didn't, or at least not for one of two pairs I bought recently. For me, general sizes were accurate, but I had no idea some color choices change the fabric. The online color choices themselves bugged me too (I just wanted whatever standard "blue" I had before, but the old tag doesn't tell you what option you're wearing, and it's difficult figuring out several blue colors online that all look the same to me).

review_title: Foreign Made looses the original Levi quality
review_body: The Fit was good. The chart for the overall Levi's below showing various styles said that they sit at the waist, but when they arrived, the information stated that they sit below the waist; one reason that I did not choose Levi's 569 was that they stated (up front) that they sit below the waist. They were lighter weight denim, similar to Levi's "Signature" series, but twice the price. I laundered them as instructed on the tag (cold water), but when they came out of the dryer, the color was uneven, lightly striped at the front pockets and faded spots on the back pockets (it appears that the material was not dyed sufficiently or the dye bath was diluted). I read some of the other negative comments, but I will keep them as a reminder, even though they are not suitable for wearing in public.

review_title: Perfect. I have a small waist and long legs
review_body: Perfect. I have a small waist and long legs. When buying pants online I usually buy two pairs of the same pants in the same size and color because although pants from the same make in the same size and style are marked identically, they almost never fit identically - I usually keep the one out of the two that fits the best and send the one that doesn’t fit right back. I ordered two pairs of these pants and they both fit identically. Great job Amazon!! Buying a lot more of these!

review_title: The only things I would point out in these are that the button hole above the fly is not quite cut enough for the button to easily be undone (although this may be a good thing ...
review_body: Honestly, I would give this four and a half stars if it were possible. It fits true to size and there are no major issues with the pants. The only things I would point out in these are that the button hole above the fly is not quite cut enough for the button to easily be undone (although this may be a good thing for some) and the stitching on the inside right pocket was done awkwardly. What I mean is that when the pocket was sewn, it was not flipped right outside out before the final seam was stitched. As such, there is a part of the fabric that is inside the pocket. Neither issues are noticeable nor detract from the pants. They are definitely worth the buy if you are looking for a pair for relatively cheap.

It does say in the description that these do have a little more 'room' in the thigh area.  Truth be told though these are a little baggy and they are pleated way more than the picture shows.  The slight bagginess I can be OK with but the well defined pleate... NO

I buy and go through a lot of slacks - and my favorites (a la Tom Wolfe, are white or whitish.) I thought I would give a pair of these Amazon Essentials a try - and I am quite pleased. They are lightweight and perma-press (60% cotton and 40% poly) and fit precisely right! I am a 34 X 30 - and so are these pants. Really nice for these summer months - and really sharp looking, whether worn with a jacket or an untucked Hawaiian shirt!

review_title: Inseam was wrong. Not 29 as on package.
review_body: The waist size great  The inseam was not 29 as on package.
Well, i wasn't expecting too much from these. And that's what i got.

I was so excited to find out Amazon made khakis but man was I disappointed. While they fit perfectly in the waist and are the correct length these pants fit like a trash bag. They are so baggy it is actually ridiculous. I needed these pants to wear at work in an office. These pants are seemingly made for East LA cholo gangsters or something. Seriously odd cut to them. Then I tried to get a refund and they said ok, but then UPS never picked them up and I am stuck with these ridiculous pants.

review_title: They work. More like jeans than dress pants.
review_body: After washing them twice they already started to shrink noticeable.

review_title: The construction and look of the pants were both great! The problem was the size of the legs
review_body: The construction and look of the pants were both great!  The problem was the size of the legs.  They look waaaaayyyy too baggy and I'm a bigger guy too. If they released these same pants in a "slim fit" leg, I'd definitely be a customer.

I purchased these for day-to-day dress for the office. At $20, they're 1/3 the cost of -- as far as I can tell -- identical pants found at a department store. I'm not particularly fashion conscious so take that how you will, but I do look for workmanship and quality material even if fashion is not at the top of my list. To this end, the stitching is uniform along the waist, inseam and cuff. Belt loops are sturdy, zippers lay flat and when folded, the material is evenly sewn. Material is good and of decent weight (i.e., it's not some see-through material like that found on cheaper polyester pants).

review_title: Good for the price but fabric is my issue
review_body: Good for the price but fabric is my issue. It's impossible to find 100% cotton hoodies anymore. Some have different sections with different fabric blends/combinations. (Hood liner , front top layer , sleeve collars , etc.) Synthetics have taken over. Sad truth. $100+ for a "cotton" (100%) Zip up hooded sweatshirt if you can find one. Very few sizes and colors. Cheaper to use synthetic fabric. Many people are allergic to synthetics and/ or overheat in them. (Not an issue of wet/dry)

This hoodie was exactly what I was looking for. A hoodie that was not so heavy but not too light if there is some brisk wind. I usually sweat a lot whenever I have a regular sweater on because of how thick they come. I needed something like this. I love how the sleeves are perfect in length as well. I'm on the short side of 5'7 so usually sleeves go over my wrist like some goth kid but these a great. They stay on my wrist and don't slide up and down. My only negative was the factory clothing smell. It was STRONG when I took it out the plastic wrap. I had to febreze it a couple of times to knock out the smell.

review_title: Amazon saved the day and oh yea, this is a dope classic hoodie! Nice!
review_body: This hoodie runs true to size. It is a very soft and comfortable hoodie! The interior of the hoodie is a nice light fleece. It isn't a heavy fleece so it won't keep you warm in very cold weather but it will do the job for chilly to cold weather (about 38/40 degrees and warmer). It works wonders with a nice thermal underneath, though (if you want to wear it in colder weather). I don't know how well the color holds up because I bought the light grey hoodie (hard to imagine light grey fading into anything but light-er grey) but the light grey looks exactly as it did in the picture advertising it.

Very soft, it is exactly what it seems. Plain zip up sweater. Warm but not too warm, great for spring and summer nights. I am a 5'4 female who is usually a L/XL and the large fit very well with just the right about of baginess. Inside is soft but not super thick. Just what I was looking for.

My fiancé absolutely loves this hoodie that we bought for him. As per his request, I was on the search for a PLAIN (when I say plain, I mean very plain with no bells or whistles, no colored zipper or drawstring) and you would actually be surprised how difficult it is to find a simple plain black hoodie. After ordering, we were a bit worried about sizing as we always are when ordering anything for him online, but when he whipped it out of the box to try it on we were ecstatic that it fit not only well, but perfectly. It is also surprisingly warm to be so lightweight and the fleece lining makes it super comfy. Will order again!

review_title: It's a good get by jacket for around house or outside
review_body: It's a good get by jacket for around house or outside. No matter  how many times you wash and dry it, the fleece continuously  comes out on to your clothes. Can't wear it out in public if you want to lint roller your self to death every 5 min. Again you get what you pay for. I recommend  Addidas  hoodies yes it's a little more expensive  but it's the best. I've been wearing  them for 20 plus years and have proven to my self to not settle for less.

If it cost any more, I would have given this 3 stars. This is a super generic hoodie with the type of build quality I would expect from a package of plain white under t-shirts. Nothing really wrong with it, just nothing really right with it. On the positive side, it's nice and light which is what I was hoping for since I live around Phoenix, AZ and I got it for our balmy 50 degree evenings.

The most comfortable jacket ever! The inside is a soft and warm fleece lining and the outside is a regular cotton shell. The inside feel is very soft and comfortable on the skin. It also looks great on, is just the right size and is available is a good option of colors.m

Loved this hoodie. My expectations weren't too high for just a cheap Hanes product but this fall I'll probably pick up one or two more in different colors. The fabric is somewhat lightweight so if you're looking for a really heavy sweatshirt this one may disappoint you. For me it's cozy and perfect.

Bought this in XL and it shrunk. I am 6'2, 217 lbs and this hoodie definitely did not fit after the wash. I did give it three stars though because my girlfriend took it after it shrunk and wears it all the time.

review_title: Quality not what it used to be
review_body: Been buying these for decades.  Material quality has gone downhill more recently. They just don't stay new-looking as long as they used to.

I've been buying this same size and type for years.  As long as they keep making them, they'll continue to fit, and I'll continue to buy them.  There's never any need for me to try them on because I already know what I'm getting.  I have the same kind of confidence when buying boots online.

This pair of 550 Relaxed Fit Jeans evidenced poor workmanship. One of the belt loops broke free (the stitch seems good, but the fabric gave way leaving a hole where the stich should be). Also a hole showed up at the corner of a rear pocket near another stitch. Something is not right with the fabric on this pair...it is weaker and prone to tearing. Tearing is not something I would expect from new(ish) Levis. None of my other levis have had these problems, causing me to wonder if the pair I purchased off of Amazon were conterefeit. In any case, these certainly did not weather ordinary use durably as one might expect of Levis. This pair is simply falling apart for no good reason. I am now reluctant to make future Levis purchases at Amazon and am more likely to get them at a department store where I am less likely to get a conterfeit product and have a store to complain to if the product does not meet expectation.

review_title: Exactly the fit and cut I expected.  Not quite the quality
review_body: This review is going to be very similar in form and fashion to my 560's review.  Levi's denim pants fit the way I expect them to. Always have, always will.  I've been consistently able to run into a retail shop, and pick up a pair of these, by cut and size, swipe my card, and leave the store in under 5 minutes.  They fit as expected, they feel as expected.  Praises Sung.

I struggle to find Mr. MVP blue jeans. He is 6 feet tall and has a (sorry my love) bubble butt and big thighs that come with running and biking. We tried the athletic fit Levi's and those were okay, but they fit too much like skinny jeans which on his body type just does not look right.

review_title: Not lasting, and will not buy again
review_body: Got these five months ago, and crotch ripped not at seam but material is worn through.  I ordered another pair, I hope I am not buying Knock off's or something.  Just use for work and work a sales floor, so not rough on them, hardly get dirty at all.  Seems like this should not have happened.  Not happy, we will see what happens with the new pair and will update.  Other than the rip they look like new, touch more faded but that is normal.

review_title: Dark Blue are very thin not the same material as the Black and made very cheaply
review_body: Material is very thin, pants are made very cheap Levi's Red Back Pocket tag has a (R) not Levi's I do not expect these to last.

Sad to say I have to agree with the other low reviews of levi's.  It is extremely hard to find the length I need for my waste size and thought these would be a great pair of jeans, after all they are levi's.  But as others have stated, the material is extremely thin and not what I expect from levis.  They do not "stay up" and have to be pulled up frequently.  This has resulted, due do thin material and poor craftsmanship, of both side belt loops seperating from the jeans.  I do alot of knealing in my line of work and the right knee is nearly thread bare. Holes have worn in both back pockets and the inside of the left front pocket has become unsewn.  It is not just with the 550 style it is for the two pair of 501's I purchased at about the same time.  Don't know about you, but this is my last levi jeans.  I would recommend Carhartt traditional jeans if you like a pair of jeans that will hold up longer than a few months in working conditions.  I have a few pair of these I purchased two years ago, although faded, they are still holding up and have no holes worn in them

I've been wearing Levis for as long as I can remember and that all stops with this last pair of jeans.  The a-holes at Levis thought they would be smart and make the thickness thinner (at least by half) and still charge the same price.  Although I like the cut of these jeans I don't see myself buying another pair of anything Levis.  Think I'm kidding, take an old pair of Levis if you have them and compare.  I did and there's no comparison.  The denim of Levis new jeans is comparable to the $12-14 pair of jeans you can buy from Old Navy. If you like Levis for previous years, don't be fooled by these.  They are nowhere near the same. I would return these.because $40 is about $28 too much for this quality but I needed a pair to replace another pair for trip and didn't have time to find an alternate brand.

I am very disappointed in the jeans I received. I love levi'so but the last 2 pair I received from amazon were defective, in the same place. The right rear pocket tore right on theach inside corner, wear they attach to the pants. Then I went to pull them up by the belt loop, I didn't have my belt on yet and they are loose around the waste, and the belt loop tore free from the bottom, where they attach to the pants.  Granted I have had these for a few months but I live in So California, and I wear shorts most of the time.  I only wear pants if I have to.  I don't know if it was a shipment that Amazon received but two pair, torn in the exact same place? I don't believe in coincidence.

I was really hoping I was going to like this T-shirt, for the style looks really good. I find that it’s even exceeding my expectations for it well-made and fits well. It’s a good casual yet good looking longsleeved T-shirt. Good for lounging around the home or even going out to a casual dinner. (Two-tone gray-green reviewed)

review_title: The Price Is Incredible. The Quality And Fit Are Not Great
review_body: is a good value shirt given it's low price, but here is my full review of what you are going to get:

review_title: Orderered three, liked the heather best.
review_body: These Henley's are not cheaply made despite the price.  The hand of the material is smooth and feels like maybe a light flannel.  The weight is nice, about halfway between a sweat and a T, leaning more toward the T.Fit well out of the package and after washing but I have a hunch there was maybe a little shrinkage, say 5%.  I usually prefer all cotton but the poly ratio in these shirts was fine.  They breathe fine and are comfortable in the heat.

Great look and good material, though did run a little bit smaller than I had anticipated. I am an athletic build 5'8" 180lb and the medium fits pretty snug through the arm pits. I would go with a L next time as it doesnt run long in length, so would not be down to your thighs like most larges do now a days

review_title: The one negative I have is that it smelled horrible. I left the sweater in my car over ...
review_body: This sweater is a lot thicker than I anticipated. I thought it would be more light weight. I bought the blue sweater and it is exactly that color. The one negative I have is that it smelled horrible. I left the sweater in my car over night and it permiated the car for two days. It had a sour smell. Unpleasant. But it's decent  overall.

I wear Henley shirts all the time around the house.  I've been buying more expensive brands for several years but thought I would try these Hanes shirts.  I've been very impressed.  They'll all cotton, the only fabric I like.  They fit well and feel good.  I like the contrasting color on the button edging and the price was certainly right.  I've purchased four already and plan to purchase more.
PROS: Soft comfortable material, good fit

Have a number of the Hanes Beefy-Ts and this one isn't what I'd call worthy of the BeefyT name.  It's just ok as a henley goes and is comfortable, but if you're looking for that Beefy-T feel you won't find it here.  Can only wonder how thick  the non Beefy T-shirts are??  I ordered 3 different Hanes Beefy-T henleys and all three are the same.

review_title: Dont size up (at least not in the aqua color)
review_body: The price is right, however this does not run small, at least in the aqua size 2xl. It is a 2xl, however I needed a 1xl and read that it ran small. No worries, i ordered 1 to check the fit and ill keep it as a gift for someone else. I suggest ordering in the person's actual size. And I won't fault the product, perhaps the reviewers had a different experience.

review_title: No good for the middle age man with a belly
review_body: The shirt fits well but after you wash it, it get short and my belly hangs out because I am 50

review_title: if you like soaking wet cotton shirts then these are for you
review_body: I bought 3 of these tech short sleeve shirts for the gym.  After 30 minutes, if you like soaking wet cotton shirts then these are for you.  These are extremely disappointing compared to previous Under Armour shirts.  These shirts get saturated and stay wet.  They  never feel like the moisture is wicking away.  Will only given 1 star as I will never buy them again.  HBCotlerMD

review_title: ... loose on the stomach area for a big guy like me. the only drawback for me is the ...
review_body: shirt fit well and is loose on the stomach area for a big guy like me. the only drawback for me is the neck is really loose which I don't like, I like for the neck on a shirt to be nice and snug as to not show off chest hair lol

review_title: Great performance shirt, beware the wicking
review_body: Slight problem with wicking after a few washes but I would marry this line of clothing. Its sexy as hell. Feels great after a work out to slip into this shirt all fresh and showered then go to work. I work in a creative studio and its like being naked but without the lawsuits. If they could get the wicking aftwr a few washes down Id be happy.

These are my go-to around the house, layering, or working out shirts. I'm 6'2", about 260 lbs, and the xxl's fit me. Recently they've been cut slightly longer which has been a welcome change because the first shirt I bought was borderline long enough. Highly recommended these shirts!

review_title: A little too snug for me...read on
review_body: No complaints with the shirt quality. I read where UA had made certain shirts a little more "roomy" and went with it. BUT......XXLT is fine for workouts or under another shirt as a base but as a t-shirt with shorts, too snug for me. Just my opinion.....your mileage may very.

Bought this shirt for hiking and was very pleased with the quality of the shirt.  Ive owned several under armour products that have lasted me almost fifteen years, just time to update them.  The durability in the brush is not great which you shouldnt honestly expect from a light polyester shirt anyways but that was the only drawback I've come across.

Shirt is very comfortable with the exception of a tag on the inside of the shirt below the ribs.  Very annoying tag in my opinion.  Other than that the shirt is a good quality sweat wicking type shirt.  Feels good to wear on a hot day

The material was nice but the shirt was too large. I purchased a large and an extra large and to my dismay neither one fit properly. The large was tight and the extra large was too big. Additionally, the shirts are a little too short. Years ago I purchased other Under Armour shirts and they fit perfectly and I still have the same measurements. I found other shirts (Vapor Apparel) that are sold by Amazon that fit much better and feel good.  The Vapor Apparel shirts are long sleeve, made of lightweight material and offer sun protection.

review_title: Low quality, fit and fabric are awkward.  Returned.
review_body: The quality of these under armour tech shirts is so low compared to how they used to be.  The fabric almost feels like silk.  The collar area is rigid and tight on the neck.  Overall fit is awkward, especially in the shoulders.  Not sure I can ever buy another UA shirt without seeing it in person beforehand.  Based on other UA purchases, quality and sizing are highly inconsistent.

This shirt is great for running, but as it says, it is a loose cut. In my case, I had to return the small and order an extra small from somewhere else as amazon does not sell that size. Overall it is a good shirt, but be aware that it is quite loose.

review_title: The fit is to put it in the words of ...
review_body: The fit is to put it in the words of my wife, "old man pants".  Which just means it was very baggy in the wrong places.
