Compared to other pants purchased that are regular fit, it appeared too lose.  However the fit with regards to size appeared to be accurate as the waist and length was correct, just the style appeared outdated.  To be clear, I'm not comparing the fit to "slim fit" type styles.  I'm comparing to regular fit as I had ordered these for work.  We have business casual but wear ties, no coat or jacket.  I'm hopeful this will be updated as the price is very economical and I purchase these with the attitude it's a uniform.

I bought this pants because of the attractive price but mainly because it was labeled as an "Amazon Essential" Seeing that I have been a member of this site for years now, when Amazon recommends a products I should trust them, right? When I received the pants, it did not seem like a new pair to me as it was literally a lint magnet. It had lint when I took it from its packaging and even after I used a lint remover AND  scotch tape on the entire pants to remove the lint, it still attracted it. I was so disappointed with this purchase, as I consider it a waste of money.

Let me start out by stating that I'm extremely picky about clothes (fit and comfort).  That being said, these pants were perfect.  They fit well, there's lots of room in the pant legs (not baggy) which is great for a bodybuilder type like me, and they're extremely comfortable.  I feel like they might run exactly one size too small, but I also have wide hips.  But that being said, I'm still happy with the size I bought and am happy to have these in my wardrobe.  Oh, they look very good, too.

review_title: They are super wide everywhere else
review_body: These pants fit well enough.  I was surprised that the waist was a little smaller than I expected.  I'm usually a size 33 waist, and these at a 34 are a little tight, but not overly so.  They are super wide everywhere else, making them look a little baggier than I would like.  I guess for the price they are good, but I wouldn't call them the most stylish.  Still, they seem well constructed using thick material and solid seams.  The material doesn't exactly feel premium either, but again it's appropriate for the price.  For work pants, they will work fine, but for a night out, I'll be using different pants.
Ordered 36 x 34. Waist was fine. Length was about 31.
I know that not everyone has the same experience with every product. I'm only writing about my experience.

Did not fit as expected.  Sizes are WAY off and the cut is pretty sloppy.  This is probably good for someone who is just beginning buying work clothes, but not for people who want to look very professional.

The pants were great but I ordered them much to large. I asked to return them and was told ok. I waited and waited for a return label only to find out the day before the return deadline that I was responsible for printing it out. I don't have a printer and could not access one in time. Pretty pissed off that I could not exchange or return them. We don't have the money to throw away. I wish I was told my responsibilities in regard to the return without having to investigate it. Eventually I did and it was too late.

review_title: Waste of time to order pants on Amazon
review_body: The label was wrong. They were  4 inches too long. This is the second time I have ordered pants and the size was totally wrong. It's really quite a pain…
The material is good but the fitting is pretty loose. The trousers look like baggy pants with wide bottom. I wish the fitting were a bit slimmer.

review_title: Baggy like a little kid in daddy’s jeans.
review_body: At first I kinda liked it being a little loose, but facts are facts. These came way too baggy and big. The waist feels likes it’s mutliple sizes too big as well as the length and the width of the thigh area and legs. I feel like a little kid in them and the only way the bottom ankle area doesn’t get stepped on by my heel is if I wear them with boots. I wanted to go a little more relaxed and enjoy the elasticity of these jeans because I’m 37 now; I’m not a fat guy, but not being a gym rat I need a flexibility for weight and comfort. I did not get that with these jeans. In fact I feel like there was no elasticity in them at all like pairs I’ve purchaced in the past of the 559 variety. So disappointed that I basically threw money away.

review_title: Not real USA Levi's. Made in/for South America!
review_body: These aren't U.S. made Levi's. They're made in Lesotho. Levi's de Mexico and Levi's de Brazil.

What happened to the 559s? Now they are SKIN TIGHT. I used to always buy this fit. Did they change factories? I bought 2 pair. Carry On and Wellington. Both are COMPLETELY different. The carry ons (made in mexico) are way darker than pictured are are thick as cardboard. They fit extremely tight and are an inch longer than ordered. Also, there are visible tag holes on the rear of the jeans. The Wellingtons (made in bangledesh) are EXTEMELY thin. I mean like Hanes undershirt thin. The length is about 3 inches longer than ordered. It seems that the pants are also sewn crooked as the leg seam angles instead of going straight down. Sad day in jeans land. My favorite fit just tanked.

review_title: If you want to raise your voice three octaves, buy these...
review_body: Somewhere along the line some idiot at Levi's decided every pair of jeans they make needs a low-cut waste.  They're also supposedly "relaxed fit", but they're not even close, not like they used to be anyway.  I'm 6'2", a 36 inch waist, and a runner.  I can barely pull these things down to take a crap because the legs are sooo skinny.

review_title: My favorite casusal pants and worth
review_body: Although noticeably larger than expected for 569, requiring a reduction in waist size of 2 for proper fitment, these pants have exceeded expectations in three years of usage.  I ordered some from Levi's website in late 2011 and ordered up a few more pairs last summer from Amazon and the difference in quality, durability, and fade is imperceptible when adjusted for age.  These pants do, and always, run large in my experience regardless of where purchased.  Despite the light-weight denim they are a trusted and favorite jean.

review_title: The fit is so large that I cannot even wear ...
review_body: The fit is so large that I cannot even wear it.  I originally bought a pair that was my usual fit for ALL OTHER PANTS, and it was too short.  So I bought a pair that was the next higher length.  The new pair is much bigger in the waist even though the size number did not change.

review_title: a little bit of stretch is too much
review_body: Can't decide between 2 and 3 stars.  When I put these on, they were perfect -- snug enough to fit without being tight.  So I wore them to work in the morning and by the time I was walking a mile from my parking spot to the Monday Night (7:30 pm) Football game that night, they really felt baggy.  These jeans have just a little bit of stretch in them, but that little bit of stretch was too much.  I will buy the same size and style again, but only the 100% cotton/denim ones, not this version.  I'll wear this pair again, but I will wash them in hot water hereafter.

review_title: Blue Collar wash is a little off from picture and denim is on the thinner side
review_body: The 559 is nice and roomy through the thighs, which, despite having what I would call pretty standard-bordering-on-skinny-ish thighs, is something I find a problem with with some other Levi's styles. These are definitely "relaxed fit", very casual, so be sure that's what you want. I don't want to focus too much on the specifics of the style, because I think that depends mostly on trying on the jeans and checking out yourself in a mirror. So, I'm going to write about what I find helpful - does the wash of the jeans look like the picture? and what does the fabric feel like? (because if you've looked at Levi's before you know the denim ranges from pretty thin to very chunky). So, the wash in the picture is not exactly representative of what I received - the two pairs I got aren't as dark as the dark areas in the picture and the light areas aren't as light. So, overall, a little less contrast and a little lighter blue than the picture. They come off a little more Dad-ish than I had hoped, but not overly so (plus, I'm a Dad, so I guess the shoe fits). The denim is definitely one of the thinner variations I've seen on the 559. Personally, I prefer the thinner denim for the added flexibility/comfort, but, in my experience at least, the thinner denim wears out a bit quicker.  Overall, I think this is a nice wash, but I would have preferred something with slightly more contrast and the fabric suits my preference.

review_title: Finally! Jeans that fit like 10 years ago
review_body: I'm 35 and until now I could not find jeans that were not way too tight for my comfort (not quite as baggy as in the early 2000s). Even jeans I ordered described as "loose fitting" were so tight around the butt and thighs (and sometimes the ankles) I just can't wear them. I don't want JNCO jeans or anything (90s reference to ridiculously baggy jeans), never sagged my pants, but never got caught up in the skinny jeans thing. Don't understand it. These are the 1st jeans I've actually purchased in 7-8 years that I really like and are accurately described in my eyes

review_title: Comfortable jeans, but slightly longer than expected
review_body: These Levi’s 559s are very comfortable. The denim is soft, waist fits as expected, and there is plenty of room in the crotch and thighs. My one complaint is with the length. The jeans claim to be 30” in length, but are clearly two inches longer than other pairs of Levi’s with the same length measurement. I’ve noticed a lot of recent ads for jeans and shoes have the jean legs cuffed. I am wondering if the fashion industry, as a whole, has just decided that all men will cuff their jeans for the next year or two. It’s not a huge inconvenience, but, I do feel as though it’s worth removing a star from the rating.

I love wearing this on cozy, stay at home and slumming days.  Was HUGE on me (5'2, 120lbs) but fit the hubby just fine (5'11, 190lbs).  Shrinks a bit with washing & drying.  Recommend line drying if you wear a large and want to keep it that way.  Retains it's color (we use Tide w/bleach), and does not pill or fall apart with regular wear.

For $16 bucks it's perfect. Durable zipper, useful pockets, great color, and warm enough. This is not a thick hoody that you can wear to go dogsledding. But for cool temperatures, for the change of seasons, for sleeping in on a cold night, or to layer under a jacket, it's perfect.

review_title: Don't let the "SALE PRICE" fool you!
review_body: Don't let the "SALE" price fool you!  These Hanes Hoodies are normally $11, not $50.  Walmart sells them everyday for $11.

review_title: A Handsome Hoodie - Good for Red Hood Cosplay!
review_body: I adore this hoodie, I've worn it for over a year now and the fabric is just as comfy as ever. Sure, the soft fleece lining wears down and pills up, even coming off in the dryer over time making it much thinner, but it's still snuggly, and passes for warm. I've managed to stain it, and then wash it so many times it should be honestly dead, but the color has stayed true! The neck tie thing still looks like new, and the sleeves have been stretched from being pushed up my arms, but that's normal wear and tear. While it's light enough to wear in summer, I wear it as an additional layer under my winter coat and love it! I even bought a second one, as this was initially for a Red Hood cosplay for Batman comics, and I ended up loving it a little too much. Constantly. I wore it to bed because I was chilly okay. Fully love this item, going to probably buy it for a long time. I bought a "large", knowing it would be bigger on me, and that's what Hoodies are made for right? Medium would be pushed against me and not tight but snug. Large means I can pull my arms and legs in comfortably if I'm really chilly and pretend it's more of a boyfriend shirt than something for myself, and we all know it's extra comfy to snuggle down in something a size too big (but not comedically big) for you. It's a good buy.

review_title: I liked it so much I bought two more
review_body: I bought the black one first.  I liked it so much I bought two more...navy, and deep forest...all three medium  They look great, and fit perfectly.  I'm a 70 year old, 6' tall,160 lb man, and not very large or muscular.  I would advise that if you have a muscular build go one size larger.  For me the hoodie fits perfectly.

review_title: Got this in a men's small because I like hoodies a little baggy
review_body: Got this in a men's small because I like hoodies a little baggy. I needed a plain black one for work. Love it! Thick so it's super warm for winter. I am a woman and the men's small fits amazing. Has a funny smell when you get it so I would wash it. Plus when you wash it, it gets softer.  Also fast shipping. I got it in a day.

review_title: A little thin, may not last long
review_body: Great price, very comfy, look to be well made, but the weight is good for just a cool day. Nothing too extreme, up to each individual I suppose. I got two of these, mainly for work, and they perform well for my tastes. Have not washed yet, kind of worried if they will last but hey, at the sale price who cares.

I work a lot in a meat cooler. This is light enough not to kill me with heat when I'm "outside" in the store, and it's warm enough to keep me going inside a cooler. Fits as expected. I bought one, and after my experience with it I bought two more.

review_title: It is really comfortable and soft
review_body: Even though this is a men's sweatshirt, I bought it for myself, to wear around the house. It is really comfortable and soft. The drawstrings, to the hoodie, are not like others that I have had, they are more like a textured, braided shoelace. I really like this, it feels so cozy to lounge it.

I have been looking for a replacement black hoodie for awhile. I didn’t want any logos on it. The one I have was a company gift several years ago. It finally occurred to me to look at the tag to see what brand. Eureka! And no logo.

When I want the absolute blackest black jeans I can get, I turn to Levi's. Mine have held up with no fading and no issues, so I ordered a pair for my husband. I ordered 38x30 (length) and while the waist, seat and thighs fit my husband well, the length is by no means a 30" inseam - more like a 34" at  least. I'm not able to hem jeans, so we either need to take these to be tailored, or he'll have to wear them cuffed up with monochrome black Converse low tops so it looks deliberate and not like he's wearing the wrong size pants.

I purchased 2 pairs 36-32 for myself and 2 for my adult son.  These purchases from Amazon were a good experience for us.  I am puzzled by my purchases recently from Levies.com which were completely unsatisfactory and a disappointment.  From Levies direct we purchased 10 pairs of 560 in which the material was completely different than pictured and replacements were the same.  We also tried some 550 black and the same was true with big differences in the sizing.  The sales people were very nice but had no idea of what they were shipping.  If someone showed me these jeans without tags I would think they were knock offs because of the poor quality and off sizing!  I think this is why there is so much difference in what buyers are reporting back.  You can not be sure what you are going to receive and neither does the sales dept. of Levies.com.  At least with Amazon or Zappos if you should receive a bad pair of Levies returns are easy.  With Levies.com. this was not the case for us.  In Levies the good are good and the bad are completely unacceptable. The men's Levis 550 medium stone washed jeans we have recently received from Amazon and Zappos have been well constructed with the good old heavy denim, which we expect and demand from Levi's, and the good correct fit which is not too much to ask for from their loyal old customers.  Otherwise Levi's will lose us! Some people may think Levis should pay more attention to their quality control and less attention to their political advertising concerning social engineering.

review_title: Irregular fit, unusual defects, these are knockoffs. Stay clear.
review_body: I bought these after trying on and purchasing a pair from a Macy's. These fit completely differently from the other ones I own, the crotch is super tight and actually started hurting after a while in an area that most men don't welcome pain in. Because of how tight they gripped my crotch, I didn't want to wash them for fear that one wash and they would be un-wearbale. In addition to that, the second time I wore them the front button fell off without me even noticing, something I have never experience with Levi's jeans. I even ended up cutting my finger on the jagged metal stud when I reached down to unbutton. I am not overweight and have purchased a variety of "less loose" fitting jeans without this issue. After doing a little research I have determined that these ARE NOT REAL LEVI'S and are actually a knock-off with poor fit and workmanship. I know for sure because the little red tab on the back pocket doesn't even say "LEVI'S" on it. just a trademark symbol with no letters or anything else. Amazon needs to do a better job of vetting their vendors, brands like Levi's need help protecting their name, and I don't like paying for knockoff products.

review_title: The waist is about 1/4" narrower than it should be for a 32" jeans. Beware! You might need to go to next waist size!
review_body: The quality of Levi's jeans has been decreasing through the years. The fabric is getting thinner and they do not last as much as they used to years ago.

review_title: 35" waist - why don't they sell these in stores?
review_body: 34" too tight - 36" too loose - 35" just right.

edit: I've contacted Amazon Customer Service since my review.  They are return/replacing all three pairs of jeans.  Hopefully I just got a bad batch?  Can't ask for more from Amazon.  We'll see if Levi's just had a faux pas with the jeans I ordered or if there's a quality issue with Levi's.

My husband actually is the one that wears it and I love that I can now find them consistently here on Amazon and at a reasonable price and no shipping with my Prime account. Prior to looking for them here, I had to drive 30 minutes to a store to get them and sometimes they didn't have them or they were damaged (zipper or other poor quality). We've now bought four of the 550s here and they are all great. Good quality, good fit, good look. I would buy these again and likely will as he wears them to work the bee yards and needs a regular rotation of jeans on hand.

So... bought a new pair of jeans, just like the ones in the closet. Seem well made, waist fit great, the length- 2 inches longer then my old ones. All made in indonesia.  Now to decide- reorder a shorter pair or same size and see what I get?

Changed my rating to 1 star. Both pair of pants developed a hole next to the upper left corner of the Right hand back pocket.Then the hole rips down the length of the pocket. One pair’s tag started to disintegrate after a few washes. I’ve never had problems with Levi’s until these 2 pair.I don’t no if their knock offs or just defective pants. I order 29 length received 30 length, not a big deal.

One big selling point of Levi's jeans used to be durability -- it was possible to wear a pair for years.  These pairs and others received as gifts last year all started to fall apart after just a few uses.  The quality of construction of these jeans is poor, to say the least.  The old jeans may have cost more upfront, but the value proposition was significantly higher considering their durability.

review_title: The weight of the fabric is perfect for Colorado and the cut makes my man look ...
review_body: The weight of the fabric is perfect for Colorado and the cut makes my man look like he "tried" when he got ready, but doesn't make him have to - making him all the more willing to wear it! Which of course makes me happy :)

review_title: Good shirt for the price, but order up a size.
review_body: The fit is a little smaller than I expected (I'm 5' 8" and lean, and the small is a bit snug) and I'd probably order up a size if I were to buy this again.  That's okay though because it works well for layering.  I originally planned on wearing it over a T-shirt, but now I take advantage of the snug fit and wear it under my flannel if I have to go outside (it gets cold and windy up in these mountains!).

At first I ordered medium size which fitted too small. Then i exchanged for large size, this time it fitted too large (at least two sizes too large). I think Hanes is selling this cheap because the sizes are all over the place. If you don't care about the fit, go ahead and buy it.

Bought these for son's college wardrobe at NE school. He loves the feel. Not too heavy. Great layered or alone. Runs a tad big but son will shrink them when he washes them in hot water and sets the dryer too high. Totally recommend. Hands down the choice /  FOTL doesn't come close. I substrates one star due to a few threads and an uneven seam one one. Ordered 5.

review_title: All dressed up and no place to go.
review_body: Good quality and stitching. Feels really nice to wear and fits perfectly.  I am super happy with this shirt.  I have purchased a lot of shirts online and this is definitely one of the better ones.  Can't go wrong at this price as long as you order the right size.  The shrink a little so be aware of that.

My husband loves this shirt. Its warm and cozy, but breezy enough to not feel too constricting. Can wear it by itself or layer with another shirt on top. He's on the short side, with broad shoulders and a thick, muscular build. The XL fit him well. He loves it and has requested extras in different colors. It arrived pretty quick, too. Great value for a great price.
For me it was a little tight at the waist and a lot longer in sleeve but I am short. The thickness was slightly thiner when compared the one I had ordered last year.

Nah, didn't care for this shirt. After one washing the bottom part just kinda shrunk and in a weird way curved up like a dried up mushroom or something. It is warm though, just very uncomfortable. Also the fabric is like a magnet, picks up every little particle of whatever is in the air and sticks to it.
I love these shirts. They are inexpensive and of reasonable thickness and quality. I am cold natured so I wear these shirts in the house and when sleeping.

review_title: Heavy cotton, nice color, but it stinks like heavy chemicals!
review_body: The color is nice. Heavy cotton. But it absolutely stinks! Bought an XL for my husband who is 6’3” and 130lbs or maybe more these days, and it appears to look like it should fit like Columbia XL or Timberland XL.
The material is thin but no too thin, stretchy but not body-hugging tight, and absorbs sweat well. Love it.

Fantastic shirt. Looks good.  They are great to work out in or just hang out in hot weather. Wisks the sweat. Very light and loose fitting.  Only reason for not getting 5 stars is the price. If they just dropped it $5 it be a 5 Star.  Still worth it to me since it’s hard to find a competitor that is similar.

review_title: Great shirt. Great cut and quality
review_body: Perfect top for my man! He has about 9 colors now. This particular style is not fitted, light and airy. He loves them and said he would wear them all day every day if he could. They hold up well to repeated machine washing and drying. Colors are exactly as pictured. He is 5'8" thick build, broad shoulders, long torso, and the shirt lands right past his waistline. Perfect

I've bought these UA shirts from sporting goods stores and those seem to be of higher quality. These seem too flimsy and the workmanship is suspect. When I first took it out of the wrapper I wondered if it was a knockoff. Fit and finish is definitely subpar when compared to other UA shirts I own that are supposed to be identicle.

review_title: Best shirt if you live in very hot and humid areas
review_body: I couldn't have asked for a better shirt then these Under Armor shirts. I live in the southern part of Florida and man does it get ridiculously hot, but with these shirts I can actually breathe in them and not feel too suffocated by the heat. Not to mention, they actually make me look good despite not having a very fit body, so that's a plus!
Very light fabric. Husband is 6’3 around 190 and I got a large. Color exactly as advertised

review_title: This fit very poorly. I am a rather small ...
review_body: This fit very poorly. I am a rather small person and so I ordered a small. I would wear a small T shirt from, say, The Gap. This was baggy as all heck. Given it's stretchy, I would call it a medium. Returned and decided I was too fat for a stretchy shirt anyway.

review_title: ... got a size bigger because i wanted to be comfortable on my backpacking trip( which is what i used ...
review_body: i got a size bigger because i wanted to be comfortable on my backpacking trip( which is what i used it for) and it worked out fantastic, dried basically instantly and kept the sweat off of my body in the cold while hiking, really good reliable shirt.

Great shirt! I just used it this morning for my workout and I'm a heavy sweater. The shirt held up well and didn't weigh me down like most cotton shirts do. It's lightweight and breathable and even though I sweat through it, it's just cold to the touch, not wet. That's a plus for me. 5 stars all the way.

This shirt is very comfortable and fit perfect. I wear it to the gym and if i'm working outside where I would sweat alot. The shirt keeps me dry and it does not smell. It is flexible and moves well with me. I now have 3 of these shirts and probably by more.
I purchased these for my husband.  He loves the fit since they are not baggy or tight. He finds that they are very comfortable.  The material is thicker and more durable than we expected for $20!

review_title: they fit great feel like they are of good quality material
review_body: These slacks were a gamble purchase since I had not bought Amazon Essentials clothing. I was really impressed. they fit great feel like they are of good quality material. I will be purchasing more from Amazon Essentials

I bought three pair of these for my husband, who has a business casual dress code for work. They were very good quality and true to size. He liked them so much that we bought more since the price was so good!

review_title: Not like the D3 that they referenced in the features, but an ok product
review_body: These are Not like the D3 that they referenced in the features. They do not have a claps in the waste, just the button. The material is very wrinkly and kind of sticks to other fabrics and your body. They work but they are basic. And the waste is an inch shorter that published and the length is a 1/2 longer. They will likely shrink so i get the length but they may not be usable due to the waste size after one wash. I bought the 40/32

review_title: THE PROBLEM MAY BE THAT THEY LOOK LIKE THEY ARE LONG RISE WHICH DROPS THE START OF ...
review_body: BOUGHT 4 PAIR BECAUSE THEY HAD A 28" INSEAM. TURNED OUT THEY ARE LONGER THAN 30" INSEAM SLACKS. I TRIED 2 PAIR,

I rarely find pant that fit me off the rack (so to speak). These did and for $20 they make casual that more comfortable. And they are comfortable. I needed them for my job which requires a lot of movement and these pants are great for that. The material is soft and again, the word "comfortable" speaks volumes. You really can't go wrong. The first pair I bought was a size smaller so the free return made it easy to find the right size. Very pleased.
I am amazed at the quality and price point of Amazon Essentials. The men’s clothes are designed to be of above average quality for the price and average fit that will be comfortable for most men.
Good pants

The material and construction of these trousers are comparable to ones that I have bought for three times the price.  The fit is as expected. They do require a bit of tailoring to taper the legs as I found them to be too wide for my taste but even with the added minor tailoring cost, the total was still well below what I would have spent on another brand which usually requires additional tailoring anyway.  Amazon Essentials has become my go-to for high quality clothing items and a good price.

These pants soft on your booty. These pants are thick, but not so thick that they are uncomfortable in warm weather. These are so soft  your partner will want to touch them while you are wearing them. So far they haven't ripped very easily, and some pants rip rather quickly with general wear. These are one of the better 20.00 pairs of pants I've ever bought for the dude that lives on the couch.

review_title: Levi's: Find your fit and stick with it..
review_body: Levi's somehow got complicated along the way. These jeans are as advertised, relaxed and straight. They fit good for larger Leg and hip profile but can feel a little baggy down at the lower 3rd of the leg. The bigger challenge is figuring out which color/pair is 100% cotton and NOT stretch material which I abhor.  Luckily the darkest blue ones are not stretch and the dark color is best suited for me. Levi's fabric, in general, seems inconsistent these days but at least you can order the size and color easier than going to different stores trying find what you need.

review_title: Great fit, great color, and great price!
review_body: Took a gamble for the husband, since we’re both picky about his denim colors and it’s so hard to tell online. These jeans, in the Navarro color, are perfect. Nice dark indigo, with the perfect amount of sandblast, no whiskering or anything that makes them look dated or super trendy. Can be casual or slightly dressed up with the right shirt/shoes. The fit is great, as he’s been wearing 550s and decided the leg was too loose at the bottom, the 559 refines that look a bit with the straight leg. Also pleased with the deal we got, since they retail at about 50% higher online.

I have a pair of these that I bought approximately in 2006 or so that was fantastic.  Nice quality. Comfortable. Good fit. I am completely average build and I figured that even though I rarely buy clothes online, since I was able to find the exact same size style down to the same 4 digit color code, why not just get these through the mail?  I thought I would save some time trying stuff on in the store which I really don't like doing.

review_title: Best jeans for a 5'10" husky guy like myself
review_body: Love these jeans! I am 5'10" tall, definitely not all muscle (sorry ladies). Depending on the brand I wear a size 36-38 waist and 29/30 length in most cases. 36 waist and 30 length fit me perfectly. These jeans seem to have a touch of elastic feel to them around the hips. Not sure if that's for real or just how they fit me.

review_title: Worn Out in Less Than 4 Months
review_body: I love the fit and cut of the Levis 559, but the quality has gone downhill dramatically.  I last pair I purchased lasted for almost 4 years of frequent use.  I bought a replacement pair in February of 2018 and they are already worn out in June of 2018.  There's a hole in the crotch area and the corners of the rear pockets are wearing through as well.  Is that what we should expect from Levis now, 3-1/2 months???  I'll probably order one more pair in hopes that the last ones were a fluke, but I'm not optimistic.

Really bizarre. Early this year I bought two pair of 32x32 that were maybe a little big but figured they's shrink down. A couple of months back I suffered an injury and have since lost 30# so I ordered one waist size down, 31x32 thinking that they might be a little too big but as I put weight back on they's be just about perfect. Out of the box they are incredibly too big and not just the waist but the legs are much more loose and baggy than the 32x32. Unfortunately I washed them to see if they might tightne up so I don't think I can return them. Now I'm hesitant to try a waist 30 and will likely just go to the mall and try some jeans and buy whatever fits best.

review_title: Great if you don't need front pockets
review_body: My favorite jeans. Have a few pairs purchased years ago and recently ordered several more pairs based on those. BUT... Levis has cut the depth of the front pockets by more than half. The are so shallow i can't put my iphone in them or even get my hands all the way in. Some pinhead at Levis probably figured the could save money by reducing the material used. Bad move Levis. Fire that clown and send me some proper jeans. Would have returned but didnt discover this until I had already removed the tags and washed them.

I’m giving up on ordering Levis online.  Their horrible naming practices and varying fiber content from color to color in the same product line is bad enough, but the unexpected variation in product quality is a step too far.

These jeans fit just fine and are a good product.  I only have one negative comment, which is the reason for my review being 4 out of 5 instead of 5 out of 5.  The supplier's stock for my size was so depleted that the only color choice was for blue pants that were "pre" faded on the front... Now, this may be considered cool or trendy, but to me the fading makes them looked "used" before I even put them on for the first time! I don't like that look and would much rather buy blue jeans that are dark blue, as new.

review_title: Not the same quality you would expect
review_body: I have bought these jeans several times in the past and they have been great.  This latest order of two pairs were different than all the others

review_title: Poor quality zipper makes this jacket a loser :-(
review_body: If the zipper had been made of good quality, I would have kept this jacket.
I purchased one of these and my GF kept wearing it so I bought another one recently. The first one was fine. The zipper on this more recent one doesn't work very well.

review_title: Inexpensive spring jacket, but consider ordering one size up.
review_body: Low price for a nice spring/early-fall jacket. It is very lightweight and thin. The sizing in the arms feels a little too short and at times it feels too tight for the size I ordered.

The sweater felt at first like it was small, but I just forgot the realize the extra weight I have added own.  Perfect sweater for those of us that like a light weight sweater that provides some warmth, yet won't overheat up, best for the slightly chilly nights, but not a winter coat replacement.

Really basic zip hoodie that I ordered as part of my Halloween costume but now it's my go-to when I'm a little chilly. It's a little big on me, but that's what I wanted. Adds to the coziness factor. Very soft inside and wear it around the house all the time because its so darn comfy.

Exactly what I expected, but I'm not sure how long it will hold up to the punishment I can give to my hoodies. Slightly on the thin side (fabric) so I'm curious when I will wear the first hole in it. Otherwise, it fits great, strong zipper, light weight.

These jackets are absolutely what I was looking for and expected! My husband is 100% satisfied with them and will be purchasing the again as needed. They fit around the waist and wrists rather well, I suppose the only complaint is that the hood is too small. However, the zipper is of good quality, they fabric is soft, and once you wash them the odd smell of them comes out. They do not shrink, either.

review_title: FIts well, built well, looks good and the price was right.
review_body: XL is a nice fit (athletic build - wider shoulders and not much fat around the middle,)  Well built (no flaws in materials, sewing, symmetry, etc.)  Pleasantly surprised by the quality and the looks of it.  Originally had ordered it for use around the house.  But it looks so good, I wear it out as well.

I love this hoody, purchased for a trip abroad so I was a little nervous...very pleased with it, very lightweight, but warm...very soft and comfy...will purchase another one,,,,,one caution,,,,it has a full front zipper, so be somewhat gentle with it, it seems a little on the fragile side....love it !!!!!
Now how versatile casual get up and go to lazy to REALLY GET dressed 5 star comfort is THIS.

review_title: Get a few sizes larger if you're an athletic person
review_body: I do a lot of strength training so my thighs/butt region is larger than most average guys.  If I buy these jeans to fit my waist (around 36"), then they are too tight in my thighs/butt.  I have to buy them at a size 40" waist so that the thighs/butt will fit, then I wash them to shrink them down a bit and wear around the house to stretch them back out to properly fit me.

review_title: I have been buying 550 blue jeans in the same 34x34 size for years and always fit great. Not having the same luck with these jeans ...
review_body: This was second attempt to buy 550's in black. I have been buying 550 blue jeans in the same 34x34 size for years and always fit great. Not having the same luck with these jeans in  black. My first pair was considerably larger in the thickness of the leg as well as the length, had to return. Ordered a second time and this second pair fit well in the leg thickness but are about 1.5" too long, again will return. Going to try one more time and order a size 34Wx33L. The pic is of the second pair placed on top of a pair of my 550 blue jeans in the same 34x34 size.

I truly think Levi quality is a thing of the past.  Belt loop stitching at the waste unravels after two washings, and don't even get me stated on the stitching around the back pockets.  I'm told I can send the Levi's back for a replacement.  I really don't want to waste the postage and receive a replacement that will fail in very short period.  I started questioning Levi quality 8 months ago, bought 4 new pair and watched them self destruct in less than two months.  I'm a 54 year old die-hard levi fan and have just purchased my first pair of wranglers - lets see how wrangler performs.  I'm saddened to see what has happened to the Levi Brand.

review_title: Distance between front belt loops is very small
review_body: While other aspects of the fit are fine, one dimension that I would never expect to be an issue is the distance between the two front belt loops. Unfortunately, Levis has reduced this dimension to the point where some belts with loop and buckle simply don't fit properly. On previous versions of this same Levi cut there were anywhere from 4.25 to 5+ inches of space. Now you are lucky if you get 3.5 inches. Levis customer service has stated that the official distance is now 3 to 3.5 inches. It don't know why they made this change, but they should list it on their website along with other dimensions.

review_title: Loose fit is perfect for fluctuating waist line
review_body: Depending on the season, I can easily fluctuate 10 pounds above my max weight (by Army standards). I have pretty much worn a 34" waist since high school, but I can easily put on a pair of 36" jeans depending on the manufacturer.

review_title: Jeans made in Bangladesh are too small.
review_body: I had to return two pairs of these jeans in this color (dark indigo) because waist sizing is too small. Husband always wears Levis in size 32x32 and this style of jeans bought at the same time in a different color (medium stonewash) fit him perfect.  We noticed that the dark indigo is made in Bangladesh, but the medium stonewash is made in Mexico.  There appears to be a quality problem with the sizing of jeans made in Bangladesh.  In reality, the jeans made in Bangladesh seem to be a 31x32 instead of 32x32, although the labels on the jeans themselves all say 32x32.  Considering whether or not to try to order 33x32 in dark indigo to see if these fit, but haven't decided yet whether to bother.  The quality of the material and stitching of the jeans seems to be the normal good quality of Levis jeans, just the sizing is bad.

Levi's come and Levi's go.  After wearing them for 40 years I've noticed a few things: belt loops are STILL the weakest point on the jeans: be careful of hitching your britches up by the belt loops - they might just come off in your hands!  Also, the color of the stitching seems to be constantly changing: first it was gold, then it was yellow, now it's almost an off-white - but ONLY on the rear pockets.  Weird.  And is it just me or is that tag that they put inside the right side of the waistband getting LONGER?  I suppose much of this is due to lowered quality control at off shore assembly plants in Costa Rica?  Bangladesh?  Zimbabwe?  I miss the good old days when Levi's - the #1 symbol of American culture - where made here in the USA.

Levi's men 550 relax fit jeans - perfect! Very pleased with the quality, fit, leg length of these jeans, do not wish to make a fashion statement just needed jeans to wear for whatever I want to do, cut grass, odd jobs, etc. Ample room to move around in any position required. These jeans are exactly what I was hoping for.  Since the fabric color does not affect the fit of this product it will not be mentioned. Fully expect to have great service from these jeans.

review_title: Received pants with a small rip in the leg.
review_body: I ordered two pairs. Unfortunately, I washed the pants before checking them fully.  One of the legs has a small tear in it. So, can't return.  EXPENSIVE junk pants right off the bat.

review_title: Too baggy, taper is like boot cut jeans
review_body: Unlike my old 550's, these are baggier and the tapered legs are more like "boot cut" jeans. Maybe it is because these are imported, and my old ones were made in the USA?? Other than that, the material seems good and the stitching seems the same. Just disappointed that they are baggier and the taper isn't the same.
Thickness of the Henley was better than I expected, the quality of the sewing was great too. I will revisit the site gain for future purchase.

review_title: I bought two and will buy more.
review_body: The shirt fits and works great.

Love the color combo and look of the henley style with the feel of the Beefy Hanes. I will definitely be ordering more in the future as more colors come along. Order a size up and you should be fine when it shrinks in the wash. Feels great. Although it is beefy it has a slight, very slight stretch to it, but I guess that is normal many cotton t-shirts.

review_title: Not beefy, get Dickie heavy weight Henley with pocket for almost the same price
review_body: I purchased this because it said beefy.  It is actually rather thin.  I also bought a Dickie heavy weight Henley with chest pocket.  The Dickie is actually heavy weight and has a chest pocket that is undetectable under a shirt.  The Dickie is only slightly more expensive.  I will not purchase the Hanes product ever again.
I Like the style and fit,I would recommend going to a size larger though.They will shrink

review_title: Okay shirt. Little bit snug through the chest
review_body: This runs a little small I think. Granted, this is on a woman. a person without breasts might have different mileage. The fabric is pretty heavy, thick, not super stretchy. It seems like it would be durable, but I only needed it for a costume. My review is based on purchasing a 3X for a woman who would normally wear a 3X unisex t-shirt.
Good, heavy quality shirt.  Fairly warm even.  I'm a tad on the short and plump side.  5'7" and 215 pounds and the X-LARGE fits great.  Little loose like I like it.

review_title: Great price! And the touch of gray along the ...
review_body: Husband really likes this one...Great price!  And the touch of gray along the placket adds a touch of style in stead of all red.

review_title: Good quality, nice fit, great price. Very satisfied.
review_body: Good quality, fits well. I bought this because I like the fit and feel of Hanes' Beefy-T shirts (softness, better material, overall quality), and the price is very reasonable. I also like the look of the Henley - it just seems less informal than an ordinary t-shirt (and better suited for cooler seasons and climates). The cuffs are about 2 inches, which is longer than I would prefer. I wish there were more color options. The color (red) is a little darker than in the picture, but it is sufficiently close. Overall, I am very satisfied with this product.

review_title: Bought these for my nephews and they like them. Nice and soft
review_body: Bought these for my nephews and they like them.  Nice and soft. Held up well so far with multiple washings, nice color. True to size (they are 3x built like linebackers).

I wear Under Armour at LOT.  I work from home and have no reason to "dress up".  I wear Under Armour shirts and shorts and I'm not embarrassed if someone drops by the house or if I have to make a run to the store.  They are so comfortable and good looking I LOVE them!  I even wear them when I go running and to the gym.

I bought two of these for my husband and he loves them. He's 5'9" and 142 lb and wears the medium. It's a loose fit but he likes it that way. He worked out in it and said that it wicked the moisture very well. I'll probably buy him more when they go on sale again now that I know he likes them.

Very good material and nice fitting. I was worried at first about ordering name brand things off Amazon, especially for a low price, but it ended up being a good purchase. The coloring and fit was exactly like the picture.
Great shirts, but need a little color on them, like they had last year when I bought a couple. Very durable and comfortable. Never gets soggy when playing sports.

I have ordered many of these shirts from Amazon/Under Armour in two sizes(XXL and xxxl) and multiple colors all are very nice and fit correctly..... however the Royal/white color almost seems to be a totally different shirt the  fabric feels much thinner and it is almost see thru maybe it's a newer version? Idk but I'll be sticking to gray, navy, and black from now on

review_title: Love the shirt in general - building the upper body
review_body: Love the shirt in general - building the upper body, but it hangs loose enough to let the belly I can't get rid stay relatively hidden...  However, this shirt has two different length sleeves?  disappointed in the quality control.

My husband's review of this shirt:  The fabric of this shirt is great, the fit is as advertised, and the neckband makes it particularly comfortable.  This is the fourth style of this UA shirt that I have purchased because I love them!

Bought this for the boyfriend, who loves it and wears it at least once or twice a week. keep in mind that it is a loose fit, so if you're in between sizes, you should go for the smaller size. my boyfriend usually wears medium, so I got him medium. the waist area was a little loose, but I think if I had gotten a small, the shoulder/arm area would be too tight for him

Bought several of these shirts in different colors for my husband and he loves them!  They fit really nicely, not snug.  He had gotten a couple of Nike shirts that are similar but they were a slim fit, he didn't like them.

review_title: It's not the shirt's fault I didn't meet my time goal
review_body: I purchased this product because I can never find a women's size that fits me properly. PS- I'm a girl. I bought this to wear for the New York City Marathon. I wanted a color that would stand out. I also purchased iron-on letters to add my name to the front. The shirt held up well with the ironing and looked good as I headed to the start line. Unfortunately, it just wasn't my race and I was proud to finish and look good wearing the shirt in the process.

review_title: Comfortable, wrinkle resistant, great for business or casual wear
review_body: These pants are awesome. Got them for my boyfriend who is 6'4" and 170 lbs. I ordered a size 33x34 and they fit perfectly. They are wrinkle resistant and look great on him. These would be great for work pants or casual wear. Not sure if they are also stain resistant but it wasn't in the item description, but they are dark pants so hopefully we won't have issues with stains down the road. 5 stars for comfy, affordable dress pants.

I bought these as the only other black pants I had were actually kinda baggy looking, like something you'd see a trainee chef wear.  So when these arrived, I immediately tried them on.  The material was actually ok, had no issues with that aspect, but alas the fit was just as baggy.  It's like the rear just gradually tapers down to the ankles.  They'll do in a pinch, but I think I'll just go buy some black jeans instead.

Was disappointed in the pants, the material looked and felt cheap and collected lint like crazy during the day. Description didn’t mention it required ironing, and the pants required a LOT of ironing to get any kind of crease to hold.

review_title: good fit and quality for the price
review_body: I have purchased these pants previously and like them quite well for the price.  My biggest complaint about them is the little "pocket" sewn inside the right front pants pocket.  I keep my coin change in my right front pocket and it inevitably gets stuck in that little pocket.  This is not the only pants I have that have this problem.  I'm not sure why it is there but I wish they would stop putting it in.  I am going to have my wife remove them.

review_title: Nice pants, especially for the cost, but legs are baggy.
review_body: The pants fit well, but they use too much material in the circumference of the legs causing them to be extremely baggy on the foot and does not look professional.  I purchased the 40x34 khakis and will returning unfortunately.

review_title: Its great to find a size length of 28
review_body: Its great to find a size length of 28 . Im 5'7 about 155 lbs and wear size 32 waist 28 length . I like that I don't have to go to my tailor and pay extra to have them  hemmed and this saves me about $12 to $14 dollars  however size 32 waist was a little on the small side and they did seem to fit a little snug. They seem well enough made and will have to see how they hold up in the long term. I think I will be buying more but may decide to go for a size up and keep the 28 length .
This was  part of a Prime Wardrobe order.  I kept two pair of pants but returned these because they shipped me the wrong size.  Bag label was correct, but the pants were a different size.

Fabric is not very light ... rather stiff and heavy.  Pants seem to fit smaller/more snug than most other pants of the same size.  Also the pants seem to pick up any sort of lint, dust, hair, etc.  Wouldn't recommend.

review_title: Nice, but congested in the legs & waste
review_body: Good quality; bad fit. My current pants are 34W x 32L and do not fit nearly as snug as these. I'd say these are just a little bit on the small side in the legs and waste, but not way off compared to all my other pants. The length was nice. Some 32s can look skimpy on me. These were full 32s; I was pleased with that. The quality and material both were quite acceptable.

review_title: Just simple pants at the best price.
review_body: Nothing fancy.  The feel a little thinner than pants that cost 50-100% more so maybe they won't last as long (we'll see).  At $20 per pair though, who cares?  I've worn and washed them and they clean pretty well and seem to be wrinkle free enough.  Best of all, I have a 35 inch waist and most stores don't carry that size.  34 is too tight and 36 makes me look like I have balloon pants.  It's nice to get pants that fit just right.

review_title: My husband really liked these jeans
review_body: My husband really liked these jeans.  They fit well, look nice, and appear to be real Levi's from the cut.  They came with a tear on the side, though, that made me think these were factory rejects.  When I looked at the outside seam (location of the tear), there was just a single row of stitching.  In my own Levi's the front and back fabrics are serged together.  With this pair, the serging was done on each piece of cut fabric, but the pieces were not serged together.  Since that is the case, when a tiny hole starts, the pants are in embarrassing trouble. I can't imagine that men's jeans are made to be less durable.  Super disappointing.

review_title: a bit too low-cut, crotch wears a hole a bit early
review_body: Waist was cut a little low, my ass-crack shows when I bend over.  Never had that problem with any jeans before as a guy.  If not for that I wouldn't need a belt with these.

I used to count on being able to wear my Levi's almost daily for a full year before holes would begin to appear around the crotch (always the "first point of failure" for Levi's jeans for me). I imagine anyone who bought jeans back in the 80s or earlier would scoff at the idea of a pair wearing out after only a year, but my expectations have always been set to "modern standards" of name brand clothing quality. I felt that for the price, I was still getting a good value for a pair of pants that I was wearing every single day for a year. When that one-year lifespan slipped back to 10 months, and then 8 months, I grumbled a bit, but was still more or less fine with what I was paying for.

I love this style of jean- low rise, straight and slim but not gross hipster "skinny". This color, tumbled rigid, is a nice dark blue denim color with flecks of white that holds its color through multiple washings. I also order the Range color which starts out dark but quickly fades to a pale blue with a few washes- not ideal. I am 6'- 160 lbs and the 30x34 fits very well with enough extra length for a little cuff or to fall over boots- but with major caveats.

review_title: The world's top jeans brand has inconsistent sizing
review_body: It really is hard to believe that Levi's, the world's most well known jeans brand, can't get consistent sizing in their factories. I can't believe this is not an issue in the company's executive meetings. Do they really think pushing out different sizes, depending on the country that it is made, will pay off in the long run? Not with me.

review_title: They are well made and I stand by Levi Strauss as the best jeans on the market
review_body: I kept them anyway but will never buy this type again! A belt keeps them from dropping to the floor.  They are well made and I stand by Levi Strauss as the best jeans on the market. SO,  I bought a different kind-Still Levis Strauss-Same  size- but NOT RELAXED STRAIGHT FIT- and they fit perfect.  Still need a belt but I I'm far past my twenties and being skinny.  Also got Button Fly Jeans as a gift in the exact same size and though do not like button fly these were again Levi Strauss and they fit like a glove.  BUY LEVIS-JUST NOT THIS VARIETY

So for me the jeans I ordered are comfortable, and I like the look, but there are a lot of things that were surprising that others might not be as okay with as I am. Since I'm a negative nelly, here's a breakdown of things that you might be unpleasantly surprised by that I personally didn't mind.

I'm not sure what the deal is with the (lack of) quality on these. I usually associate Levi's brand with good quality jeans; it's certainly a famous brand. And at the price of 50 bucks a pair, I was hoping to get my money's worth. That is not really even any savings over the in-store prices, but I thought it would be more convenient than going to the store and searching through the piles for a right size. But what I received must be classified as a factory 2nd or 3rd that was likely rejected by the brick and mortar stores. The pockets and pant legs are slightly frayed, and these are not supposed to be one of those "distressed" style jeans. Not only that, but the zipper was somehow bent at a 90 degree angle. If these were cheap then maybe I could write off those defects as getting what you pay for. But these are top dollar jeans from a top brand, so it's not acceptable.
I bought these in 36x32 to replace my obsolete 38x32 as I've been losing weight (yay!). I tried them in store before ordering. For what it's worth I went with the Tumbled Rigid color.

review_title: They are just okay but no better.
review_body: Eh- these jeans are just "okay" compared to the exact same 559 jeans I bought at Belk in person at local retail store. Compared to the store bought ones (which were from Bangladesh I believe), these were from Mexico. They fit a little more snug in the waist (almost too much so) and the denim is thinner / lighter weight. After a long day of wear comparing both, these become a bit baggy in the butt versus the others bought retail. I bought these on Amazon because my local Belk ran out of my size. Next time I will prob go to the Belk website and just order from there and pay the shipping, which sucks as I am an Amazon Prime member and like the 2-day shipping included in the items I buy.  All in all these jeans suffice and will work I guess, but for the same retail price at Belk I will go back there in the future. Hope this helps someone make a decision and I despise the fact there are too many variables in a specific line of Jeans that I feel should be uniform in quality and consistency no matter where purchased- especially with a big name brand.

It's okay but not what I was expecting. I kept it because my husband needed a hooded sweatshirt right away in the re color for his job.  Would have preferred that it be a little  heavier material but will work until we can find a heavier one.

As part of an EMT class, you need to wear plain sweats with no logo when you go to the hospital, ride-alongs, etc. This sweatshirt is the perfect, "school-uniform shade" navy blue. No logos in sight! Good quality zipper, and nice pockets. I now use this for working out at the gym, and, it is cold, so sometimes I wear it around the house, staying up late to study, or even sleeping in it.

review_title: I purchased a Men's Large because I prefer my sweats ...
review_body: I purchased a Men's Large because I prefer my sweats to be bigger, and my movement is not nearly as restricted versus some women's stuff. I would have to say it's a little bigger than true-to-size because there is definitely a lot of room in there for me, and I typically wear a XL-2X (40C bra size) / Men's L shirts, Men's L sweatshirts.

First off, I'm a woman! Men's hoodies are just as comfortable as women's, but much less expensive! The sizing is just right for me as I like things to be loose and long. I'm 5'7, with a 40 inch bust line. The length hits me just to the bottom of my bottom! LOL! Not to thick or thin, perfect for brisk weather.

review_title: Still a good buy despite the large sleeves
review_body: The first time I ordered this, I got a medium and when I got it it was a little big, but I really like the quality for its price so I decided to get another one but in a size small. I just got it today and there was not a big size difference between the small and the medium. The small was still a a bit larger than I expected but overall it was still a good buy. It was just really big on the arms which is somewhat expected cause this is men sizing. By the way, I am a female 5'3 weighing around 143lbs.

This black hoodie is the same one you wore in high school to look like you were in a gang with your buddies.  The quality is meeeh, but they do last; I had one that I found in a lost and found box that lasted for about 3 years.  Who knows how old it was, probably made in 93' or something.

review_title: easily 'upgraded' with some fabric paint for school mascot/initials
review_body: My son's college has this as its 'color'. I needed a hoodie to wear to a hockey game and was unwilling to put $50 into it. This one was reasonably priced, easily 'upgraded' with some fabric paint for school mascot/initials, and is very soft. I ahve worn it several times now and find it to be one of my 'grab and go' pieces.

Great medium weight hoodie.  fits great across the chest arms and length.  Zipper is quality, and the material is soft and cozie.  Great for wearing around the house on a chilly day, or outside if the weather is below 70 degrees or windy.  I will def buy another one.

review_title: Fit is perfect, the lining is really soft
review_body: Fit is perfect, the lining is really soft, and is a really nice hoodie. The zipper feels a little cheap but works. The sleeves are a drop baggy but really not too bad. I definitely recommend these.

review_title: They are just as nice & as comfortable (actually exactly the same) as the ...
review_body: I have order 2 of these sweatshirts (Red & Purple). They are just as nice & as comfortable (actually exactly the same) as the name brands, just without the logo & the high price of the name brand. These sweatshirts are very comfortable & I will probably be ordering more, just different colors

Was hoping to find another pair of jeans that would fit me.  I have thighs that are a bit larger than normal due to an unusual exercise program as a youngster.  Have only found one manufacturer whose jeans fit my body style.  They are quite a bit more expensive so I thought to give this brand a try.  Once again failure is what I found.  These were like many others where they are super tight in the Gluteus maximus (aka butt crack).

As others have observed, quality has not only notably declined since the 60's and 70's, they've declined steadily since and again over the past couple years.  Thinning weight fabric, no double belt loops anymore along the middle of the back, resulting in increased slippage, but also a definite weak spot now where the upper corners of the back pockets are attached (and no, I don't wear wallets in them).  Also, one of the last two pairs I bought frayed after two washing's in a spot adjacent to the zipper.  All of this is a far cry from what Levi's quality used to be, even a couple ;years ago.  So purchase only after close inspection, if at all.

I Love these Jeans there the Perfect fit especially the Length the 32" is to long the 31's are just so hard to find of course it is it's the best fit ! Also the 550 Levi's are the only one's I've been able to find with the 31" in length. It's unbelievable that the 550 are the only pair of jeans that I can find with a 31" length in any style or brand ! I just wanna know why it's so hard to get the 31's in any style from any brand of Jeans sure would like an answer to this question ? also they wouldn't sale out as fast as they do if there wasn't a demand for them.

review_title: Best all-around jeans for looks, fit, and work capability.
review_body: I work as a skilled craftsman, and I've gone through a number of jeans recently, and these have proven to be the best all around for looks, fit, comfort and work capability.

review_title: A traditional cut jeans for real men . Not hipster skinny jeans cut like most else these days.
review_body: FITS AS EXPECTED . Didn't expect that .... why ? It seems levis is following the hipster tight pants trend and every other pair I have bought brand new is not cut for a man . the butt slides off due to the hipster skinny jeans cut and I hate it . This 550's actually have a waist on them . They are NOT the hipster no butt skinny jeans cut but imho a Original Levis traditional cut jeans . Which are getting harder and harder to find.

It has been 33 years since my husband has been wearing Levi's, and refuses to try any other brand.  They really are great and last forever.  Good quality, well made and they wash really well.  The "BIG SECRET" , for him is the sizing.  He wore a 32 x 36 , when we married in the regular boot cut Levis, but after years went by he  had to go up to the 34 x 36,  and that was kind of OK for him until that size got snug.  When I came across the 550 relaxed fit, AND he could still wear the same size, and they were comfortable and looked the same as regular fit, all was right with the world! So I have to say, after all these years and his refusal to even look at another brand, really says something.  He runs a rather large truck body business, and spends a lot of time in his office, but he still loves to work on them, and weld and all that other stuff,  and they hold up extremely well.  I would definitely recommend these to anyone!

review_title: 2 out of the 3 pair are functional. I love the 550's but one zipper doesn't work
review_body: The zipper is VERY difficult to get up and down and NOT Acceptable.

review_title: Finally jeans that are too skinny
review_body: I have been looking for something to replace the old 505 cut that appears to have changed in the last 2-3 years to skinny low waisted jeans.  I figured the 550's must have slimmed down a bit from when I last wore them in the 1990's when they were very baggy.  They still are too full in the legs for my taste but the waist is higher and the rise is as well.  You can bend over in these and not worry that underwear or plumber's crack is showing like so many jean are today.

review_title: Holes, frayed edges, very poor quality from Levi... did NOT expect this
review_body: I had tried to find what I needed in the local stores, so I knew what size fit well with this particular pair.  So no surprise there.  But its Levi's...  so quality is what I expect and it's what I got.

review_title: Great pants but not every pair exactly the same
review_body: I have purchased two pairs of these Levi's 550 jeans in the Tumbled Ridged color and both fit exactly the same and were true to the size I had ordered them.  They have held up fantastically well over multiple washes and fit just as well when I originally purchased them.
Ordered 2 one was 100% cotton. The second one had other synthetic materials not to happy out that. Its false advertisement

The shirt is wider than most 2XL shirts I buy for my son. The fabric and sewing look good. So, I washed it to see if it shrank. It did not seem to do so. He layers it over a tank top for extra warmth or wears it under a sweater.

review_title: Am on here to buy more! LOVE IT!
review_body: Bought for my husband for Christmas and it looks awesome on him! He's usually an XL and I bought an XL, fits great! Love the price so I'm on here to buy it in several other colors to stash away for the next gift. Highly recommend!

I agree with all the positive reviews. I purchased two of these shirts for my husband. He liked them and they fit good. They're soft, launder well and for the price you really can't go wrong. For a men's casual wear shirt, I highly recommend!
Nice shirt, but it is 60/40.

review_title: Great Henley to Wear Around the House or Out
review_body: This item is great. I had been looking for a good Henley shirt and this one had good review so I ordered it. Fit-wise, this is perfect. It fit exactly as I expected. It also is soft and feels great on my skin. The color is also really cool. It looks even better in person than it does in the picture. I can't make any comment about durability as I have only had the shirt for about a week, but I've washed it twice and it has held up great. This is a great product if you're looking for a Henley to just wear around the house or out.

These shirts are fabulous.  This is the second one we purchased. Comfortable, casual, great for everyday.  Wear is great. We like the beefy feel to it them. Not a cheap, thin, shirt.  Awesome. Will buy more.

The size issue confuses me. I previously bought one of a different color through Amazon and it fit perfectly. I was so happy that I wanted another but that color was no longer available so I purchased this which is considerably larger even though It is marked as the same size. Still wearable but not as good a fit.

This was a good deal.  Hanes product that is heavier than the normal tee shirts.  Long sleeves makes this real comfortable.  I've bought two so far..  Expecting to order more now that I've used them.  Not yet washed them so have to see if there is any significant shrinkage.  If there is, I will update this review and dock it down a star.

I ordered an XL and I got an XL + 1/2.  Really big shirt.  Hopefully, it will shrink.  Nice soft cotton feel.  Love the grey backing on the henley collar and the fact that the buttons are NOT white.  Thanks.

review_title: Given as a Christmas gift. It's the first time ...
review_body: Given as a Christmas gift.  It's the first time in 30 years I've purchased clothes for 52 year old son and it was just what he wanted for a new exercise he's under taking. -  time to take control of his heart and life style.

review_title: Nice shirts. Fit well and good quality
review_body: Nice shirts.  Fit well and good quality.  Cheaper or very closely priced to places ive visited who carry these.  Colors are a bit off when viewed online but thats not a big deal.  I would order more in the future.
This shirt looks great to wear with some black pants shorts or whatever.  I might even wear to the gym soon.  Very comfortable tee!!!

These are 100% polyester not Charged cotton. I thought I was buying Charged cotton, but I will keep this shirt. It's a great fit, the material is great for hot temps. It's very fine material. Loose fit. You can see through it when held up to light. Not what I expected but I will keep and wear it.

review_title: "Black 009/ White" is not solid black/white, its static..  "Black 001/White" is solid black, I believe.
review_body: This specific color "Black 009/ White" is NOT as pictured in the first picture.. it is gray/black/white static type coloring as shown in other pictures... If you are looking for a solid black Under Armour shirt (don't care what color the logo is but expecting white) as I was, I believe the "Black 001/White" is the one and only option... Just a heads up for this specific color on this shirt.... Fits good and breaths as expected.. just not the color i expected from the picture or from the description.. BEWARE

review_title: Horrible odor on the shirt as soon as i opened ...
review_body: Horrible odor on the shirt as soon as i opened the bag which gave me a headache.  Smelt like the chemical version of strong Indian food.  Couldn't return this fast enough.  Will never buy one of these shirts off amazon again.

review_title: but this shirt is GREAT for exercising
review_body: I've been skeptical of techno-fabric in general because of the way lycra stuff has pilled in the past, but this shirt is GREAT for exercising. Breathes beautifully, doesn't stay wet, and it seems to be holding up well.
This shirt is not tight, but also not roomy -- it tends to hug or cling to you more than I care for.  I normally wear 2x in an athletic shirt; for this I went up to 3x to get the right fit

review_title: fits bigger than I expected and bigger what would normally ...
review_body: fits bigger than I expected and bigger what would normally be considered a Large

review_title: Very cool and comfortable to sleep in or wear outdoors.
review_body: A loose fit as advertised. I have several of these loose fit UA shirts. This white one is a thinner material than my others. Very cool and comfortable to sleep in or wear outdoors.

These pants look great, have a nice true-black color and look like they will hold up well.  They compare well to pants I've bought for 30% more.  I'm quite pleased with them, though I might go up an inch in the waist next time I order.

review_title: Quality pants at a good price.
review_body: They were a quality pair of pants at a good price. I like that the material is a little bit thicker than say a pair of Dockers. I bought the usual size that I buy and I thought they fit a little more snuggly, so perhaps add an inch around the waist, but other than that they are good to go and look nice with any dress shirt and tie.

review_title: ... be accurate and the quality of the material was good, but I found the pants the be big ...
review_body: The waist and length I found to be accurate and the quality of the material was good, but I found the pants the be big and bulky in the legs.  Believe me, I’m not a fan of skinny jeans, but with these pants I felt like I was MC Hammer!  The if you like plenty of room in the legs, I would say their perfect.  But if you like a more tapered modern look, I would recommend passing on these.

I jam 5'9 and weigh 170 lbs.  With the statistics out of the way I ordered the Amazon Essentials Classic-Fit Khakis sized at 38W X 28L.  The package arrived and I opened itwith some trepidation.  I tried on a pair and the fit was perfect!  The waist was a bit on the large size so I might try a 36W next time.  Otherwise the pants are a great buy for $20.  I would definitely recommend these trousers as the sizing was ample..  There is one caveat - the material is not heavy duty khaki. I live in sunny Socal where it is a bit warmer this time of year than back East.  It might be wise to find a heavier grade of khaki trouser in cooler climates but for the value and workmanship these pants are excellent.  Definitely recommended!

review_title: Great pants at a great price!
review_body: These pants fit me like a glove! I am tough to fit, as I have had trouble finding 29/29 size in anything I would wear in public. I found the item in these pants, and was so pleased with them, I bought another pair in stone. Same great fit, and both of these colors go with everything I own in summer and winter shirts. Like I said in the title of this review " Great pants at a great price!"

review_title: Nice pants, but longer than expected
review_body: These are nice pants. They are comfortable and, in my opinion, look good. They're a little dressier than my usual khakis, but not annoying like a lot of actual dress pants. My only quibble so far is that the length of these pants is a good 2 inches longer (approximately) than most of my casual pants and jeans. I had to return the 32 length and get a 30.

I wear a 38x34 and the size is excellent. The front pockets are plenty deep and that's necessary since that's where I keep my wallet these days. Best of all, the zipper isn't that cheap plastic crap that's in Jos A. Banks pants, it's metal. Before you think of buying at Macy's or Penney's or any of the other stores take a good look at these.
This item WAS returned as it was not the correct size for my dad.  I was charged again. It was claimed that they didn't receive it. Stuck without a product and charged. Not good.

The pants appears to be well made and the fit was spot on. I decided to buy two more pairs since the price is right. I would say the quality is on par with what you find at Old Navy or even Dockers. I haven't washed them yet so I can't comment on the wrinkle resistance, but I don't think you would be disappointed with your purchase.

Purchased (2) pair, 30 days apart.  June and July 2018.  Cloth feels good, workmanship is good, cut (fit) is good.  The dark navy is an odd coloring but you get used to it.  Each pair are washed once a week, residential machine, grocery store liquid detergent, warm wash, cold rinse.  One of the pairs is already starting to get white in the lower thigh & knee area.  Its all in the preference of the dressed "down" worn/bleached look or the dressed "up" color fast look.

review_title: Excellent Product and fits as expected!
review_body: I bought this for my 40 year old son as a gift.  He was visiting me over Thanksgiving and was wearing the same brand/style, but wanted a different color since most of his wardrobe consists of tonal grays, black, and white.  I had it mailed/delivered to his own apartment address and he was very satisfied with both the delivery company (arrived a day earlier) and the fit of the jeans.  The color is wonderful, the overall fit is not "bun hugging" (my son prefers jeans that are not) and would likely appeal to more mature men past 30 than teenagers, in my opinion.  Can't go wrong with Levi's and Amazon!

Great fit for me - I've now purchased 6 pairs in various colors and like them all. Prefer the non stretch for the feel when wearing them, but the stretch one's are still good to wear. Comments about the quality are puzzling to me, as mine look and feel as I'd expect, and are exactly the same as the pair I purchased from a Levi's brick and mortar store. I'll keep buying from Amazon as the price is extremely competitive, with free prime shipping. Very happy customer.

review_title: Buyer Beware: stretch fabric on specific colors!
review_body: I would give 5 stars for the pair I previously owned, but I found out not all 559's fit the same.  The difference is in the colors - some use use stretch fabric, others are 100% cotton.  It's hard to say it "fits as expected" when the colors vary so much.  2% elastane felt at least 2 sizes larger than the 1% with the same waist size.  This is baffling when trying to shop by style.  Why clump stretch and non-stretch together in the same page?

review_title: No way these are authentic Levi's jeans
review_body: I've had Levi's that have held up for years.  I've had this pair for 6 months and they are rapidly falling apart.  I don't work in these pants, so they aren't subjected to anything more strenuous than sitting, standing, and walking.  The denim is very thin compared to my authentic Levi's that were purchased in brick and mortar stores.  Either Levi's quality has taken a nosedive recently, or these are fake.

review_title: Don't buy these.  Made in Lesotho, soft fabric, inferior denim grain.
review_body: Fell apart in just a month.  Ripped straight down the wallet line, hole on the opposite side I don't even put my wallet in.  As for the major tear, I use a very small wallet,and I didn't work in these jeans.  Checked the manufacturer tab, Made in Lesotho. Famous for using inferior grain denim and cotton products. Someone from quality control needs to stop this.  And until they do, me and Levi are done.

I still have to return these. As is the problem with other Levi's I have bought these are made in a random other country. They are cut completely different and are nothing like the regular 559 I have come to love. I grabbed them since they were a great price at the time, but it was just a waste since they aren't the same pants at all. Sadly this looks like I will have to yet again go back to the Levi's store to make sure I get an authentic, high-quality pair of these.

fit nicely, cant go wrong with a pair of levis. i didn't notice when ordering, and it doesn't mention this, they are the stretch version. at first i wasnt sure about it but i do like them. a little more comfortable and still look like jeans. i got one waist size bigger than usual for more comfort, with the stretch though i probably could have stayed with my actual waist size. the ad also says they are button fly, this is incorrect. i received (and wanted) zipper fly.

Update: Still my favorite jeans, but the croch ripped open this week and they had to be retired. They lasted 1 year and 3 months with regular wear (usually a couple days a week). I had a second pair and have already replaced the pair that ripped because, even if I wish they were a little more durable, they're the best fit and overall look I've found.

review_title: Length and waist run true, but not really "relaxed"
review_body: I bought these pants because I wanted a light colored pair of jeans. The fabric weight is fine but my biggest problem with these jeans is the cut. Even though they're marked as relaxed fit, they seem surprisingly tight in the legs - and I'm not exactly a heavily built guy.
