I ordered my regular size and it's not as if the pants were designed for a smaller person - the waist is fine and the length is fine. It just seems like a slimmer cut than what I'd expect from relaxed straight cut jeans. Thank heavens they are stretchy otherwise they'd be uncomfortable.

I ordered these jeans in size 36 last week.  They were just a bit too big, so I ordered the size 34 and received them today.  I couldn't even get them past my waist.  Never had that happen with a 34 before.  As you can see from the pictures, they are over 4 inches smaller than the 36 (ruler says a little over 2 inches, which equates to over 4" on the circumference).  Also, both pairs are substantially thinner than any Levi's I've ever owned before.  Either these are Chinese knock-offs or the quality control at Levi's is failing miserably.  Manufacturers have got to get a grip on these issues.  It's becoming infuriating.  Quality control does not have to suffer, regardless of price point.
Good for the price; cotton fleece inside is warmer than expected...fits a bit smaller than the black one I purchased. XL fits my 6'4" 195lbs. Sleeves run about 34-35 inches.

Super soft fabric, not too thick/thin, it's perfect for layering. It washes nicely and dried quickly without pilling. No zipper issues after being laundered. Very reasonably priced for the quality - looks and feels like higher end specialty stores hoodies for 1/3 the price. Pockets are good size. I bought the black one and it's a solid, very dark, true black. Not heathered or some weird charcoal dark grey color, just regular dark black. Washed and wore it right away and don't want to take it off. Highly recommend.

I came here after reading reviews for women’s black zip ups and seeing how they run short. I am 5’9 and size 14. I ordered the L. Perfect baggyness and great for the price. I would say if u are a man taller than 5’9, this might be short on you.

review_title: I love stealing hoodies from guys because they're always so much ...
review_body: I love stealing hoodies from guys because they're always so much more comfortable, so I finally just got my own. Washes well and super comfortable, with a good stretch unlike some cotton hoodies.

review_title: Safety Hazzard! String sewn in place.
review_body: This is a great sweatshirt. Comfortable fit - not too thin, not too thick. So why a safety hazard (of all things - for a hooded sweatshirt, really) ?? Well, yes - I bought this for the morning run. First day out the silly hood strings were flapping all around. I tried to simply yank the whole thing out during the run. No go. When I returned home I realized that the string is *sewn* into the hood at the midway point! So if you happen to be using any sort of machinery, tools, etc... and one of the strings gets caught... you could be in for some serious trouble. Think: home mixer, drill press, saw, car engine, pretty much anything with rotating parts to grab the string as you look and pull you in. The old-school hoods (the ones where the string always had a mind of its own) would simply pull the string out. This one has a strong string, sewn strongly in place. Beware! Other than that - I like it (and have cut out the string!

it's a little bigger than I expected, but I haven't washed it yet, so it may shrink. It's super soft and cozy.  I can see wearing it a lot this winter, even though I only bought it as part of a halloween costume.

review_title: and says it's the perfect weight, as a lot of sweatshirts are too ...
review_body: I ordered a size up for my husband and it fits perfectly.  He's worn it almost everyday since it arrived, and says it's the perfect weight, as a lot of sweatshirts are too warm for him.  It's been washed once and went through the dryer on low heat with no noticeable shrinkage.

It's a little snug in the arms up by the armpits and across the stomach, though the latter might be my fault for sitting around all summer. I wear a medium and it fits, but I would probably be more comfortable in a large.

review_title: Even if you buy a size up, you're going ...
review_body: Even if you buy a size up, you're going to get eco alright= what happened Hanes?! So this goes for small, med and large sizes ,,,, body and fabric . If you just don't move nor reach for anything, don't sit down not bend over, this is the hoodie for you,,,, and the hoodie is short :(

It's very comfy and not to heavy. Of course, it can't compete with the Hollister hoodie I got for $25 at Marshall's, so I guess I'm spoiled that way. The wrist and bottom feel like they'll eventually stretch out, which would be a problem, since I tend to pull up my sleeves.

Fit was expected. A little roughly stitched, but these are for work. They are tough that is for sure. A tiny bit too long at first, but I am sure they will ever so slightly shrink up a bit. I don't wear these for anything but work. I wear bootcuts otherwise. These are bulky and a bit harder, but very durable. Otherwise I got a 35 waist for comfort at work. Usually I wear about a 34.

I'm generously awarding 3 stars because this well-known brand of jeans is of good quality, and Amazon's price is excellent. Unfortunately, Levi's sizing is unreliable and the same size that has fit me well for a while is too small to wear as delivered here--so I've had to return the item. (Note that this isn't a one-time fluke: I have in my wardrobe along with several Levis that fit well another that is also too small. All the samples that I've mentioned are the same Levi's model, labeled with the exact same size.)

review_title: Poor Quality not the denim of years past.
review_body: The denim used in these jeans is of very poor quality. I have worn these a dozen times and they have tours wide open on the side of the left back pocket. The denim is paper thin. Has no strength  and rips for no reason. I feel these are definitely of a B grade material.

review_title: Sizing Issues with Levis and Poor Quality
review_body: It seems lately that Levis has trouble controlling sizes. I have a pair of these in 31 waste that fit well, but others in 32 waist that are tighter than the 31 wasted ones. Seems like the sizing these days is all over the map.

review_title: Amazing. When I shop for jeans at a brick ...
review_body: I just ordered these Levi's Men's 550 Relaxed Fit Medium Stonewash Jeans before the Labor Day weekend and they've already arrived.  Amazing.  When I shop for jeans at a brick and mortar store, I typically have to try on five pair before finding some that fit reasonably well.  I don't know if I just got lucky or what.  But these fit perfectly with no try-ons.  Very happy with this purchase!

review_title: they are all good clothes, but no standards
review_body: It's been an experience.  I bought some new jeans.  First it was Wrangler, which was too long (2" beyond the heel).  Then Lee, which was 1" too long.  Levi seems to have stuck to the measurements, still it touches the floor.  I say this based on Lee pants (about 10 years ago?) that was an inch above the floor.  I wear 38x32.  Looked for 31 which seem to be rare and I think 30 will be too short.  Pants or shoes, there is no standards now.

review_title: My husband's favorite jeans, for almost 2 decades!
review_body: My husband has worn Levi's 550s for probably 20 years.  He likes that they aren't baggy or skinny, and that they have a zipper fly.  Levi's are a little more expensive than some other brands, but he wears these jeans for 3 or 4 years before they're too faded and become work pants.  I just threw a pair out that he's had for at least 10 years.  They fit true to the waist and inseam sizes, and I can just order online for him and know they will fit him.
No consistency at all. I ordered two pairs of the same size but different colors and the black pair were 2 inches longer and baggier than the other. Terrible.

review_title: Great Jeans; Superior Amazon Customer Service
review_body: I’ve found Levi’s Jeans are the most reliable casual/everyday jeans for me. I’d given up finding relaxed fit in stores but searched Amazon on a hunch. The first pair had a belt loop come lose after wearing about four hours. Amazon was great and had a new pair on the way immediately and sent a label and instructions to return the torn ones. The new pair is great and meets expectations. Thanks.

review_title: Levi's quality seems to have dropped.
review_body: What happened to Levi's jeans? I have a pair that ripped near the back pocket less than 2 months after I bought them. I spoke with my co-workers and they said they have had the same thing happen. Levi's used to last years but it appears their quality is not as good as they used to be. If the 2 new pair I bought experience a similar fate, I wont be buying their jeans again.

review_title: I'm glad I didn't listen to other reviewers and got ACTUAL ...
review_body: I'm glad I didn't listen to other reviewers and got ACTUAL size. My friend is a size small and it fit perfectly. I haven't washed yet but material is good and color is dead on. What a nice surprise from amazon.

review_title: A nice shirt for the price.
review_body: Yes this is a thicker heavier shirt thus the beefy name. This shirt fits great. I took it out of the dryer layed it flat on the bed. Later put it on a hanger. Looks like I ironed it. Very comfortable. Well wortg the price.
I am hard person to fit into various clothing.  This item fits well, very nicely made, and much more than I expected.  I would highly recommend this product.

review_title: and the medium fits almost perfect. Maybe a hair tight in the chest
review_body: I am 5' 10", 160 LBS. with an average build, and the medium fits almost perfect. Maybe a hair tight in the chest. Mine is 100% cotton but did not shrink up to much in the wash. I would describe the fabric as medium weight not beefy but I live in cali. so that's fine. All in all a good shirt.

Bought a large and washed it in warm water and dried it on the low setting.  Fits me perfect but usually a large is too big on me but a medium is a tad too small.  The color I bought is 75% cotton and 25% polyester.  Has a soft feel.  Planning to order a couple more of these shirts.

review_title: These are so comfortable and look so good that I bought two more
review_body: These are so comfortable and look so good that I bought two more. An easy shirt to throw on and do whatever you like to do in it. I fell off a skateboard and landed on my elbow. The shirt is still fine. Lost some skin off my elbow, but the shirt is fine. :)

review_title: But not bad. Best cut/weight for the dollar
review_body: I'm 6'-1" 215 & use it as a contractor.  The 2XL fits a bit loose, not blowsy. Would have gave it 5 stars if they made it a bit longer in the tail. But not bad. Best cut/weight for the dollar. Minimal shrinkage after multiple washes.

it is tissue paper thin..fits is too tight.What happened to the old Hanes thermal.My old ones are three times the weight and a medium fit fine so I purchased a large and it is skin tights.Terrible product.

review_title: it fit well and was comfortable.
review_body: Bought for a Mr. T halloween costume, it fit well and was comfortable.

review_title: red is a bit dark and runs small a smidge
review_body: shirt color is more of a dark red and the size is a bit small, so i'd ordered up in the next size above . bought this for my hubby and he loves wearing it, even just to lounge around in the house . its a soft, cotton shirt and very comfy . a great purchase .

review_title: The shirt is excellent quality, and does exactly what I would expect ...
review_body: The shirt is excellent quality, and does exactly what I would expect from a technical fabric.

I work as a paramedic, and our agency color is green, so I bought a couple of the green shirts to wear underneath our button up shirts.  These shirts are nice and soft, wicks away the sweat to keep you dry and cool.  Allows for great flexibility during times when needed.  I highly recommend this shirt to anybody whom is active.
I love Under Armour products and this shirt is no exception. Well made and performs great. Have worn many times since purchase - no shrinkage or other issues. Great feel fit.

review_title: nice shirt and materail but a bit short
review_body: the fit was great, I am a big guy, but like most shirts there too short,,, ill be able to wear for a while them it will be showing my Done lap disease off  :-( ..... but it is a nice shirt for you mere mortals....lol
Love the fit and feel of these shirts, and when walking in humid hot weather, it wicks the perspiration away and keeps me cooler than straight cotton TShirts.
Love the UA brand of clothing cause it fits loose and doesn't hug the body.

Tried the Medium and it was too baggy and large.  I exchanged it for a small and that was too tight.  Something in between would have been perfect, but that doesn't exist.  Unfortunately, I gave this a shot.  It didn't fit right with either possible size.  Most seem to have found this shirt to fit perfectly for them, but it didn't for me.
I’ve owned several polyester Under Armour shirts in the past and love them.  I like this one too,  but the polyester is a tad bit scratchy compared to previous shirts.

This shirt should be branded as near perfect. Armour shirts absorb sweat and keep you cool in hot weather. They fit perfect if you order a size up. My husband wears LXXX and I ordered LXXXX up. I was totally right after he tried it on. It fit perfectly and still was a little loose for him to move around. Material is super soft and this shirt is very attractive. I highly recommend buying Under Armour. I liked this brand so much I almost purchase all clothes from Under Armour for my son.

I like UA Tech Loose shirts. That said I ordered 2 different colors both in the same size, each was made in a different country. The 1 felt like a true large, the other "large" looked and fit like a medium. I'm disappointed as their outsourcing causes size differences preventing me from ordering anymore.

These are not the best made pants I've ever owned, but they are certainly good-enough, and well worth the money.  They are very basic, and fit closer to the more relaxed style I prefer, rather than the trim silhouette that is popular now.  The quality is probably similar to, say, H and M than a Polo or Vineyard Vines, but sometimes that is all you need. I would not hesitate to buy them again.

review_title: High quality men's pants at an excellent price
review_body: These pants are a great value for the price. I ordered Olive and Gray in 38 waist and 29 leg and they fit perfectly. I was impressed with the wrinkle resistant material and soft feel. I will use them for work with with polo shirt. I just ordered a pair in navy blue. Give them a try and you will have no regrets.

review_title: animal hair etc like many of the reviews I saw before I purchased
review_body: My husband typically wears scrubs to work & needed some new pants for a business casual look. These worked perfectly!! They have washed & worn well so far (keeping in mind I can only speak to occasional wear). Haven't noticed an issue with them attracting lint, animal hair etc like many of the reviews I saw before I purchased. Great buy overall, & the fact that they are so reasonably priced just makes it a sweeter deal.

I used to sell men's clothing and the main way to cut costs and increase profits is to use less material in the seat and crotch of men's pants. These pants will not cut you  even when sitting down. For casual pants, skip the discount and department stores and order these. Best $20 I have ever spent for pants.

review_title: Good pants for the price and fit better than some ...
review_body: Good pants for the price and fit better than some I have found in men's clothing stores. The only down side is the little notch at the bottom of the front pocket catches all my change and it's hard to get the coins out of there while you're wearing the pants.
These are classic style pants that have a 1990’s dockers look. If you’re looking for modern style pants, these are not for you. Overall, good fit for a pair of “Daddy Pants”.

My husband uses this type of pants for working around the house and the yard. He has a short inseam - 30" - and it is getting harder and harder to find that length in a decent pair of pants. I was really impressed with the quality of these pants and they fit absolutely perfectly. I would recommend these pants.

As is seemingly typical with navy blue pants, the color began to fade slightly with each trip through the washer/dryer.  Otherwise, they were nice and fit very well, but I had to retire them after the color began to look duller/lighter than when purchased only a few months prior.  Off to Goodwill they go, sadly...
Well made, but legs are so out of proportion they look  like clown pants
Pretty tough to beat for $20.00.  I don't think they are office quality, but are just great for a casual lunch or dinner with friends.  I'll be anxious to see how they look after several washings.

review_title: Would have been nice to see something like Avenger blue or Avenger Black
review_body: Fit well, and was what I was looking for except the color "Avenger".  I thought it was a dark blue but it is Black.  Would have been nice to see something like Avenger blue or Avenger Black.  But I did order them and they fit and will be fine.  I was surprised that they were made in China.  I always thought Levi's was an American company.  May have to find a different brand in the future.

review_title: Great Jeans, kinda pricey in my opinion though
review_body: These are really great jeans. I like the fit.  The legs are wider than most jeans sold nowadays though.  Me thinks the skinny jeans revolution is terrible.  I hate skinny jeans!! However, due to the fact that the legs on these jeans are a little wider than many jeans sold nowadays, I feel that these jeans fit great. Very comfortable in my opinion.  Good crotch!! My only knock on these jeans is the price.  I paid $39.99 for my jeans from Amazon.  I feel that the Amazon price is too high.  While they would have probably cost more from a brick and mortar store, I shop at Amazon to save money.  I feel I should have been able to save more money from buying these jeans on Amazon.  The negative aspects regarding buying online remain the same. You have to wait to receive your order, product may not be exactly as described, or the product might not fit the way you like, are all detriments to buying online.  Give those drawbacks, one should be able to save a good amount of money on a product when compared to offline purchased in my opinion.  I just feel that these jeans should be cheaper on Amazon. However, I WOULD MOST CERTAINLY PURCHASE THESE JEANS AGAIN in the future.

I'm a little disappointed  with these Wellington levis 559 jeans. They fit perfect but the quality of the material thickness is super thin.  ( VERY THIN)  The other options like the dark blue jeans are much thicker material.

The problem with Levi’s is fit uniformity, the same waist size varies wildly. Some 31” fit well while others in the same model may be too small or too large. Same with length, some 34” are spot on while others are too long or too short. Levi’s needs to tighten up its quality control. Other than the fit issue, it’s a good product.

I have been really frustrated buying these jeans because the sizing is not consistent. I ordered the exact fit and style of a pair that my boyfriend already owns and loves. Unfortunately, they did not fit the same at all. I measured the waist of a pant labeled with a 36" waist and it was actually 40". Same story on length. Apparently someone is just slapping any label on hand to a pair of pants. I have ordered and sent back more than one pair of these jeans adjusting by ordering a smaller size for what I thought was their sizing error. No luck. Over it and won't order these again. Giving two stars because the color and wash of the jeans are nice.

Fit/finish perfect for both pairs! Beats sifting through a pile of seconds at local department stores. Color/pattern matched what was shown online. Price was competitive and can't beat (Prime) delivery. Not going to comment on style or Levi's in general. You either like them or not (I do).

review_title: Terrible quality, and misrepresented in the description.
review_body: Absolutely terrible quality.  What they don't tell you in the description is that these are stretchy.  They are not true "jeans material".  I ordered a different color (Range) and they were the correct fit, and were not stretchy pants.

I bough the exact size of jeans I currently have.  Relaxed fit is necessary for my bigger than average quads.  My current jeans are loose fitting and very comfortable.  They are just wearing out.  When these arrived, I tried them on and they fit my legs like my daughters yoga pants. Relaxed fit .. not so much.

review_title: Extremely inconsistent, too much to recommend or buy again.
review_body: As others have made clear, the consistency of these jeans is... nonexistent.  They have obviously given up on quality control and are just banking on the fact that not many people buy two pairs of the same exact jeans over time.  But with internet ordering, the only way to know what you're going to get is based on what you've purchased before, so if you're going to advertise your jeans by specific number, you better make sure they are the same.

review_title: Perfect fit, comfortable.  Slim with a bit of give.
review_body: I'm a 33" x 29", which is a tough size to find, and 32" in certain pants fits well.  However, the 559 (a bit of stretch to them) 32" x 30" fits perfectly, without straining the button at all.  I've heard that some experience size variations by pant color (weird, but okay if that's what you found).  I have 3 pairs of 559s in two colors and the fit is identical.  I really love these jeans.  Identical review for the other color I bought at the same time.

This  sweater change my life! Every time when  i wear this, i feel like im part of the blood. showing the blood sign and teachers are getting scared of me, im now the cool kid in school as i getting girls left to right. i feel very happy until one day, the sweater starting to get holes and shrink .my heart was sad as getting backstabbed by the reviews, i could not wear it anymore. will buy again if i have the money

excellent fit, very comfortable, the zipper is great quality. i have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hoodie. it is what a hoodie should be unless you want a liner, and this one isn't one of those which is fine.

I bought this Men's size Medium for me because I wanted a full all Red zipper hoodie ..... and it fits that description .... fits me perfectly (I'm 5/3" & 145#)  ... I like a hoodie with roominess .... and, this one is perfect for me ........ I love it.

review_title: knock your self out and stay cozy
review_body: Nice , light weight and  reasonably priced, my husband wanted a white hoodie, really " white ".  He's happy and I'm pre staining, that's LOVE. Right ! smile !

I've had one of these for years. I left it behind last time I went out of town, and was devastated. Thank goodness I could get this one! It's my everyday go-to for cold days. I'm not a guy, but I like the baggy fit of this for gardening or yard work or running errands. It's soft on the inside and washes well, has nice warm slash pockets for hands and a hood for that cold wind.

This hoodie was purchased for an ET Halloween costume, after Halloween it became an everyday wear for my son. It has been washed and dried several times. The hoodie has not faded nor has the fabric pilled up, it looks as good as it did the day we received it. My son wore this most days during the NY winter as he does not like wearing a large bulky jacket.

It is one of those that is warm enough for a cool room, but it is cool enough to use in a warm temperature. The material is nice, soft, comfortable, fits me perfectly, is not like those weird cloths that says Large, but it fits like a Small, or those that Says XL but it fits like a XXXL, it fits perfectly. It has not shrink after washing it, has not tear to pieces, or lose stiches, I will purchase another one in a different color.

So I bought this by accident, I meant to buy a no-zip hoodie but I decided to give this a chance anyways. So right from opening this there was a random string blocking me from wearing it properly that I had to remove which was somewhat annoying but after I actually got to put it on it looked nice. My only real complaint is just how far down the neck part of the shirt comes down but if you wear a good matching shirt under it you should be covered. Overall I’m not sure if I’ll ever actually wear it but it’s not bad for $14. I wouldn’t really recommend buying it for anything more then that though.

review_title: It's been excellent, but not as useful as I expected
review_body: It's been excellent, but not as useful as I expected, because mgt. finally got tired of everyone bitching about how cold it is in the bldg.,so they bumped up the thermostat a degree or two.  That is not Hanes' fault, that I'm wearing it less than I expected.

Classic grey hoodie. This is what I wear around the house in cooler months so I can keep the thermostat at 62. My version of Mr. Rogers' sweater, I guess. I'm bald, so the hood comes in handy too. Can't beat the bang-for-the-buck,

I now have to reorder the same pair because of the poor quality. They already have tears in the quad/thigh area and the belt loops are tearing. I am careful to only wash when necessary, turned inside out, using Wool Lite Dark and hang dry. The color has faded fast and not close to the texture feel of my old Levi's from years ago. The only reason Levi's is getting my money, again, is because I do not have time to go out and try other jeans for fit. And that the 550 model is not usually found in stores. I checked a few and found the Macy's has them only online for the same price. I will start looking for a new jeans brand.

I've been wearing these for years. Last time I bought 38s and they fit fine. Recently I put on a few extra pounds and they started to feel a bit snug, not terrible but a little uncomfortable especially right out of the wash. Anyway I decided to take a step up and get some 40s this time around to give myself some breathing room. I just got the new pair and they actually felt smaller then the 38s. And when I held them up side by side the old 38s were wider in the waist. So I got out the tape measure and it seems that the old ones, which were suppose to be 38, were actually 40" and the new ones which are suppose to be 40 are only 39". You'd think with a product that is sized in 2" increments the margin of error would be less then +/- 2". I returned them for some 42s we'll see how those fit in a couple days.

review_title: These are 100% heavy duty cotton denim Levi's... Just like the good old days!
review_body: Even though these Levi's Men's 550 Relaxed Jeans are considered relaxed through the legs, they do run narrow through the waist and seat. No problem, though. We returned the original pair and went up one size leaving the length the same. Now my husband says they're super comfortable and reminded him of why he has always loved Levi's.

2 months after purchase these jeans have a coin sized hole in the buttock and it is frayed about the legs. I guess I would value this if I was a teen, but I wear these for casual work in my own office. Casual would not mean having my underwear show through. I wear these jeans about 2 days a week. So after about 8, perhaps 10, wearings, where I sit at a desk, the  if worn through. I've used Levi's for 40 years or more. Eventually pants wear out. Usually at seams around the pockets. I've never seen anything like this. I wonder if it wasn't overly aggressive stonewashing, because there are a number of areas on the jeans that are much lighter than other areas. It is those areas that seem to be breaking down much, much faster than would be expected. The same day I bought this pair, I also bought a pair of 36x34's and I ended up returning those after just over a month when the stitching starting coming off. That was hard as it was a few days beyond the return date. This is 2+ months, so I don't figure that I'll even try, but buyer beware.

review_title: I will order again because they are a great price and exactly what I purchase from large retailers
review_body: Ordered two pair........one medium stone wash and one light stone wash.  Would have given 5 stars, but I received a dark stone wash instead of the the light.  I will order again because they are a great price and exactly what I purchase from large retailers.

review_title: they looked like they were made for the circus
review_body: The pair of Levi's 550 I received had Yellow stiching on the rear pockets and a combination of the standard burnt orangy color and yellow stiching on the belt loops and fly area. they looked like they were made for the circus. In my 40 + years of wearing Levi's I've never seen a pair that looked like this.

You read the tabs, you pick the rewards (size) and you’ll end up getting who knows. Levi’s have lost standards many years ago. This is my last pair from them. I’m tired of guessing what sizes they really are. I’ve had beltloops come off on one end. I’m just done oh and they are no longer an American company. They haven’t for years

I have bought Levi's for most of my life and they have become a cheap product and I am going to start looking for an alternative.  The fabric has gotten thiner and the belt loops rip too easily.  Very disappointed in every pair I have bought for the past few years.

review_title: Not what they used to be
review_body: Poor quality, these have really gone down hill. I hope they can fix their quality issues someday...

review_title: Is it really that impossible to sew on a belt loop?
review_body: I've been wearing these jeans for years, but I guess it's time to find another brand. I recently bought three pairs of these, and one of them has a belt loop that's torn loose after wearing them just one time - and I was very careful not to pull the jeans up by the belt loop. I've had this problem with this product one too many times now.

We bought this for my husband as part of his Halloween costume, since the price was right. It's actually a really nice quality shirt. It fit as expected and I think my husband will be wearing it for more than just Halloween.

I like the material, the fit is a little tight around the stomach like other people have said but it feels nice in the shoulders and the sleeves roll up well. I'm giving it 3 stars because the sewing quality is a little shoddy; I've worn it maybe 20 times since April and there's a hole developing at the joint on the wrist. I bought one with jersey material so I'll see how that one holds up. I can probably repair it, so for the money it isn't too bad?

review_title: Is easily dressed up or down!
review_body: Loving the simplicity of this style shirt,  great fabric feel and with the addition of those 3 collar buttons you can dress this up with slacks or keep it casual with a pair of jeans either way your going to look great!
I bought this as a gift for my husband as a long sleeved shirt that was great for just running around the house and working in the yard.  He loves it.  I would definitely buy him another.

review_title: Great Value in a Long Sleeve Henley
review_body: For a basic inexpensive long sleeve henley, this is a great shirt!  I am a 45 inch chest with 34/35 inch sleeves and the fit of an XL is about perfect with the sleeves being just a touch longer than I would like.  I'm pretty sure a few more washings and dryings will solve that issue though.  For $10, in my opinion, these shirts are a great value and I will order more if the solid colors become available in my size.
Husband loves it, wears it as much as he can, the details and buttons are perfectly sewed on. The fabric is soft and resistant. The color is the same as the picture shown.
Nice shirt; soft and fine cotton.  Some posters say that it is not 100% cotton, but the shirt that I received has a label that says "100% cotton".

review_title: This item is nice thru the shoulders but tight thru the waist
review_body: This item is nice thru the shoulders but tight thru the waist.  If you have any bulk in the mid section order a size larger.  Also inside seam on cuff is not sewn...poor quality overall

review_title: THE COLOR IS BEAUTIFUL AND EVEN MORE VIBRANT THAN SHOWN IN THE PICTURE
review_body: THE COLOR IS BEAUTIFUL AND EVEN MORE VIBRANT THAN SHOWN IN THE PICTURE.  VERY NICE FEEL TO THE SHIRT.  THIS WOULD BE A GREAT SHIRT FOR CASUAL FRIDAYS, OR ANYTIME REALLY.
Fits true to size and is very flattering for men. If you have any chest size insecurities, I feel like this shirt is definitely one to get because it really drapes well and accentuates muscles.
I love that I can find tall sizes.  My husband usually wears a XXXLT.  He is 6' 4.5". Fit perfectly. Long enough.  It's a bit loose, but we like that.  Still looks perfect after several washes.

Super cheap material.  Wore it once and it was very hot and uncomfortable.  I'm an avid fitness enthusiast and pretty particular with my gear.  This shirt was a wasted purchase.  I'll never wear it again.
I have official under Armour shirts. These are knock offs. Real ones feel soft and move with you naturally. These are stiff and scratchy. These are not real.
the shirt is ok... it just runs too large its a "loose fit" so you should order a size smaller than what usually wear.

review_title: Overall it is fine to work out in but it is a little ...
review_body: Fits small and listed short sleeve but I received long. Overall it is fine to work out in but it is a little to tight to lounge in or go out to the store after working out.

review_title: Nice material. Got a 5x for someone who normally ...
review_body: Nice material. Got a 5x for someone who normally wears 3x..but Under Armour always runs small. Fits great EXCEPT for the length. If he raises his arms at all, the shirt goes up & shows his belly(Obviously). For being a 5x, it should be longer
Love the feel of this shirt and the fit!  You won’t be disappointed if you buy one!  It nice and form fitting which is nice, I prefer shirts that contour to your body!

I do not usually order clothes that under armour classifies as "loose" fit so I was not familiar with the sizing. I am 6'2, 220 lbs and usually order XL, So I was surprised when this shirt arrived and i put it on and it was huge. Still a great shirt. Good quality and very comfortable. Other people have complained about the switch from 95/5 poly/cotton blend to 100% poly but honestly I am not sure it makes much difference. A nice comfortable tshirt either way. I went back and ordered another, size large and it fits great

review_title: and the material was slightly different in a way I don't like, lighter and softer
review_body: I've bought a couple of these in gray, and I wanted one in red. But when it arrived it was a day-glo pinkish orange, and the material was slightly different in a way I don't like, lighter and softer. I wish they would make on in a genuine red.
I do like this shirt but it's baggier than I expected. Maybe people who typically buy under armour go a couple sizes down or something but I was expecting a tighter cut shirt.

review_title: Khakis that fit well and look good at the right price
review_body: I wear khakis almost every day to work, but I have a problem paying more than $20 for them. So, when I saw an ad for these Amazon Essentials khakis, I one-clicked and got them two days later. They fit well, look good and come in a variety of colors and sizes. Since the price is right, I'll probably buy several more pairs.
True to size. Classical design! Nice fabric.

Bought these for my husband. Unfortunately, the first pair we got had the right pocket practically sewn shut. But Amazon sent a replacement even before they received the damaged ones. The new pair was perfect. He loves them and we plan to get several pairs in more colors for him.
Can't beat these for the price.

review_title: They look and feel like $20 pants
review_body: For the price, you can't really beat them. They look and feel like $20 pants.

review_title: These pants arrived so wrinkled I didn't thing I could ...
review_body: These pants arrived so wrinkled I didn't thing I could ever iron out the wrinkles.  Also they run a little short in the length. I returned them for a full refund.

review_title: ) They're comfortable, and they're not pleated
review_body: What can I say? I needed gray pants, and these are gray pants; they fit the bill. They run a little small, but it wasn't a big deal. Maybe I've just been running a bit big lately. ;) They're comfortable, and they're not pleated, which, in my opinion, only makes people look like they're wearing diapers, so that's good.

review_title: Don't try to save a few pennies on these slacks
review_body: I can't figure out if these are supposed to be dress pant. They are definitely. More on the casual side. They do not fit very well or look very good. and the color is a very dull faded color

review_title: You get what you pay for.
review_body: These are $20 pants and you get what you pay for. The fabric attracts fuzz and is thin and dull. The cut is okay. You can pay more money for worse pants, but that doesn't make these a deal.
4- stars because the quality is so-so. These pants will last about 6-months. But for $20.00 worth it. Fit a little short, other than that great pants. Will be buying more.

My Levis 501's I've been wearing for years fit around the waist and butt fine, but are too tight through the legs, so I thought I'd give these a try. Fit is perfect and are very comfortable.  Just ordered two more pairs. Like that online I can get odd sizes.  I wear a 33.

WTF!?!?!  These jeans appear to be going the same way as food stuff in stores, meaning same packaging but less quality/quantity. I always buy my jeans a size larger so when they shrink they fit perfect in the waist and the sizing through Amazon (unlike at stores) is always spot on perfect, so ordering Levis through Amazon is definitely the way to go!!!  Levis jeans always had some heft, hell that is why people still have their favorites from 20 years ago and can actually resell them for more than what they paid for them originally.  However, these pants are not your old school black denim Levis jeans...they fit perfect but they are "stretchy" and "flex" and seem to be made more for comfort than durability.  Sad to say, but only wrangler seems to still make the affordable denim black and of course if you got the money you can buy higher end (quality) jeans that truly have some heft to them.  These jeans will last about 6-8 months and be a tattered mess...so sad for such an old America Icon.  <thumbs down>
Not sure why Levi's fitting is all over the place.

If I could give zero stars I would. After a month of wear and normal cold washing, the jeans started splitting all over!  These splits are not on the stitched seams but in the fabric itself. They look like someone slashed them all over with a razor blade. How can an old and formerly ‘trusted’ brand like Levi’s sell this junk?

I bought a pair of these model Levis in a Macy's and really liked the way the 559 fit me. Ordering the same model, same size on Amazon I thought would result in an identical pair to the one I bought in the store. I guess that was naive of me. The one I bought on line was at least an inch too long in the legs, creating a nuisance that requires me to cuff the jeans or to later have them altered at considerable cost. The material of the jeans feels quite different than the store bought pants, being much thinner and of what appears to be inferior quality. I doubt that I would ever order jeans again online from any source, including Amazon.

These do have a little bit of stretch to them, and I wasn't sure if I would like that or if it would make the fabric feel weak or odd. The denim is thick and strong, probably more sturdy than the 100% cotton denim Levi's. Those are REALLY hit or miss when you order online. I ordered two pairs of 505's along with this pair, each a different wash/color, and one feels very thin while the other feels the way I think a good pair of Levi's should feel. I'm going to order the stretch denim from now on.

Fit is NOT the same as 559s I bought 15 years ago. After wearing and washing and trying to shrink these for a few weeks, I have to say the current 559 fit is very strange. The tops of these are sort of funnel-shaped. The thighs seem a bit narrower, the lower butt a bit smaller and the waist an inch or two bigger than the 2 pairs of older 559s in the same size I still have. The strange cut makes it impossible to keep these up without a belt. The huge waist just slides right off my hips.

review_title: great fit, great style, good for any guy
review_body: I bought these for my boyfriend. He is picky about his jeans, but I found that Levi's makes exactly what he needs. He says they are comfortable and fit nicely. They don't have any of that flashy stuff. Just a nice pair of jeans. They are great for any type of outfit whether he is working around the yard/shop or going out for a casual dinner. There is also a really wide variety of them here on amazon. I snatched up about 5 pair for him. All arrived on time, looked great, fit great, and he was pleased!

These are very long...like they are 2" longer than other Levi's I have bought saying same size. I also expected waist to be correct size and the "relaxed" part to be in the seat and legs...but the actual waist is bigger than that of similar size levi's I own. So not sure if the 559 style is always like that, but I would not buy these again. I wanted a little extra room over my 514's, but even after washing in hot water and drying on high heat, they still are WAY over sized at the waist and in the length.

Decided to redo my whole jean collection with Levis stretch and man am I happy. These jeans are very comfortable. Size and fit are perfect. Appreciate the real denim feel with some flexibility!! Just can’t go wrong! Get the stretch not the raw denim (nothing wrong if u like that too) but the stretch is the way to go! Cheers

review_title: Runs a little small in the bigger sizes.
review_body: Very comfortable sweatshirt. I will say it runs a little small. I normally wear XXL but I purchased this in XXXL just in case. It's sized about like the XXL it's replacing. Otherwise nice product.

Nice sweater it's not thick so you can use this really anytime unless it's like 100 degrees but yeah great sweater. One thing I will say is that if your tall like me you will kind of notice that the sweater can be a little short ? I would advise you wash this in cold water and let it air dry or air fluff.

I'm a gal that's 4'11". I ordered the large and it's kind of oversized, but I love my hoodies to be roomy. The hood is not too small either. The material is super soft and the Navy blue is a pretty color. A great purchase!

I like my new Haines hoodie.  It is comfortable and warm.  I wish it was a little longer.  I am six feet tall and it comes to my waist when I am standing.  When I bend over my back is exposed.  I guess I should have ordered the extra large in Tall but I couldn't find it on Amazon.  It will do okay.  I am afraid that if it shrinks any when washed my wife will have a new hoodie that is way too big for her.  When they make clothes bigger for extra large they need to make them longer and not just wider.
Comfortable?  Check.

Very light and comfortable. If it helps any guys out there I'm 6 feet tall, 260 lb, broad shoulders with a 52 inch chest, and the XL was a great fit. I have plenty of room even after the wash. I ordered a couple more. The red one looks great!

review_title: Great hoodie. I had a black one of these ...
review_body: Great hoodie.  I had a black one of these for years and it's too beat up to wear in public, so it went into my work clothes pile.  This one is just like the old one I bought at target years ago, except a lighter color.  I would definitely buy again.

review_title: I've had better, but i've had worse, too.
review_body: Kind of thin, fits smaller than I would've expected, seams make it more uncomfortable than a hoodie should really be and could certainly be a good bit softer, kind of scratchy.  Not the greatest in the way of hoodies.  You could do better, but you could do worse too, really.

Ordered this for a hoodie to wear strictly at work in a warehouse. It has held up surprisingly well for the cost. It's thick enough to kee me warm on a cold morning but not too thick to work and move in easily.

This is just a good, simple hoodie. I use them for working out to get some extra sweat going. These don't irritate me like other "exercise" specific jackets/hoodies do. They are easy to wash and can be thrown on when doing yard work or if it just gets chilly in the house.

review_title: Levi's belt loop problems with quality/durability
review_body: Levi's seems to be having quality issues...  I have had these for just over two year.  I don't wear them every day.  Two pairs purchased two/three months apart now are having the belt loops fall off of the jeans.  Because they are over two years old Levi's won't do anything about it.
I've been a fan of Levi's for years, but the black pair I received from the vendor were marked with noticeable "light smudges" on the front thigh area.

review_title: If I wanted to cuff my pants I would have ...
review_body: If I wanted to cuff my pants I would have ordered them extra long.  I ordered the same model and size 36 x 34 that I have been wearing for the last 15 years, but for some reason Levi has decided that 34 is now 3-4" longer than it was last year!  The QC at Levi is almost non-existent.  Unfortunately, I let these sit in my closet too long to return.  So, I ordered 36x32 and found these to be about 1/2" shorter than the 34's.  I am done with Levi, and will begin looking at other brands...

review_title: Bought 3 pair for my husband and the zipper broke ...
review_body: Bought 3 pair for my husband and the zipper broke on one pair after a month.  Need to exchange, but the seller (Amazon) does not give the option of exchanging or getting a refund.  Too expensive ($50 a pair when we bought them) to only last one month!

I have wore Levis' 550 in the same size for the last 20 years and they have fit me great.  Levi's changed their fit on the 550's and now they are loose and baggy and I hate it.  I will be looking for a different style or different brand.  I wish I could fit something that fit like the old style 550's.

review_title: but they just don't fit like Levi's! I wasn't sure about the Rinse color
review_body: I've been a Levi's guy since I was in high school in the 80s.  Have tried other brand recently, but they just don't fit like Levi's!  I wasn't sure about the Rinse color...the dark stonewash seemed more to my liking.  BUT, being the tightwad that I am, saving $13 made me give it a shot, and it's actually okay.  If both were the same price, I'd probably still opt for the dark stonewash, but these will be fine...especially for work, where they prefer we wear dark jeans on our jeans fridays.

review_title: Fit is nothing like it used to be
review_body: The fit of these jeans is absolutely nothing like they have been for the past 10 years. The legs are very baggy. They are two to three inches longer than they should be. Unfortunately, i assumed they would be the same 550 relaxed jeans my husband has worn for years and i washed them before we realized how poorly they fit. Now i can't return them. What is the point having style numbers when the fit is drastically different?

review_title: Great jeans if you don't mind being caught with your fly open
review_body: I have worn Levi's jeans my entire adult life. But a few years ago I noticed that Levi's was using a new type of zipper, which tended to slide very easily - so easily, in fact, that during the course of the day it would often slide down on its own, leaving my fly wide open (!). After tossing a pair of otherwise perfectly good jeans, I ordered a new pair from Amazon but I encountered the same problem. I exchanged those jeans for another pair, but encountered the same problem. I am now returning them for a refund and am on the lookout for a new brand of jeans. Clearly the issue is not with Levi's quality control but with the basic design of the zipper.

Wow I can't believe the Levi's I just got from Amazon .The dark stonewash is not dark.  The belt loops look like they won't last a week. The material is much thinner than any Levi I've ever bought. My husband wants me to return them. Are these knock off Levi's . Made by someone else? If you can buy another brand don't buy these.

review_title: Despite multiple washings, I have found these jeans not ...
review_body: Despite multiple washings, I have found these jeans not to be color fast.
I felt as if their sizes run a tad bit small, however the quality of the shirts was excellent

review_title: large was a little bigger than expected.
review_body: but it looks kinda 90's now so it's chill. im not picky with work clothes as long as it's comfortable. i just hate the tags on the front inside on the left hand side. i had to cut them out because they are annoying but it's all good

Bought this shirt for my husband and he asked me to buy this shirt in other colors. The material was a nice grade and seems well made. Not too thick and not too thin. I was surprised how nice it was being that it wasn't expensive. I plan to purchase other colors of this same shirt.

Nice quality.  Body is Very long.  Sleeves are about right for xxl.  Body is tight (too small) even for shirt advertised as slim fit, which this was not. Payed extra $2 for xxl and overall did not get xxl.  Disappointed. Wanted to order more but will not because of fit.

review_title: These beefy henley t-shirts are nice! They're a good weight but nice
review_body: These beefy henley t-shirts are nice! They're a good weight but nice, soft, and comfortable. It think they're a great value. They fit as expected.

Look I did think it would fit me a bit better. But my shortness and stoutness (so to speak) got the better of me. It fits well, just wish it didn't hug me so much. I still love the shirt.  Who knows I'll probably fit into one day ;)

I like the look at the fit, but it seems to attract lint in the dryer and this is the only shirt I have that does that.  Unusual for a henley shirt.  It's somewhat annoying to have to pick lint off of it after washing/drying..
Glad I read previous reviews on the size. I normally wear a large but I definitely like the way the extra large fits. I'm 5'ft11" and 190 lbs.
Very comfortable and warm for these cooler days that are upon us. Took the the NC mountains this past weekend and really enjoyed it. Good quality shirt and fits great.

review_title: Fit well and very comfy and durable
review_body: These Henley’s are my favorite. They fit well, are very comfortable and durable. Some Henley’s are thin and flimsy and too tight.  These are perfect.
I love under armour tech shirts . but I've noticed they have changed the shirts seem longer and the arms longer . still they are my favorite shirts . can wear them out to workout
Very well made and my husband loves it!
I was disappointed that threads unraveled at multiple seems within a couple of weeks. I've had UA befire, and quality always seemed higher until this shirt.
Nice fit, looks great. Still have to do additional things like dipping in white vinegar, baking soda to get rid of gym odors.

review_title: but the person hated the fabric
review_body: this was a gift also, but the person hated the fabric. It's not cotton. It's a special blend of threads designed to wick away moisture. So if your friend likes cotton, this is not for him.

review_title: Fits smaller than previous UA Loose Fit.
review_body: Fit is much smaller than previous years Loose Fit (tighter in chest and arms)...maybe UA is trying to save money on fabric quantity? The fabric quality is great.  If the fit was better, it'd be five stars.

review_title: I do not recommend using this shirt for a situation where you would ...
review_body: This fabric needs some metallic threading or something antibacterial, because it gets really smelly very quickly under the armpits. I do not recommend using this shirt for a situation where you would be backpacking across country... or a marathon, or any activity that requires physical exertion for longer than an hour. I typically do not generate much body odor, but this shirt stinks up really fast.
I have a few off these Under Armor workout shirts. The fit is perfect for my frame. I am usually somewhere between a small and medium. Thankfully this fits just great. Also great during the workout.

review_title: Good slim fit t-shirt for gym.
review_body: I order this t-shirt 2 times.  First I order Medium, it's be too large for me. After I get small. It's perfect for gym. Thanks.
Nice microfiber sports tee shirt. However, the material is thinner and more apt to wrinkle a little compared to the Fila microfiber tee.

review_title: Budget way to add to your wardrobe
review_body: Decent quality for this price point.  I wouldn't say that you would include these pants in the finest part of your wardrobe, but should be more than fine for most occasions.

The pants I ordered arrived on time and they fit well. They are comfortable; not too tight and not too loose. The only negative is that the pants regularly attract lint and particles. However, the price is reasonable and the lint problem is manageable. All one needs is a good lint brush.
I'm 6' 3" and ordered a 34 x 34. There's maybe an inch of extra fabric on the ankles.
Very thin material compared to name brand khaki slacks.  Only a one button closure at waist that if it pops off nothing else is holding them closed.  Also run larger than expected.

review_title: Great quality, value pants -work or spectator sports!
review_body: Perfect fit. Measures exactly as promised. The quality is the same as pants on AMAZON priced twice as much. My husband, a general surgeon, wears these to work under his white coat, and to our grandson’s baseball games!

review_title: These seem to be a good quality, but they are *baggy*.
review_body: I love the quality and the price cannot be beat. That being said, they are really, really baggy in the thigh and the leg. I don't wear any type of skinny jeans, but these are more like hammer pants than a modern office pant. Even for "classic fit", they are far too large in the thigh and leg.

Came up in a search for cotton pants.  Actually they are cotton/poly blend.  It does state that clearly in the description, which I missed.  Oh well.  They are decent casual pants for a great price.  If they were all cotton I would buy a bunch of them.
Wow these run small. At least 3-4 sizes smaller than other brands like Dockers.
these fit like 36x32 length was a bit long but waist was perfect for advertisement. Definitly classic chinos loose not tight or skinny around the legs and I have quads. Comfortable will keep

These pants fit my husband well and he says they're comfortable.  They wash up okay, a little wrinkled.  I would buy more but they were out of stock for two months, so I cancelled the order.  Would recommend if they ever become available again.

review_title: Great design and fit Crap Quality
review_body: Total crap. Very poor quality. Year easily. Belt loops tore after a few months. Look good and good design but only intended to make the sale and wear a few times or only gently.

I was excited to order these jeans at what I thought was a good price. I ordered 38x30 and when they arrived, they were marked 38x30, however they were not even close. They were so huge I thought someone had played a joke on me. I measured the waist and they measured over 44 inches. What a joke. Again, they indicated the correct size, but were actually several sizes too large. Totally frustrated and disappointed. I thought I could trust Amazon to have better control of the quality of the products they are selling.

Fits well pre- and post-laundering. Color is good. Haven't owned Levi's in a while and the fabric seems a little thinner than I recall. Another commenter mentioned 5 versus 7 belt loops which is not a deal killer but I'd prefer 7. These jeans haven't been used much so I can't speak to their durability. I'm hardly a rancher or cowboy and I hope they hold up to my leisure pursuits.

Bought this in "tumbled rigid" which appeared as a slightly washed black but is actually a super-dark blue.  Regardless, I think these are great (most of my 559s have been) and will continue to purchase.  Some of the colors seem to be of a thinned material (which makes them fit funny); these did not suffer from that condition.

review_title: I have purchased the same size 559 jeans for years ...
review_body: I have purchased the same size 559 jeans for years, but after recently purchasing 2 more pair, I realized the cut seems to have gotten much tighter and uncomfortable.  So much so, that I returned them and will have to look some other jeans.

If you are debating between different Levi's versions then you've found the best one. The straight leg look is great, but the best part is the 559 has a slight stretchiness to it. It's not like these are spandex or sweat pants or whatever, they feel like regular jeans, but their subtle stretch keeps them from pushing and pinching your skin when you bend and flex, which makes them the most comfortable jeans you'll ever wear. I have two pairs and I basically don't wear any other jeans anymore. Get one blue pair and one grey pair and you'll be good-to-go!

The size was great and as always Amazon got them here quick. But, there was a stiff almost like fishing line seam and the top of the waist.  I tried them on and it felt like it was going to cut me.  I had them on for maybe 30 seconds before I couldn't handle the feeling anymore.  There is no way I could wear these things. Very uncomfortable!

review_title: Fit tight until broken in, durability isn't what it was a few years ago
review_body: I've been buying and wearing these for years. They're one of the few jeans that I can actually get to fit somewhat acceptably off the rack.

I love these jeans. Had been wearing the 514's for a long time, but I've gained a bit of weight recently and these are much more comfortable. They don't look huge as I was expecting, but being used to the 514's they're a bit tighter. These have been amazing. I've bought 2 pairs.

review_title: I don't know what Levis is doing, but I ...
review_body: I don't know what Levis is doing, but I echo other's comments that the fit of pants purchased several years ago is no guarantee that the current version of the same pant will fit today. My 2-year old 559 pants fit perfectly. This latest version is not even close. Length is shorter, rise is shorter, and waist is smaller. Buy in a store where they can be tried on.

I will continue to buy this product. I wear this jacket to the gym almost everyday and its holding up pretty darn well. No rips or holes and I don't go easy on this thing. It soft an cozy and helps me sweat. I love this jacket.

review_title: Nice hooded zip… no complaints at all.
review_body: I think everything that is stated about this in the details is correct… and it’s a nice mid-weight with lots of room in it. At about 15 bucks the price was really good and it’s just the right weight to throw on over a shirt when the nights start to chill. I’m 6’3’ and the XL gave me the extra room and fit that I wanted so it’s easy to move around in it and I’ll be buying some more because hoodies in the house for the winter are less expensive than keeping the heat cranked-up,

review_title: nice but runs small and a bit thin
review_body: Bought a few colors of this sweatshirt when my father had shoulder surgery.  I ordered a size up having read the reviews. I ordered a 3xl when dad typically need a 2xlt.  It just fit him.  The material was a little thinner than I thought it would be.  It would not keep me warm in the upper Midwest where I live but he is in the south and it was just ok.  We needed to layer to keep him warm.  I washed and lined dried and didn't see any noticeable shrinkage.

I'm 6 feet 200lbs and extra large is a good size.  Not tight and not baggy, goes to about mid butt, arms proper length and don't pull up when stretching, hood is good size.  Lighter weight than a normal hoody but not thin, inside is very soft. Never put hoodies in the dryer btw, it ruins the soft inside and ones with zippers it will shrink oddly around the zipper.  Best to lay them on a flat surface and flip it once in awhile.

These are the most comfortable sweaters ever. My husband get's warm very easily so he hates wearing sweaters/hoodies/jackets. This sweater is perfect for him because it's very thin, yet soft. He doesn't overheat in them, and it's easy to layer with other clothing.

Purchased this hoodie in a blue for my picky-about-color 16 year old teen daughter.  The hoodie fits her well and is long enough in the torso so as to not leave her midriff bare when she lifts her arms.  The hoodie is the perfect weight, heavy enough for a fall day or as an extra layer in colder weather.  Zipper is very good as it is heavy duty appearing and moves smoothly up and down.  Washes well with no shrinkage.  Has enough cotton so as to not pill.

This hoodie has a very odd fit to it in the sense that the sleeves are large and the torso seems smaller.. I guess if you have really long arms this would fit perfectly.. The hood itself seems to be a good fit not too big not too small. The draw strings seems way too long though so you might just want to remove those all together.
I love this jacket! It's super soft.
I'm a woman who fits a 2xl so, I'm a size down in mens! It fits great, it's comfy, and I love the baby blue color. It brings out my eyes :)

review_title: THINGS ARE GETTIN SMALLER & SMALLER WITH EVERYTHING !!  WHATS UP WITH THAT ????
review_body: THE PRICE WAS NICE & GOT HERE IN TWO DAYS . I LIKE THE COLOR  !!  BUT RUNS A LITTLE SMALL .  NO BIG DEAL !!  IM A LARGE SIZE IN SHIRTS & JACKETS .  BUT OVER THE YRS.  IT SEEMS AS THOUGH THE SIZES OF MENS SHIRTS & JACKETS , HAVE BEEN GETTING SMALLER & SMALLER .  SO I ALWAYS ORDER X-LARGES & THEY SEEM TO FIT PRETTY GOOD !!

review_title: What can be said about Levi's?
review_body: Delivered promptly (thanks Amazon) and fit perfect.  If you know your size, there's literally no reason not to order online.

Quality is lacking. The legs are huge, making my husband look ridiculous. There is already a hole right at the top corner of a back pocket and my husband only wore them twice to go out, not doing anything in them like work around the house or anything. My husband used to wear this style 10 years ago and these look and fit nothing like they used to.

review_title: was skeptical about ordering fitted clothing, but love the idea now
review_body: typically ordering fitted clothing from any online store can be tricky. Honestly, I was very hesitant to order measured clothing because I am a tall big guy. However, I knew what size i typically wear. I feared that the size ordered would differ in actual size once arrived. This was not the case. The Levis I ordered were just like the ones in the store and even lower in cost than my preferred department store. I was so pleased with the fitting, quality and savings (free shipping via Amazon Prime members) that I ordered another identical pair a week later. Saved me a trip to the shopping mall and perhaps a few bucks on gas. If you know your size, order that size is my suggestion. H

review_title: Levi's are not what they used to be..
review_body: Jeans has at least 4 missing teeth on the zipper.  I am returning, and using the send me same product back. We will see if another pair has any issues..  I will also be looking close at the other pair I ordered later today to make sure I do not find any defects......

The legs were really wide. The photo pictured is straight or even tapered. My husband's waist is a bit large, but his legs are muscular and shapely. These jeans made him look huge. We sent them back. I will say, the return process was easy. (It did cost me the shipping, however.)

I don't believe these 550's are really authentic Levis. I have had many 550's before and the fit and quality were much better. The material seems different and the fit is way too big with these jeans bought through Amazon. Go to Levis.com to be sure to get the authentic ones.

review_title: Poor design. Very unsatisfied with the lower quality of ...
review_body: I can't believe how quickly the area above the pocket ripped without being caught on something, etc.  Poor design.  Very unsatisfied with the lower quality of what used to be a superior quality brand.  Material was thin too.
Ordered 36x30, they are tagged 36x30 but....got at least 37X32, lesson learned. Likely mis- marked seconds. Drop right off my ass...Wont by Levis on line again, $39...get what you pay for.

review_title: Less than 1 year of weeekly use!
review_body: Poor Quality!  As other reviewers have commented, these are not the Levi's we grew up with.  The jeans are comfortable and fit well, but do not expect these to last a year.  Belt loops tear off, holes in the crotch,  zipper does not stay up (look down often to examine your zipper).

I wear a size 32-32 in every pair of jeans that I have ever bought until I ordered these. Once I got them and tried them on, I could barely get them up to my waist and could not button them. They were also too short for my legs making them look like capris. I would recomend getting these a size or two bigger.

I just love my new shirts I bought them long sleeve for next year's winter. They seem very soft and very thick so I am sure they will be very warm, when I'm ready to use them. Good quality. I would buy these again I purchased two of them.

review_title: A little thin to be called beefy.
review_body: Somewhat disappointed shirt is pretty thin I definitely would not characterize it as being beefy. Fit is good and it is comfortable and soft. After two Washings and is starting to pile. I wish there were better choices for long sleeve Henley's at this price.

review_title: and a medium in these fit like a compression shirt
review_body: These are extremely tight, much more so than other Hanes shirts. I've been wearing their Comfort Soft t shirts in medium for years, and a medium in these fit like a compression shirt. Be prepared to size up. Nice quality otherwise.

review_title: Very comfortable. I bought some of these shirts to make ...
review_body: Very comfortable. I bought some of these shirts to make it easier to get up really early in the morning, in the winters. Works just as well as I thought, and I found myself wearing them around during the day too, just casually.

review_title: Good Fabric, but very tight around neck
review_body: Size Large: Fabric is very good quality cotton and nice but neck is also really tight. I'm 5'7" 165 lbs with average neck.  Look at pic, the neck doesn't flop openat all - it stays tight regardless if you button or not. Just not normal people.

review_title: Very pleased with the quality of the shirt
review_body: Very pleased with the quality of the shirt. Always happy with the Hanes Beefy T. Color was a hit also. Fit was a little snug.

Comfortable, fit as expected... Perfect for looking decent when you're feeling casual. I call it my brunch shirt. It's not too warm but it's thick enough that it feels well made. I've washed it about six times so far and it's holding up well.

review_title: Good quality material however it fits snug on my 6'0 ...
review_body: Good quality material however it fits snug on my 6'0 180lb boyfriend. After washing I am positive it will no longer fit in the length of arms and overall shirt.

I bought a L and a M, I’m about 180lbs 6’ And normally wear a medium, the M is a little tight in the chest and a tiny bit short in the sleeves but they can be rolled up so who cares. The large has is a bit big, some extra room in the upper back/neck, I still like the way it fits tho. they’re great quality shirts

review_title: Good fit and a good price
review_body: This is my third henley by hanes. Good fit and a good price.
Overall quality is good, but the collar won't lay down, even after 5 or so washings. It's not a bad shirt, but I'm not that excited about it.
This shirt is so soft, the material is thin and breathable. The size fits exactly as listed and it arrived on time as expected! I will definitely be ordering again. Highly recommend.

review_title: picture does not depict actual color
review_body: shirt looks cheap. not like other UA shirts i have gotten in the past. be careful. i ordered the black shirt with grey logo and got the black shirt with white logo instead. does not look like in picture.

review_title: He is a tall guy and they offer it in Tall which is awesome. Very nice breathable material
review_body: I bought this for my husband and he loves it.  He is a tall guy and they offer it in Tall which is awesome.  Very nice breathable material.

Bought an XXL because the XL sized UA shirts I had purchased previously were a little snug.  I don't know if it's because these are different styles or what, but they are way bigger than I expected.  A lot of extra fabric, which gets uncomfortable when sweating on a run.

Not a big fan. I have a few other shirts in this line, various colors and they fit much better than this one. I got the plain white one and it does not have much stretch, like my other colored shirts and the cut seems to be a bit smaller than the other ones as well. Wish they were consistent, I do like the ones I have that actually fit well.

review_title: great shirt. cool to wear in the hottest weather
review_body: great shirt.  cool to wear in the hottest weather. fit perfect. ordered 4 more.  set for rest of the summer.

review_title: If you work in the heat, Forget that cotton exists.
review_body: I sweat ALOT. I work in landscaping, in Florida. Enough said? This shirt dries sooooo fast as long as nothing is contacting the shirt I.e. a seat in a car. Your chest will dry instantly but your back stays wet if the shirt is pressed against a surface. I'm not removing a star for this because it's pretty basic evaporation 101. This shirt is awesome, I bought one to try it, and now I'm buying 5 more, 1 for every day of the work week.

I purchased these as a work/undershirt and have really liked them. They are very comfortable, seem durable so far (got my first one a few months ago), and look great. Hot or cold it does the job. Summer heat/sweat is were they shine though. They really do seem to dissipate your sweat over a greater area and keep you cooler than a cotton tee shirt. They are also more attractive under pressure (no blotchy sweat stains as with cotton tees - especially with dark colors like I prefer). They will be my "go to" tee of choice.

review_title: I have all colors and for some reason only the ...
review_body: I have all colors and for some reason only the navy shirt’s hymns cam loose after initial wash. These shirts are so awesome

These are the first pair of pants that I could wear without having to have them hemmed.  They feel nice.  My only knock is that they seem to attract a lot of lint.  Worth the money so I purchased 3 pairs.

review_title: Quality is fine, but the fit is baggy
review_body: Quality is fine, but the fit is baggy. The legs are straight and very wide st the bottom. Even for a bigger guy like me a taper would add a more refined look. Good news is that Amazon’s step up brand good threads has a nice cut to them and good quality.

review_title: size is ol but color is off
review_body: I ordered one size wider in the waist since I can't wear it before buying. the color it a very faded matte black almost charcoal in color. I will keep them but it's very basic and subdued.

You pay for what you get with these pants. They are not very wrinkle resistant at all. They also fade a lot in their first wash cycle, so they look a little funny against my black dress shoes. I wouldn't recommend these pants. They look, feel, and fit cheaply. On the other hand it's important to remember they are very cheap pants, so like I said you pay for what you get with these pants. If it wasn't for the fading and the wrinkling they would be decent pants for sure.

review_title: The price is great - very affordable
review_body: The price is great - very affordable.  The material is comparable to those selling 2 times the price.  The legs are toooooo roomy.  You should state they are the relaxed fit instead of classic fit.  We have to return the pants.

review_title: Color is great, anti wrinkle is good
review_body: They are very bland and basic. The legs are massive. I thought they would be a bit more fitting. Color is great, anti wrinkle is good. Have a tailor handy if you are looking for a good fit. The waist is fine. I feel like a look like a high schooler wearing his dads suit pants to prom.

The leg length, measured from the crotcj, IS 28 inches. But the length from the crotch to the top of the pants has been increased to make the pants effectively 30-32 inches long. They're baggy when pulled up past my belly button, which means they're NOT 28 LENGTH.

review_title: But for the price they are a good buy for the money
review_body: Decent pair of pants. They are more relaxed fit (baggy) than I expected. I have worn this pair a few times and they seem to be holding up. I think I would of rated these higer if they werent so baggy. But for the price they are a good buy for the money.

The first pair were to long but the waist fit right.  So I ordered a second pair with the same waist, but one size shorter.  Those fit just fine.  The odd thing is the Khaki colored were to small of a waist and the length was fine.  So I ordered one size larger waist with the same length and they fit.
Great pant and comfortable. But on 3rd wash I pulled two broken buttons off out of the dryer. Cheap plastic buttons that break make good pants terrible pants.

review_title: The only (odd) issue I had with these jeans is ...
review_body: The only (odd) issue I had with these jeans is that my phone would sit in the pocket sideways. Does that make sense? That is, instead of the top being point up, it would end up pointing forward (or backward). It's kind of uncomfortable. The pockets must just be kind of wide on the inside. Wouldn't stop me from buying them again, though.

review_title: This pair is wonderful. I love the way they fit
review_body: I have had difficulty finding jeans that fit just right. I bought some from a mall not too long ago and they were too tight and sort of had that "skinny jeans" look and feel but at that time they were the closest I could get to a decent pair of dark blue jeans. This pair is wonderful. I love the way they fit. They aren't too tight and constraining nor are they too baggy. I have worn them out twice now and love them. I am actually thinking about getting a second pair.

review_title: Nowhere near the size I ordered...
review_body: So, I've been wearing 559's for several years, but it was time for some replacements.  I bought the exact same size I've been wearing, but when they arrived, they were wayyy too big.  I thought they needed to be washed and dried to get to their correct size, but this still did not help.  After several hot washes and high heat dries, these things are still huge.  I measured them and the waist is 42 inches and the length is 30 inches, nowhere near the 38x32's that I bought.  I feel like I've lost 50 pounds, but am still wearing my fat pants.

review_title: Big legs? Big butt? These pants are for you.
review_body: I can never wear skinny jeans, or even classic straight leg jeans -- I'm just not built that way. Most relaxed and loose fit jeans tend to fit me comfortably, but often look like "dad jeans".  That's why I love 559s. They offer the perfect amount of room in the rump and thighs, but with a modern cut that sits low on the waist and neither puts your junk on display nor leaves you with saggy crotch syndrome.

review_title: Great jeans and size consistent among different colors (at least for me)
review_body: I needed an all black pair of jeans for some of the work I do so I tried these out. The fit was surprisingly perfect for me. I'm about 6'3 and 200lbs (thin frame) and ordered 32x32. The black pair of work jeans I bought fit so well I thought I'd try another color for normal wear. Just received them and they fit exactly like the other pair. It's possible Levi's has sorted the sizing inconsistencies that over reviewers report, or I just have been lucky, or maybe it's only with certain colors. Build quality seems to be much better than some other Levi's I've had in the past that have worn out way too fast and seem super thin and cheap. I'm actually very happy with these jeans and will order more in different colors. Oh, and the amount of colors they come in is also very cool.

It's my first time buying a pair of Levi's jeans that's not one of the original fits. Certainly not what I expected. There's some sort of elastic waistband that does not go well with a tumble dryer. Even afterwards, it's loose on the waist and a bit long to be 30 on the length. However, I can't deny how comfortable they are. I expect these jeans to last a while, as have most Levi's jeans I've owned. Maybe they'll shrink to size with enough wash and dry cycles, but this is probably the last time I'm investing in a 559.

Even though these jeans are the same brand and model as those I bought in a department store (which rhymes with Lacy's), the material is much, much thinner despite having the same price. The jeans from the department store were much thicker and heavier (so they'll last much longer) than Amazon's, and are much more durable. I bought six pairs from Amazon and am disappointed in the inferior quality. I feel like I got ripped off.  Levi's should not sell the same model but with different quality to different retailers. That is deceptive to consumers. Alternately, Amazon and Levi's should publish the material weight so consumers know what they're buying. I will not buy Levi's again from Amazon.

review_title: Jeans that look good, but are very thin.
review_body: These jeans fit as expected.  The finish and look of the denim is also fine.  The reason I am leaving only 2-star feedback is because the denim is extremely thin.  I can't believe that Levi's would sell jeans this thin.  They are nearly as thin as slacks.  I also bought a different style of their stretch jeans and they were thick and great.  Apparently not all Levis have went to thin junk denim.

Pants fit perfectly fine I was very happy with the purchase I made but I only had them for 2 months and they already ripped on the back right pocket.. I've never had issues with Levis in the past. I had one pair for almost 3 years!

Levi's 559's are for comfort and style.  I have tree trunk legs and these allow for ample room.  I couldn't give a full 5 star rating because in my opinion, the quality and durability of the materials is gradually declining.  Where I used to be able to get roughly 100 washes/dry's, I can now only seem to manage 60-75 before a hole or slit forms somewhere.  Also, the fit is so variable on Levi's.
