review_title: Jeans either tend to be way too tight (501s feel way too constrictive to me) or way too baggy to where I feel like I'm wearing b
review_body: I have a hard time finding jeans that fit how I want. I'm 5'9 and roughly 160-170 lbs (haven't weighed myself in a long time) so I'm medium to shortish height and I carry a few extra lbs around the gut then I would prefer. Jeans either tend to be way too tight (501s feel way too constrictive to me) or way too baggy to where I feel like I'm wearing bell-bottoms (569s...although I do still have and wear a few pair of 569s and I will until I replace them all with these).  Guess I have kinda short legs too cuz even wearing size 34x29 there's still enough extra length in the legs to cuff them 2-3 times (which I'm ok with...I tend to wear all pants cuffed). I prefer jeans to ride a little higher on my waist...not feel like they're hanging off of my ass also. This particular cut of jeans seems to hit all the marks. They are roomy in the seat/crotch/thigh area but have a slight taper at the bottoms. The 34x29s on my frame are tight enough that I probably wouldn't need to wear a belt.. but not too tight to be uncomfortable. If I gained another 5-10 lbs id probably have to size-up. There's enough leg length to cuff them a couple times which I prefer. I will definitely be buying a few more pairs of these and I believe this style will become my 'daily-drivers'.
Heavy and comfortable.  Ordered another in a second color.  Thanks.

I went to a national brand clothing store and purchased some "expensive" jeans ($15 more than Levi's 559's on Amazon), and they fit and wear like OLD Levi's 559's, and last twice as long. I will not be purchasing Levi's again.

MEN If your jeans are too baggy it will age you go for somewhere  in between, women want to know you have some kind of a body under your jeans :) .  We returned these and got the levi 514s perfect.

review_title: but these pair smelled like horrible plastic/rubber
review_body: They stank! I ordered these because I had already bought 2 pair, but these pair smelled like horrible plastic/rubber. I can NOT get rid of the smell. I washed them several times, I left them out in the sun to dry (by this point I can't return them) and they still smell absolutely horrible. I am really disappointed because my first 2 pair were fantastic, but I can't wear these.

review_title: Something about the stretch factor of these jeans, the ...
review_body: Something about the stretch factor of these jeans, the material they use versus other jeans of the same brand, makes these feel bulky and strange in general. Not just around the waist line but in general. I will only go for the regular relaxed fit jeans after this attempt, no more stretch jeans of any kind for me.

Only problem is that on the description it didnt say that they were STRETCH so they fit just a little bigger than Im used to from the waist.  But for $23 I still kept them and they still feel good.

review_body: The 559 is the only jean I wear.  Super comfortable and fits perfectly for me.

Love these jeans! Nice stretch and comfortable fit. I'd buy again.

I'm a little taller guy and have a hard time finding jeans that fit just right. That's why I like to buy mine online. I don't have to search from store to store to find the right size and the price is pretty reasonable too. The only problem I have with buying these online is trying to figure out the colors. Some of the pictures are hard to tell what color you're truly getting. On another pair of jeans I ordered from Amazon I thought I was ordering dark blue but they turned out to be black.
I really like the look and feel of these jeans. They are a little bit big in the waste fit very well in the legs.

I love Levi's but Amazon doesn't know the difference between stretch and rigid jeans.  Sometimes I will order than same style of jean and one will be a rigid and one will be a stretch fit.  They fit your body differently.  There is no difference in the description so I think the company doesn't know there is a difference.  Can't order these now from Amazon because I don't know which one I am getting.

Since these are nearly new it will be a while before I know if they'll stand up to wear and tear use like they did in the old days.

Thankfully this happened within the return period and Amazon graciously exchanged them for a new pair. All in all, I have found that this cut fits me well and for me this is a solid pair of pants.

The difference is enough to notice but not enough to stop me from ordering more. I think I'll consider these better for temps above 40 degrees and temperature isn't generally a consideration for me when choosing what jeans to wear.

review_title: Levi's 559 are Awesome. Love the stretch waist

review_body: Jeans had a hole in them when they arrived, and fit very tight. I've been buying 559 Levi's for the last 4 years and the fit has always been consistent from Macy's. Unfortunately my Amazon order was very tight like the jeans had been shrunk. If you look at other reviews you'll see that I'm not the only one with this issue. I love shopping at Amazon and am happy with 98% of my orders, but I would not recommend buying Levi's from them.

Love the jeans though, could wear them every day.

I gave this a one star only because I couldn't give it a negative ranking. I bought two pairs of the 550 cut in the same size and when they arrived they were two different sizes and way too small. They both had the same size written on the tag but fit extremely different. I took a gamble in buying them here on Amazon is because for some reason here in my area I can only find one color. I'm thoroughly disappointed and I hope I don't have to pay restocking fees for the mistakes of other.

review_title: I have to wait until I wash them a few times.....
review_body: Now that I have washed them several times I can comment that these jeans are so well made, sturdy and well worth the money. I've probably washed them four times on "heavy" since my husband is a contractor and sure gets the jeans dirty. But the Levis still look brand new! Of course, I would recommend steam ironing them (with the crease) right away. This seems to set in the color and the crease then you never have to iron them again!

I got the exact same pair for Christmas from Amazon and so I ordered these and they are way too big. They were one, maybe two sizes too large. I am 6'6" and it is hard finding my size in stores. It would be nice if Levi's made their jeans the same every time so you didn't have to wonder if they would fit when they arrive.
just what you get.
Matched size to his old 550's.  These came with a much higher waistline than in previous years.  Not in style.  Not good.

It's a Levi's .. can't go wrong as long as you have the right size and fit for you.  Sometimes a particular style are not the same fit, I guess it's quality control at fault there, mine happen to be just right.  The other color I got is a little small.

I like the cut and fit. They also wear like iron, well made with copper rivets. I've read complaints of poor quality and thinner material, but my experience with Levi 550's is just the opposite. I still have a couple of pair that I wear from several years ago. Levi still makes a quality product and I am testament to that fact.

review_title: These jeans are quite possibly my favorite! I have an older pair of these that ...
review_body: These jeans are quite possibly my favorite! I have an older pair of these that are maybe 4 years old and what's remarkable is the consistency of the fit over the years. Many other jeans that get in the exact same size end up either being too small or too large and are never consistent. I highly recommend these jeans especially if you have an older pair and know you love the fit and look of them.

review_body: I really like these jeans. The one caveat is that the material is a lint magnet, so you'll need to invest in a lint brush to keep them looking nice. But the fit is great and they're otherwise very good quality.

I've had three different pairs of 559 jeans over the past few years because they're so comfortable. My only complaint is that the fabric is slightly thin, after about two years I tend to start forming holes in the knees and the bottom hem begins to fray, but that's pretty standard for most of the pants that I buy.

Pants fit great and look very nice.  I did have to shorten them some, but I always have to do that.  I'm just to short for my weight.  I would buy these again, in fact I do have them in grey and love those too.

Have to return them.  Will be buying the next pair locally rather than online to ensure that the size is correct.

review_title: Hard to find but worth the search!
review_body: Searched all the stores, on line, malls, even discount stores and wholesalers - Levi 550 40x29 could not be found.  I even called the company representative.  I know they make them because I own a pair.  Amazon sent me a note asking me if I was still looking.  Yes.  I ordered 2 pair because they said that was all they had left, and who knows when I could find another pair.  Good price, fit great.

review_title: Careful of length between Levi's styles
review_body: Be careful on the lengths between different style of Levi's. I bought a pair of 32 length 501s with the same order, and they fit (length) fine. These 550s ran way too long - the 32 length carried down past my ankle another 2" dragging underneath my heel.
As jeans go, no complaints.  There is some noticeable variation in the product sizing, or just a one time mismarking.

review_title: My husband will only wear Levi jeans. He has ...
review_body: My husband will only wear Levi jeans. He has the 559, 514 and 569 he says because they are now being made in other countries he has noticed that they are not always the same size, he refuses to go a size larger so if the size 40x32 do not fit they will be sent back....The ones I ordered from Amazon were the 550 style that were made too small.

review_title: Fit is nice, quality not what I expected
review_body: I've been wearing Levi's my entire life.  I'm proud to say I have pairs I can still wear that have outlasted 5 presidents.  Unfortunately, these aren't going to be among them.  The denim is thin, the belt loops are held on with maybe 4 stitches (one broke on 1st wearing), and everything about them just feels cheap.  It's about what I'd expect out of knockoffs from a certain large bargain store, but not with product from Levi Strauss.

review_title: Great Pant, but a little small.
review_body: I got these for my son for a gift and they were a little smaller than what he usually buys.

All the 31 x 32 Model 550 Levi's I buy from brick and mortar stores fit me perfectly... the 2 pair I recently ordered fit more like 28 x 30's but yet were labeled 31 x 32 (?!)  This is the first time I've had a problem with Levi jeans. I wish I could get an explanation for this so I could feel more confident with my purchases...

review_title: Just like old times comfort and fit.
review_body: Nice, rich blue, suitable for "Casual Friday" at my work. These look and feel great and I love the old-school rivets. They fit just like I'd hoped.
Fit good, looks good.
Nice soft fabric, correct fit, my husband loves the color, ordering another one today.
Loved it, too small, sent it back.
Fits great especially with my long arms.
A bit tighter than expected, but otherwise, feels good.
Nice Nice

review_title: but nothing a belt couldn’t fix and he says they are comfortable, which is kinda a big deal for him
review_body: I bought these for my 12 year old son, who has sensory issues.  They were a little big, but nothing a belt couldn’t fix and he says they are comfortable, which is kinda a big deal for him.  They also look great!  I’m happy with this purchase!

Great Pair of pants
My son loves these pants and I am glad that I ordered them.

the price was good, however they are somewhat winkled

Sizing is wrong. 36X30 of Levis 559 fit me perfectly. I bought 3 colors - Levine, Cash and Sub-zero. Levine and Sub-zero fitted perfectly but Cash color was way to big. Seemed to be a 37X32 or 38x32. I guess they have poor quality control. In this age of automation - how can they get this so wrong. Other than that, the Cash was soft and color and fading was great. But useless if it is the wrong size.
My husband's favorite jeans. They fit well, look great, and the price can't be beat.
Nice fit, with a little give in the waist which I like.

review_title: Two pairs ripped after only a few months with normal wear and tear
review_body: This is the second pair of these pants that, with normal wear and tear, ripped at the crotch. The first pair ripped after about 9 months, the second (the replacement for the first) after only 3 months. I love them otherwise, but I can't afford to keep buying jeans that regularly when every other pair of jeans I've ever owned has lasted way longer.

I used to purchase 559 jeans then they were not selling locally. I bought these at Amazon and I was disappointed in the quality of the material. These are not like the 559s I used to buy. The fit is still good but the fabric is thinner. I have some cheap Wranglers that cost half the price and are thicker. Levi's used to be indestructible; not so much any more.
These are falling apart. Fuzz all over the floor!
Perfect fit. Color is what i expected according to pictures shown.

Great to get Levi's 559 "relaxed fit" so quickly, in my size (36 x 36), and in the color I wanted. Couldn't get these at a "brick N mortar" store in my area.  Retail stores never have 36" L except for "big and tall" and B/T charge a 20-30% premium for 36L...what a rip off to tall men everywhere!
My son has these pants purchased from Kohls. I ordered another pair the exact style and size and they were no where close to being the same size

review_title: Warm and cozy for the Fall weather.
review_body: The material is a bit thin and delicate. Let's see how long it will last!

review_title: Great jeans - bought two pairs for my husband
review_body: Great jeans - bought two pairs for my husband. Was worried about sizing based on previous reviews but the Andi wash and Range wash fit consistent with each other.

review_title: Excellent Levi, finally good to have a pair that ...
review_body: Excellent Levi, finally good to have a pair that fits so well.  I wore khaki pants for a couple years and they were either to shiny type no iron or regular which got all wrinkly all the time.  The Levi 559 fits well wears well and looks good all the time, they feel great and make me feel good.  Thanks

review_title: Over $20 cheaper than what I paid at Kohl’s!
review_body: Bought these for my boyfriend after buying him the exact same pair only a different color for $60 at Kohl’s. They fit him perfectly and look great on him. Definitely will be ordering more pairs for this great price.

I chose the five-star rating because these jeans are nice looking; because they were delivered promptly; and because, therefore, I am greatly pleased!  Only thing which surprised me, just a little, was to discover the fabric isn't as thick as another pair of jeans I purchased from Amazon a year or two ago.  But I think I paid more for those jeans.  For the price, these Levi's Mens Jeans are just what the doctor ordered. :)

I love these jeans.  The color doesn't fade like it normally does in jeans.  The wrinkles release easily - no more wearing jeans with hard wrinkles/creases - no ironing required.  Sometimes I'll through them in the dryer for a 10 mins to release the wrinkles.  In a rush, I'll just put them on.  The wrinkles release within the first hour or so of wearing them.
Andi color is very thin with big marks on it. Sending them back.

review_title: With this being said they are still my favorite pair of pants and are the only one that ...
review_body: I have had numerous pairs of these pants. Every single pair fits differently based on what country they are made in. None of them are very durable either, which shouldn't be the case for a $40 pair of pants. With this being said they are still my favorite pair of pants and are the only one that I have found that comfortably fit without looking baggy.
Had to sent back, even though I already bought a size larger they were still way too tight and my son wasn't able to close the zipper. Sizing is totally off!

review_title: The 559 is a great style with a variety of washes
review_body: The 559 is a great style with a variety of washes. I have muscular thighs and the 559 has an ample amount of room in the thigh but aren’t baggy. Waist and length are spot on. Levi’s has been the only brand that I can say is consistent regarding their length/width measurements between styles. I will continue to purchase this particular style due to its great fit.

review_title: Hit and miss depending on country of origin
review_body: Bought 2 but one seems of high quality than the other. One of the pairs back pocket started to rip off next to the stitching

I am a fairly slim guy and I go to Macy's and Sears etc... to buy these jeans and they never have my size or they do but are in some weird color that looks totally dorky on me as I am in my 40's not 20's.  In addition to not having my size they want like 50 clams for them where I can buy them on Amazon for 30.  I don't mean to slam retailers as they produce jobs but come on don't gouge your customers....

unfortunately this shrank when I first washed (in cold water) and it become so tight and so short, it did no longer fit. waste of money because once washed it could not be returned. the seller should have indicated that the fabric was going to shrink this much and that one needs to buy a size larger and longer.

review_title: Great Product - Why can't they be more consistent?!
review_body: This is frustrating. I love Levi's. I guess I've learned that I can't buy them online, they have to be tried on because the "same size" varies (at least in length) by about 1.5". That's WAY too much to be confident that they will fit. I bought the same size that I always wear and these (two) pair have to be returned because they are too long. IF they fit, I love 'em.

These pants appear to be larger than expected.  They are the same size I always buy my husband (and he hasn't lost any weight!), but fall down.  I will have to wash them a few times in hot water and run them thru the dryer to see if they will shrink up in the waist - hoping that they don't shrink in length.
I freely admit I'm cheap.  But I wanted something other than Lee jeans.  These fit well, but are a bit on the pricey side even on sale.

Love black 559 Levi jeans.  Have bought them at other outlets before.  Unfortunately, this pair came in an inch too short.  I know because I compared them to my other pair.  It was an obvious 1 inch shortfall.  How does that happen!?  Also, unfortunately, I missed the return window so now I am stuck with them.  Shame on me.  Buyer beware.

Great jeans. I bought the graphite version. They feel softer than regular jeans, and that is exactly what I like about them. They are not too tight, and they are not too loose. They fit just right and they look nice. I would definitely buy again.

I'm 250 and 5'11" and although they are an inch or two long, they fit perfectly and are the most durable jeans I've ever owned. Others last maybe 6 months before wearing and holes in the knee appear. This brand lasted 2 years before needing this pair from Amazon.

review_title: At this point I decided to cut my losses and I sent all of them back for a refund in order to buy something of better quality. A
review_body: These pants are junk.  I ordered 4 pair. The belt loops on two of the pairs separated from the pants.  Sent them back and Amazon sent two new pairs of which the belt loop on one pair separated from the pants. At this point I decided to cut my losses and I sent all of them back for a refund in order to buy something of better quality.  Amazon then decided that I should pay a restocking fee.  What a joke.
I bought these for my son who has trouble finding Levi's in his size. He loved them and says they seem to fit better than the one he found in the store.

review_title: Look nice. But only wore a handful of times since ...

I ordered two pairs - one lighter in color, but same style (559). This pair is very "stiff". The lighter pair is soft and moves with me, but this darker pair is super stiff. I've washed and washed them but they are still stiff. That is the reason for the 4 ⭐️

review_title: There is something abnormal with these jeans because all of his jeans in this size fit him perfect. Definitely something wrong with the fit won’t buy ...
review_body: I wasn’t aware of the time restraint for returns.  The jeans were too tight so he dieted and lost weight but they still don’t fit.  There is something abnormal with these jeans because all of his jeans in this size fit him perfect.  Definitely something wrong with the fit won’t buy here again

I bought these jeans for my husband, who probably has not had new jeans in like five years.  They fit perfectly, just like we remember 550's fitting.  He liked them so much, he wants the black ones now too.

Lost weight and needed new jeans since the 550's I had in storage for 20 years fit again but were quite worn.  These jeans are perfect for women who are slender in the hips and bottom.  Sit at waist.  This is the jean for those who are uncomfortable with pants that hang at the hips waiting to slide down at the least provocation!  Been there, done that, don't want (or need) to anymore!
My husband loves this style and cut; however, the fit seemed a bit off this year.  They were a little more snug fitting than his pair from last year, but he kept them anyway.

Product is too small even by Levi's own measurements. I own other pairs of the same pants in the same size and these were not 31x30. When I tried to return them I was going to be charged half again what I paid for the pants when all is said and done. Avoid these pants. Avoid this brand until they return to a level of quality control that reflects well on them as a business.

review_title: Thank you.  A traditional American-cut relaxed fit jean!
review_body: Call me old-fashioned, but I am not interested in acid-washed, pre-softened, skin-tight or fancy-pocket blue jeans.  Give me American-made, traditional cut, no frills, thick denim blue jeans.  I prefer to wear them in myself.  These are perfect for that.  They are relaxed fit, so there is a little extra room for you, and they are cut to be WORN, not to be "fashionable".  You want comfort and fashion, buy a pair of chinos or dress pants.  I will keep my jeans.

I also purchased another pair of 559 and they were made with much thicker and heavier feeling material. I'm not sure if it's only this style or the entire line is changing but these will have to go back.

review_title: Great jeans, i think im in between sizes
review_body: Great jeans, i think im in between sizes, i usually wear 36, but that was too small and 38 is to big, wish they made 37, but i kept them and wore the 38. they do bleed off on to your white sneakers, even the light colors, i messed up my jordans with blue stains in the sock liner.

I just ordered these Levi 559's a year ago, so I can compare these jeans, same style, same color - Tumbled Rigid, also ordered on Amazon. I cannot believe how Levi's quality has declined. The fabric can hardly be called denim; very thin and soft. There are other issues as well, but suffice it to say these jeans look like cheap women's jeans.

review_title: They're Levi's. That's a standard of its own.
review_body: Even though Levi's are no longer made in the USA, they are still Levi's, and wear forever. Fit like they always have. I order the same size I always buy.

I've been wearing Levis since I was in grade school and are the same jeans. They hold up to years of hard wear and are quite comfortable after being broken in. Initial fit is a bit on the small side but again they break in over time. Levis has information on their website about how all their number designations (e.g., 550) relate to the fit of the jeans which was quite helpful for me. The color online was an accurate representation of the product I received and I would buy jeans from Levis on Amazon again without hesitation. I gave these jeans 4 stars because the price is on the high side of competitive with other retailers.

I am female but buy the Levi's men's jeans because they no longer make women's jean out of true denim.  The problem I have found is that the fit is very inconsistent.  I am also finding that the quality isn't what it used to be and that the leather label on the back of the jeans falls apart almost immediately.  However, I still like these jeans better than any other I am able to find.

review_title: five repairs; too thin; poor quality; VERY UNHAPPY!
review_body: Within a day or two a belt loop became undone. So I had it sewed (I don't know how to sew). Then another broke. And another. And they were resewed. Then the metal buckle broke. Where'd all'y'all Levi Strauss-ers get a piece of metal that would break? So a metal button was sewn on where the broken-in-half metal-buckle was. Whether the metal button will stay is STILL in question. The quality has gone to nil; there is a badge on your back side that tells everyone the size (what's up with that??!!); the cotton denim was VERY THIN; the price is expensive; I wasn't being kept warm enough (thin denim); obviously was made in the 3rd world countries (probably lowest bidder); obviously the standards have slipped; and it appears to me that you're using the Levi's brand's reputation to make a quick buck before the brand's reputation heads to zilch. I WILL NOT be buying Levi's blue jeans ever again, unless I can find some that were manufactured 30 or 40 years ago!! VERY, VERY UNHAPPY!!!!

Levi jeans hold up very well. My husband isn't all that hard on his jeans, but have gotten other brands that just don't hold up as well. Also they come in odd sizes, hard to find sometimes. In the long run, for me anyway, I find that paying a little more saves me money in the long run.

review_title: Classic Relaxed Fit Jeans that fit perfectly and at a great price. These look great at first wear and get better with age!
review_body: I will have to admit I did go to a local store and try on this version of Levis relaxed fit jeans prior to purchasing on Amazon because their price was simply unbeatable.  The jeans in the store fit perfectly and the jeans delivered fit just as well.  I really like the blue color of these Medium Stonewash.  It is just aged enough to make them look like they are just beginning to break in.  The fit for me is ideal.  I am very athletic so I do not like jeans that fit tight through the thigh area.  These have the perfect fit for me because they allow to sit and stand without riding up or feeling confined.  Also, the rear of these jeans have enough definition that it does not look like they are just hanging on me despite them being a relaxed fit cut.  I can easily dress these jeans up by wearing a tucked in polo shirt or oxford shirt and nice shoes or dress them down by wearing a t-shirt and running shoes.  I have now had these for about 6 months and even with washing them once a week they have maintained their great fit and the color has not even started to fade.  I highly recommend these Levis and their Amazon price cannot be beat. Out of an abundance of caution you may wish to go to a local store to try on the different styles and cuts of Levis before buying them on Amazon just to be sure the fit you are buying works for your body type.  Of course Amazon offers free returns on its clothing so you could also go that route too.  I just do not like to deal with the trouble of returning stuff and then having to re-order.

This shirt is great for working out or any occasion during which you'll be sweating profusely. I live in Tennessee where it consistently gets up into the high 90's all summer with 10 million percent humidity and wearing cotton out to run, hike, or do anything else involving exertion is a recipe for sweaty, swampy disaster. The synthetic moisture-wicking fabric keeps me nice and cool and does not stick or cling when I sweat. Something to keep in mind is that you'll need to remove the shirt promptly from the wash and not let it spend much time in contact with itself or any other moisture-wicking fabric while wet, otherwise the coating that helps wick moisture away from your skin will be damaged. It's super simple though, just wash all clothing of that type together and hang dry indoors or out. The construction is good and the shirt has maintained it's shape and color over the past two years. You are paying a bit more for the brand name I feel, but I've used Under Armour stuff a lot and believe the quality they provide is worth the price.

review_body: This shirt is EXCELLENT.  I bought a Henley style shirt from Macy's for my husband years ago. It was a designer label, pricey, high quality cotton and VERY soft. Those shirts are now old and I wanted to find something similar to replace them. I wanted same style and VERY SOFT. Well, no luck at Macy's, JCP, Nordstrom. Nothing.  I checked on line and found this shirt. The price was very low, but it was the exact style I was looking for. I expected to be disappointed and was expecting the shirt to be rough. I was WRONG. This shirt is excellent quality, the sizing is perfect, it was similar to the designer brand I bought years ago, and very soft. The cost is low. With the name Hanes, you'd think it was thin like a long sleeved T-shirt, but nope. It's a solid, well-made pull over Henley. It deserves 6 stars.  Well done Hanes!  Yes, I'm buying more.

review_title: Good fit, low on the hip.  Fabric a bit rough
review_body: I've had different brands of straight fit jeans.  I'm 6'1 and 190.  Usually I wear Calvin Klein 34x30 jeans.  I like my length just a hair short, more of a modern fit.  Compared to the CK, the inseam is the same.  However.  The total length of the jean is about 1.5 inches shorter than the CK jeans.  They ride that much lower on the hip, and the CK was labeled low on the hip.  It's also a bit slimmer fitting than the CK.  Waist is spot on.  I'd say this is a bit slim for a relaxed jean.  I did wash it once, and there is no perceivable shrinkage.  I think the material is a bit rough.  The grey color has a bit of a rougher texture than the blue color.  Not sure why.  Also, I'm very sensitive and like really soft jeans.  These aren't that soft.  I wore them for 3 full days, hoping they'd break in.  I think they will, but needs more time.  I feel like I want to rip them off after a few hours.

review_title: I have two old pairs of 559 jeans (which I love! ) but they were years old and getting ...
review_body: I thought I was safe buying Levi's online, however, I was wrong...  I have two old pairs of 559 jeans (which I love!) but they were years old and getting worn out so I was ready to get a new pair.  I figured that ordering the same size, style, and brand that I would get what I already had.  Levi's must have changed the design or something because the new pair that I received was much larger than what I have (see photos).  They are much longer, looser in the leg, and just don't fit the same—very annoying.

I don't normally write reviews for many things online bit thought I'd start with these Jeans.  As a number of other reviewers have written, I found the fit of these jeans to be horrible.  EVERY color is made differently and subsequently fit differently.  I am normally a 32x32 and some were so tight and short I could barely get into them.  Others (the exact same size of the exact same jean - just a different color) were so big I could almost pull them off without unbuttoning them.  Needless to say, it was a very frustrating process to try to find one that fits.  The material seems quite thing as well and is so different than the old durable jeans you seemed to be able to get.  I will never attempt to purchase jeans online again!

So I had to try and guess my size, based on popular online converting tables. But it didn't work. I'm not saying this is the seller's fault! review_title: levi's has lost their quality control

I have worn 36 x 34 for over 10 years but when I receive my jean now I never know how they are going to fit. There can easily be an inch difference between each pair. It depends on which country they were made in. Mexico, Cambodia, Thailand or wherever they are made they all fit different.

The material is incredibly thin. There is no lining at the waistline so they roll around your belt. I doubt they will be presentable after half a dozen washes. These pants should not be called Essential.

I ordered a 30Wx29L and they're almost as long as a 30Wx30L. The crease was off center and for whatever reason my belt looks loose with these. In the picture I'm comparing them to a 30Wx29L pair of Dockers. Overall not bad for the $20 I spent, but I don't think I'll be ordering these again.

My husband really likes these pants. They are a lot like Dickies and are very comfortable. They are made of 60% cotton and 40% polyester. The cotton part makes them soft and  the polyester makes them wrinkle resistant which 100% cotton isn't. Polyester also doesn't get as dirty either, I've found. The pockets in back have buttons. One odd thing I couldn't figure out was why one of the pockets in front has like a little pouch in it at the bottom. For loose change perhaps? It's not very big and that's the only thing I could think of. It has a 4" zipper and button for closure and it does have belt loops. Machine washable and line dry or tumble dry on low. Made in Bangladesh. These are nice enough to either be worn casual, to work in, and if you put with a nice dress shirt they would even look quite stylish and dressy.

I work in a business/casual atmosphere, so I wear similar pants from different brands every day. These pants are very comparable to more expensive pants I’ve bought in the past. The fit was as expected, and the color was nice (I find some “Khakis” to be too light in color). So far, they have washed well and are stain-free. My only minor gripe is that they don’t let go of wrinkles as easily as I like, but they do a better job than some other pants I have.

review_title: The pants are great but they didn't fit me
review_body: Hi. The pants are great but they didn't fit me. I'm trying to return but you have s by me 3 labels and the 3 pairs of pants came in one box. Am I supposed to sent it in three different boxes? Thank you.

These pants are flat front chino pants with a classic fit. Wrinkle-resistant does not mean wrinkle-free. They arrived with wrinkles and would need to be pressed before wearing. They are not very dressy and would not recommend for professional office work. They are black, but the color looked faded when they were new and it did not hold the black color after washing.  They continued to fade. There is a lot of room in the leg, measuring 9" across at the ankle and 11" across at the thigh.  They have a more conservative style. There is a slip pocket that button close on each side of the back of the pants. The belt loop is a standard two inches wide. Two of the belt loops were crooked and gives the appearance of a lesser quality clothing.

review_title: Soft  comfortable and well made, A great buy!
review_body: The first thing I noticed is the super soft material these pants are made with.  I put them on and they fit perfectly on my body and legs.  The seams are nicely stitched, well made and no loose threads.  The fit around the waist is very even and comfortable.  Movement is easy and unrestrictive, as the material moves well on the skin, no grabbing or pinching.  The size, 34-30, is exactly on the mark.  For casual or casual dress use, these are great pants, comfortable, good looking and wear well.

I've only washed then worn them one time but I was really happy with the fit and comfort. They're very basic, but if that's what you need, they're perfect. They are a tad thin but I live in FL and am usually hot, so this is a plus for me. Ordering more if these still feel good after a few more washes.

review_title: while the pants fit great right out of the bag and they are wrinkle ...
review_body: This is about the first Amazon purchase that I have regretted. while the pants fit great right out of the bag and they are wrinkle resistant, they are the biggest LINT MAGNETS that I have ever seen. No matter how many times I put them in the dryer. or whatever I do to them I need a roll of duct tape to get all the white lint off of these pants. I do not know what type of sweat shop in Bangladesh that Bezos has contracted out to but he needs to have a warning label sewn into them cautioning everyone to wear with caution unless they choose to look like a moron walking around wearing a cotton patch on your black pants. and heaven help anyone that goes somewhere that has a black light inside or they will look like a walking meteor shower!!

review_body: Good fit, I like the color. But the chemical odor never washed out.  It made the clothes closet smell like some sort of rubberized chemical.  I suspect formaldehyde  I put them in the trash after about six wash cycles. I wore the jeans twice.  Not looking for a refund, just had to get them out of the house.

review_title: Authentic Levis Brand Quality and Style
review_body: I almost didn't buy these at all because of a number of the reviews stating material and craftsmanship quality were not up to the brand name standards. In fact, I spent over a year in Wrangler jeans (just NTS) mourning the purported demise of Levis. I recently went down a couple sizes and pulled the trigger on these 550s. What a nice surprise to find these are everything they have always been. Listen, regardless of where these are being manufactured and tailored (it would be better for US if they were born in the USA) the denim is perfect, heavy, nicely tailored and sewn. I think I must have been going through withdrawals in my Wranglers. Levis are the ultimate brand with great quality all around. I will be ordering my Levis online.
Not sure if it's a sun shirt though.

Bought this shirt last week to wear to the gym. Being a larger guy, I was concerned with the sizing on this as I ddi not want to look like a sausage at the gym. Size was just right and the shirt has performed well in its first week of use.

review_title: and Nike is still a great product.
review_body: Under Armour simply blows Nike away, and Nike is still a great product.

I got these for my brother, who is 21 and in college - he was not a fan. He says they're the exact same pants that his professor wears, implying that they were not stylish at all and seemed suited to older men.

review_title: Nice pants, but they were long and baggy
review_body: I ordered 4 of these through Amazon Wardrobe because they were a great price and I needed some new work clothes. They look and feel like a nice pair of pants, but unfortunately they don't fit like the other classic fit Chinos I own. They are a lot baggier than they look in the photos. They weren't too bad around the thighs but lower down on the leg they didn't seem to slim down at all. They also run longer than other pants. I wear a 30L in all my other pants and they fit great, but the 30L I got in these pants were an inch or two too long. Unfortunately they are too baggy and long to wear in a professional setting, which is what I needed them for. I wish I'd read more of other people's reviews because I see a handful of other reviews of people also saying they're too baggy. Luckily I got them through Prime Wardrobe so returning was easy.

Husband loves these khaki pants. Comfortable fit; these are just basic chinos for weekend wear. Not meant to be dress pants. Look great; got another pair in navy and taupe. They do wrinkle like all cotton pants. Also, as stated, classic fit, not trendy fit. Ironing was simple for me. Neither my husband nor I can tell a difference between these and pants costing 2 or 3 times more, except for the label, of course, which means nothing to us.

I've been wearing these pants once or twice a week for a month; I like them. Machine wash, dry, hang from the cuff, no ironing needed. Appear to be well made and durable, though time will tell. Fit as expected. A great pair of pants at a really good price.

review_title: Good solid basic pair of chinos...
review_body: These pants feel good, fit as expected, and are extremely economical.  Seven washes in and they have not frayed, changed shape or shrunk in length. They do not hold a crease like some pants I have bought, but come out of the dryer fine for casual use.  For business use, you might have to use a cleaners or an iron.

So I bought the black pants.. and Amazon Essentials actually used black fabric for the pockets.. and black fabric for the inside of the waistband.  I didn't even realize this was an option, I just always disliked how the pockets and waistband show up on other pants.  This is my go-to pants now.  I ordered a few more.

When you want a step above jeans but want to be comfortable dressing up a bit, this is s great choice.  Especially when you won't be burning your wallet.  At this price point you might expect a less than desirable fit and look.  But they are well made and durable.  If you have a uniform need, it's a no brainer to get a few pair.  I'm buying new colors.

review_title: Navy color lighter than photos; quality not too great
review_body: We bought the navy, and they look WAY  better in the photos than what we received. The navy is darker in the photos; ours was a more washed out color. :-(  We were hoping for better quality – you know, a thicker fabric, at least a somewhat more luxurious feel...  but these were really thin fabric and seemed on the cheaper quality side.  They did fit him though. Returned them. Our search will continue...

review_title: For $20 they are a good fit and a good middle of the road cut
review_body: Got my first pair. For $20 they are a good fit and a good middle of the road cut. On first examination the fabric is nice, not too heavy and good for southern climes. I will add comment when I have had a chance to wash them and wear them. The zipper is metal and they are one button. The fabric has a nice feel. The inseam was cut accurately and as expected the waist was cut slightly generously (but not as generously as I have experienced with other well known brands....just slightly😁). So far so good for $20. More after washing.

These are a very nice pair of pants. They fit pretty much as expected and are very comfortable.  They wash and dry well - no massive wrinkles and held their color.  If you buy them I hope you are as happy with them as I am and thank you for taking the time to read my review.

I usually order a 40X34 but that size was a couple of inches too big around the waist in these.  The 38X34 fit perfectly.  These look like any other jeans but the stretch fabric makes them really comfortable.

review_title: Blue Collar wash is a little off from picture and denim is on the thinner side
review_body: The 559 is nice and roomy through the thighs, which, despite having what I would call pretty standard-bordering-on-skinny-ish thighs, is something I find a problem with with some other Levi's styles. These are definitely "relaxed fit", very casual, so be sure that's what you want. I don't want to focus too much on the specifics of the style, because I think that depends mostly on trying on the jeans and checking out yourself in a mirror. So, I'm going to write about what I find helpful - does the wash of the jeans look like the picture? and what does the fabric feel like? (because if you've looked at Levi's before you know the denim ranges from pretty thin to very chunky). So, the wash in the picture is not exactly representative of what I received - the two pairs I got aren't as dark as the dark areas in the picture and the light areas aren't as light. So, overall, a little less contrast and a little lighter blue than the picture. They come off a little more Dad-ish than I had hoped, but not overly so (plus, I'm a Dad, so I guess the shoe fits). The denim is definitely one of the thinner variations I've seen on the 559. Personally, I prefer the thinner denim for the added flexibility/comfort, but, in my experience at least, the thinner denim wears out a bit quicker.  Overall, I think this is a nice wash, but I would have preferred something with slightly more contrast and the fabric suits my preference.

review_title: Great product, but eradic sizing and lack of quality control is troubling
review_body: I love the Levi's 559 jeans. I have been wearing the same style for several years, but I was unhappy with the pair I received. I ordered 34x32, the same size I always wear, but they were too long. I compared them to my current pairs, and they seemed at least an inch longer, so I measured them. Sure enough, they're 33in long. I read another review that mentioned the different locations of manufacture, so I checked all of my jeans. These were made in Bangladesh. My older pairs were made in Pakistan and Columbia. I don't care if Levi's has them manufactured in various locations, but they need to improve their quality control. The sizing needs to be consistent. I'll be returning these and hoping the next pair is sized correctly.

With Levi's you pretty much know what to expect when you purchase them.  So I was a little disappointed that the waist seemed larger than usual.  I typically buy a 33 waist and these seemed to be at least 33.5 if not 34.  They also seem "low-rise" to me, but they aren't advertised as such.  That might be why the waist size seemed a little large to me.  In the end I decided to wash them and hope for the best; and after washing and drying, I would say they are a little larger in the waist than my other Levi's, but not too bad and I'm glad I kept them.

I have been wearing Levi Jeans for over 45 years and they were jeans that were tough and could take a beating. I never thought they would become a jean that I would give up on but enough is enough! One of the belt loops ripped off in the rear on the bottom and just hangs in the 60 days of wearing them and at 57 I don't stress that much. Now one might think I did it somehow by catching it on the door knob but the Levi 560 I purchased earlier in the 2016 did the same thing and it can't be a fluke. Sorry but saving money on cheaper material is taking what was an American classic to another cheap foreign made knock off even if is made by the same company. R.I.P. Levi because what was once great about our proudly made in the USA jeans has faded away into shadow of what it once was. I would pay more for a pair of jeans that are made in the USA than to pay for jeans that fall apart soon after you start to wear them.

review_title: Very strange fit, nice but thin material
review_body: This shirt is... odd. It puffs up in my shoulder area? it's super weird and makes me look awkward. The fit was a little bigger than I expected, but this is a BEEFY shirt so I should not have been surprised. If you are a larger guy, especially in the arms, this shirt might fit the bill. The material is soft and thin, so would make a good second layer shirt for breezy days if a coat is too much. However if you are looking specifically for warmth, I'd say pass this up.

I have 4 of these shirts that I bought to wear as work clothes. They've lasted me over a year so far and that's pretty impressive to me because these shirts have held up to a lot of grinding and welding sparks, grease and oils from steel mills, and multiple years and gold from sharp metals at work. My Grey Henly style one is by far the softest for whatever reason, and has help up the best out of the 4. The other three are all coming apart the hems at the base of the shirt and for some odd reason my top button on my black one doesn't stay buttoned. I definitely recommend them, very cozy shirts, especially the henly style shirts. I'm 6'1" and 140lbs, being tall and lanky makes it difficult to find clothes that fit nice, these aren't tight or baggy on me. If the hemming at the bottoms held up better it would've been a 5 star rating hands down, but I can't knock them too much because they've handled a lot of abuse over the past 15 months!

This shirt fits really oddly. I'm surprised by all the positive reviews, but perhaps I just received a factory second. I'm 5'9" and 150 lbs, and the small fit snugly around my chest and abdomen but is baggy on my arms. It's a really weird combination. It's thick and comfortable, but I can't see myself wearing this without an overshirt due to the odd cut. I'm curious to see if the medium has a baggier chest without baggier arms. I'll update my review if I try one.

review_title: I'm usually just a large but somewhere it said to order bigger and I'm glad I did

review_title: Perfect fit for someone half a foot taller than me!
review_body: I recently purchased two pairs of Levi's 559 men's jeans (albeit in different colors) each in the same size of 33" x 34".  While one pair fit just perfectly, as expected, the other pair were better suited for someone about half a foot taller than me.  Clearly, I am returning this pair.  Please see the attached picture.  If the jeans were a fraction of an inch different, I would have never noticed nor cared.  However, here in the age of computers, automation, and complex information systems, you'd think a multinational company like Levi's could make sure a simple old pair of pants were manufactured to specification!

Comfortable relaxed fit.  No complaints.  I wear 34W X 34L, but I bought the 34W X 36L since the legs tend to shrink on all the jeans I've had.  Leg length has shrunk, and now fits like a new set of 34X34's should.  Buyer, I'd like advise you to buy your jeans 2" longer than you wear, if you plan on wearing your jeans for a long time like I do.

I was very disappointed with these jeans.  The material was thin and had a cheap feel.  The blue dye coloring was uneven and had 3 or 4 light horizontal lines in the upper leg area.  My first thought was that they looked and felt like a cheap copy.  I would never buy Levi's again through Amazon.  I would definately recommend that they should be bought in a local store so that you know for sure what you are buying.  Levi Strauss does not have adequate quality control of their jeans in all their foreign plants.

review_title: Highly doubt they are real Levis
review_body: I ordered three pairs of jeans and two of them are most likely not real Levis.  The thread color on the pockets was a almost neon green color.  I'm use to seeing the same orange stitching throughout the entire pant.  The Levis patch on the back looks fake. The zipper is very different!  The actual tab you use to zip and unzip is very distinctive on real Levis.  They have a raised notch stamped into them and the Levis logo engraved into the tiny tab.  The ones I got were just a flat copper tab, no notch, no logo.  And the biggest giveaway, the fit!  I'm use to my 550's fitting loose but comfortable but these fakers were tight around the leg and fit terrible around the waist.  Like I said, one pair was the real deal and I was able to compare them side by side.  Unfortunately, I noticed these things when I first put them on...after I had washed them like I do with all of my clothes.  So of course I could not return them.  Spend the extra and go to your local mall and buy the real deal.  I hope these are not what Levi's is cranking out these days.

review_title: Great Jeans, Nice Color But Larger Than the Stated Size
review_body: Updated:  Can't ever say anything bad about Levi's.  I purchased the 559s purposely for the relaxed fit.  I'm overweight but going down so I purchased them on the small side so that I could wear them awhile.  But apparently the relaxed fit makes them larger than the stated size so they are a bit too large even though I ordered them to be a little small.  My original review stated that they were somewhat large but after measuring the waste band I discovered that the real measurement was 3 inches larger than the stated size.  I now wonder if they were mislabeled as opposed to the relax fit style.  The rise of these pants is supposed to be "below the waist"  but I found the rise to be a little too high for my body type.

This item was purchased for my husband, who has always worn Levi's.  Until recently, he preferred 505s, but over the last several years, the fit is very inconsistent... smaller than labeled in the waist and either shorter or longer by as much as one inch in the length.  He switched to the 550s and the measurements seem to be more consistent in both the waist and the length, plus a bit roomier in the inseam.  Great product!

They felt too soft and not as rugged as I am used to. I am used to wear them two to three times before having to iron them. These I have to iron after every time I put them on! Not what I expected or I am used to.

Ok, pretty much all I wear are Levis 559's.  I love the Indie Blue. I saw this new Steely Blue color on Amazon so I bought em. The color is pretty similar to the picture but the description failed to mention that they are 98% cotton and 2% elastine, so they are stretch jeans. I'm the kind of guy that's just not ok with stretchy jeans. If youre into that sort of thing, these may be for you. Anyways, they did have a decent weight to them and the waist fit ok while the inseam was slighty long. I got the feeling that when they stretch out a little, they would be too big. I'm about 5'8 150 by the way for a reference point. They are made in columbia and seem to be well made. So overall they seem to be quality jeans, just not for me.

review_title: Terrible quality.  Looks and feels like a knockoff.
review_body: First, the picture associated with the color I purchased didn't match at all what was sent to me. Second, the size was completely off.  I own two pair of 559s from a local Levi's store and the pair from Amazon is way smaller everywhere, especially in the crotch.  Third, the quality of these is TERRIBLE.  The fabric feels thin and cheap.  After comparing the logos and patches I would swear these were a knockoff.  I can't believe that Amazon would sell knockoffs, but I also find it very hard to believe that Levi's quality would change so drastically.  I am extremely disappointed with the product and would recommend  that if you can buy these in a Levi's store, you do so.

Purchased in mid-late 2015 and was the first pair of Levi's I purchased online!  It fit just like the other 550's I've purchased over the years.  However, after two washes the Levi's tag on the back started breaking apart and it feels/looks like cheap cardboard.  It's now March 2016 and the belt loops started tearing away from the pants.  LOL.  I never had this issue with the dozens of Levi's I've had over the last 20 years.  It may have been a defective product from the start, deteriorated in Amazon's warehouse, or could be an outright knock-off that got past Amazon.  Regardless of the reason, the jeans didn't even last a year.  ;(  Stick with purchases at a local department store you trust!

When these arrived, they were plastered with "genuine Levis" stickers and tags, and even printing on the inside of the pocket, to let me know I wasn't getting a knockoff. Well, authentic or not, the quality is...not what I expected. The fabric, rather than black-dyed denim, is almost a rough corduroy sort of material. There is also a 3-inch spot along the inner thigh where the seam was not folded correctly before being sewn, leaving the raw edge of the fabric exposed. Of course, after a few washes, this has begun to fray. Had I noticed this defect before washing it the first time, I would've returned these jeans, but unfortunately I did not.

He hates shopping for himself in the store, trying on clothes, all of it overwhelms him, but he was getting low on some clothing items. In some jeans, he wants a 32, in others, he wants a 33.  Then the length, depending on how the pants fall, determine whether he wants the length 32 or 33 inches.  You never know what combination on which pair of jeans he will want.  So I pulled out a pair of jeans he wears often, wrote down all the info--the numbers on the Levi's, the leg description, how the bottom is fitted--bootcut or regular, and I ordered the exact jeans in a different shade.  PERFECT!

review_title: Great product but not actually armor :(
review_body: Look in the mirror. What do you see? Are you physically attracted to yourself? Perhaps not. If so, this review has been tailored for you (shirt pun indented and I worked very hard for it and am proud of it). Maybe you are considering purchasing this shirt so you can get in shape. If that is indeed your quest, then cast your gaze upon the product picture. This could be you. Of course, you will need to put in hard work and actually exercise, but having the right tool for the job is imperative. Did Washington cross the Potomac with a pool noodle? Did Tyler Perry become a millionaire with a cheap wig? Did Alexander the Great use a sword made out of balloons by a poorly paid clown? I don't know. But I do know that this shirt is the right tool for the job. It is breathable without being breathtaking. LETS BE HONEST. Most of you want to know if your nips are going to show through this. Probably not a lot, unless you had the name Pepperoni Patrick around the pool growing up cause you were one of those kids who would always swim with a white t-shirt on. If you get the shirt in black, you might sweat more in the sun because black attracts heat (that's just called science people) but the benefit is that you might sweat more fat off. Also I don't know if any of you are into the Ninja arts and I don't want to know for legal reasons but black is a perfect color (not-color? idk. science) for being a ninja and with the UA breathability technology, you won't get Ninja Pits.  I don't know if ninja pits is a thing but I hope it is a term people start using.

review_title: Great shirt for guys who sweat
review_body: Can't go wrong with Underarmour. I use these shirts to work out or do anything where I expect to sweat. I like them loose (I don't have the body to get the form fitting, and even if I did I hate clothes that hug the body anyway) so I ordered a 2X. I probably could have gone with an XL (I'm 6'1" 200lbs) but as I said, I like them loose fitting. Color was exactly as advertised, shirt arrived FAST.

Highly recommended

review_title: Extreme dip in product quality from previous years, Not charged cotton, or wearable for that matter
review_body: Horrific. I have no idea what is happening to under armour but this shirt is trash. I am their biggest fan, own at least 50 clothing items and this is unacceptable. This is not charged cotton, its this cheap scratchy material that doesn't fit as well and is going to end up a rag as I tore the tags off immediately considering I own 6-8 of these shirts already and assumed it was the same. ITS NOT. I wear them all the time to exercise and around the house so I can state with certainty that there is no comparison. This isn't some nitpicky observation either. This went from a high quality shirt that everyone I know who has one likes to a shirt you would expect to get in an offbrand clearance bin for $5. UA stock has been plummeting and this seems to be pretty obvious cost cutting measures to try and keep investors happy by giving us cheap products for the same price. I'm done with this company.

It fits him perfectly; he typically wears a size Large, bought him a Large, and it fits. He loves the feel of the material on his skin and says that he feels less hot and sweaty when exercising. Overall a good buy!

review_body: nice quality

Fat people can't wear low-rise jeans like these. They go halfway up your bottom. It's rediculous. Levi's clothing design computer generates pants for larger size people, but they use the algorithm for normal size people and just increase the waist. Designs for skinny people are completely different from designs for fat people. The body doesn't scale proportionately (e.g., the knees don't become 10 inches bigger if the waist does).

This is a superbly made Tee, soft with brilliant colors, but Under Armour stresses all over its site to be careful to choose "what is right for you" in terms of "fit" -- either "compression" for tight fit;  "fitted" for following contours of your build, but not too closely;  and "loose" for loose.  Yet nowhere on Amazon's page, in "product description" or elsewhere, is there any indication what the fit is.  So be prepared -- it you are thin, or slight in build, or even average, the "loose" fit is on its way, which can be quite unflattering (more "sack"-like fit).

review_title: Fyi make sure of what you are purchasing. And save the tags
review_body: I dislike this product only because I absolutly hate polyester shirts from under armor or any company for that matter. I specifically went out of my way, double checked what I ordered to make sure it said cotton in the description. I even read reviews for the shirts I ordered and people said how they were happy with the way the soft cotton feels and all this other crap. Also, I went out of my way to even checked that the cotton shirts I own were the same ones I ordered same "heat gear" "loose" and 100% cotton because I absolutly hate polyester.  So I get home my gf already got the package which contained other stuff for her as well. So she took the shirts out, had them washed, and was excited to give them to me.  I couldn't be any more pissed when I immediately with out even touching them realized they were not what I wanted. I took the time to make sure I got exactly what I wanted and my luck or Amazon's mistake (def Amazon's mistake) I get two shirts that I will never wear. The tags n stuff it came packaged in was already in the garbage (that's my luck). So basically I realized why I never ever ever will order clothes online even if I have the same shirt (which is the only reason I did) because I always end up with something I don't want. I could be a dirt bag n pick the stuff out of the garbage but in the event they throw it on a shelf n re-sell it can't do that so I'm gonna eat this one. On a side note, the shipping info when I click on the shirt I ordered does say 100% polyester which I know I did not originally order (but good luck proving that right?)

They are light as a feather, don't add much bulk or weight and do what I want them to do ... stop embarrassing and unsightly sweat marks.  The perfect shirt.  I received a similar UA shirt for Christmas with a "Wounded Warrior" theme which I love ... I was looking for something comparable and was happy to find these.  I thought that wearing something under my polo would make me hotter ... not so much.  They stop any moisture from reaching and staying in the cotton polo and causing a chill.

I use to work out with regular cotton shirts and would always come home full of sweat and smelly.  My wife suggested I look at UA several times and I said those were for jocks and I didn't need to spend all that money for one shirt.  All I can say is, they work as advertised!  My shirt is always dry shortly after my workout.  Previously my shirts were soaked and I'd have to remove them before leaving the gym.  These are mostly dry by the time I get to my car.  I would definitely recommend these to anyone who works out regularly!  The only important piece of advice is go to UA's website and follow their measurements to figure out your size on all athletic wear!

review_title: perhaps not as loose as in the pics, but a nice tee!
review_body: i'm quite pleased with the quality and fit of the item. the only thing I would add is that you may want to consult the under armour website if you are unsure about what size to get. they have a "true fit" tool that asks some questions about your height/weight as well as what size you wear in other brands. the fit of the shirt is also modeled better on their site. the skinny guy on this page looks like he is wearing one size up. UA "loose" is not that loose. the fit is right for a casual tee. as far as the "performance" aspect, it does what it says it does. wicks and keeps you cool. gotta pay a little bit for the logo I guess, but it is a solid tee. made in Honduras, fwiw.
These used to be my favorite shirts, but as the years pass their quality gets worse and worse.

Ordered this in gray, then again in teal, huge size difference and teal has 2 different sizes on tags.  one tag says 4xlt the other says 2xlt (I usually wear a 3xlt in other shirts).  Also format of shirt tag is different than original.  I’m 6ft 3 and 300 lbs so it’s a nice long shirt if you get the right(larger version) of the shirt.

It's a nice shirt, but nothing too special. It's made of great material, softer to the skin than some of its competitors, but its very minuscule in difference. These workout shirts are all light and wick sweat off the body, and unlike UA's Coldgear shirts, these do not stand above the offerings of other brands as strikingly. Nike's Pro Combat, Tek Gear's Wicker shirts, Adidas Climalite, etc all do the same thing, and I don't really notice the difference. It's not like these shirts can stop you from sweating and feeling hot. Basically, these Under Armour shirts are nice and good quality, but you can't go wrong with any of these. Buy what's on discount.

review_title: I was afraid that I'd feel like my shirt would fly off during a bike ride
review_body: I'm not a fan of the sizing. Generally I wear 3XL (or 3XLT for cotton since I swear a single drop of rain and then warm sun can shrink cotton when you're a big guy wearing big clothes). Since there was no tall option, I ordered 4XL. Normally those are freaking kites on me. I was afraid that I'd feel like my shirt would fly off during a bike ride. This one though? Short and a bit tight. I understand compression but I've had compression clothes and they felt different. Maybe it is this shirt but if you're a big guy looking for gym clothes (aka not interested in showing anything off), this may not be the best option.

Lots of people people here said it's loose. NO IT'S NOT LOOSE! Most of them know nothing about sportswear. So, I ordered a medium even though I normally wear large. A mistake. I am 5 ft 8 and only about 78 kg (172 lbs). The chest size is OK but the shoulders are a little too tight. Should have bought a large. You always have to consider your shoulders size.  I have broad shoulders for my size, but Amazon lists only chest and waist sizes on their size chart.
I wear a 36 in all my other jeans, but these are a little big. Other than that they look and feel great.

Pants length as advertised.  However, the pants are apparently cut to be worn below the waist.  I measured a pair of my 38 waist pants that fit normally and the length from top of waist band in front through the straddle to top of waist band in back is 31 inches.  On these jeans that measurement is 27 inches.  This means the jeans ride two inches below the waist at best.  I have to constantly tug at them to try to keep them on.  Every time I sit or lean over, they slide down.  Once I lifted a box from trunk of car and walked into house and leaned over to set it down and the pants fell down completely.  Fortunately it was my house.  I went back to see if I had overlooked this critical dimension and could find nothing in the description to warm me of this design 'feature.'  I realize women have been wearing pants below the waist for some time, but I want my jeans to come to my waist where they will fasten comfortably and stay up!  Beware of ordering these jeans.

review_title: The most comfortable pair of jeans I've had in several years.
review_body: This is the most comfortable pair of jeans that I've had in several years.  The fabric is lightweight, has plenty of "give" where it counts, looks nice, and launders well, looking nice at the end of the dryer spin cycle.  The addition of elastic (my term for Levi's own term) really makes a difference in keeping the jeans at the waist (or just below) without sliding down as you stand up or sit down.  These are really well-designed jeans, and for a tall, somewhat wide at the waist guy like me, they make real sense.

review_title: What is going on in that warehouse?
review_body: I've ordered this item before and have always been very happy with my purchase but this time, not so much. Why? Well the quality of the sweater was fine. It's what came with it that has made me angry. First, I noticed a hole in it's packaging, the hole looked like it had been punctured with a finger. I didn't think much of it because I understand wear and tear can happen during processing, but when I took the sweater out of the packaging I noticed it had white specks on it. Upon closer inspection I noticed it was flakes of dandruff and I became BEYOND DISGUSTED! The hole has made me come down to the conclusion that whoever handled my sweater put their dandruff in it on purpose. And frankly I don't know whether I'll ever feel secure purchasing clothing items from amazon ever again.

I'm a 5'10" and 100lb female, but I typically buy plain/unisex-looking shirts/jackets because that's what I like. I purchased this in a men's large with the expectation of it being very large on me. I was, after all, looking for a large, comfy, sweat jacket that I could just throw on. This however, was smaller than I thought it would be. Have you ever seen a shirt/jacket that looked too wide in comparison to how long it is? Well that's what I thought when I saw this. It is a wide jacket with lots of extra room or 'puff' in the chest and stomach region. But in terms of length, it came to about my hips. And as far as the sleeves go, they're a tad too short. They fit okay when my arms are relaxed, but if I stretch or reach out for something, they ride up my arm.

review_title: Levi's Jeans are no longer a quality product
review_body: Having preferred and always worn Levi's jeans, I am very disappointed in their quality control of late.  I will no longer waste my money on them.  The last three pairs of jeans that I have purchased over the past year have all failed in the same manner - one of the rear belt loops rips out.  These have not been worn in arduous, rough conditions - just everyday suburban wear.  Nonetheless, each one has failed within 1-2 months of purchase.  Each time, belt loop rips a big hole in the rear of the jeans, such that you can't sew them back on.  Very poor construction.  Given that these jeans are about two to three times the price of their competitors, they are not worth the wasting my money on them.

review_title: BEWARE !!  The warnings you read about poor Levis quality are true.
review_body: I've been wearing Levis Jeans for more than 25 years.  I read many reviews about the recent poor quality, but I have never had a problem before.  It wasn't two months before a belt loop ripped out at the bottom...just like so many of the other reviewers (and like them I never yank on the loops).  Of course, they can't be returned after the first month, so now I'm stuck with a $40 pair of pants with a hole in the back.  If I'm going to end up with disposable pants, I'll buy them at Target or Walmart--they will almost certainly last longer than eight weeks.

review_title: 30 year brand loyal customer thinks it's time to move on...
review_body: I've been wearing Levi's for 30 years.  They've had a problem for at least the last decade though, and it's getting worse.  There is absolutely no sizing consistency between individual pairs of jeans.  It's almost like the company stacks up 20 layers of material and tries to cut out all twenty pairs at once.  Of course, one can well imagine this wouldn't work.  This problem is not solely on jeans purchased from Amazon.  It exists no matter where we procure the items.  I realize that Levi manufactures the jeans in multiple countries.  The problem exists even on the same style made in the same location.  Amazing.  I'd guess that 3/4 of the jeans that we purchase now are returned to the seller for sizing inconsistency problems.  On top of this, the material used to construct the jeans seems to be getting thinner and it wears much quicker.  Levi is no longer the quality that it once was.  After 30 years of being 100% Levi loyal, it's time to move on.

As a creature of habit, I've worn Levis for over 45 years. Beginning in grade school, when you weren't cool if you didn't wear Levis ( and Converse), up to today, when comfort becomes more of a factor, it's just always been Levis when I needed a durable pair of jeans. I'm sad to report that over the last couple of years,the Levis 550 jeans that I've purchased religiously have had a sharp drop in quality.  Even though I'm less punishing to my jeans than I was when I was younger, the area around the back pocket rivets shows signs of wear after a way too short period of time. Once the area around the rivet begins to unravel, the pants begin their way-too-early transition from good looking jeans to " wear me only when doing yard or cleanup work" jeans. I kept buying the 550's thinking that it was probably a short term aberration. It was not. Sad to say I will start looking around for a new brand of jeans once this latest pair begins it's too quick transformation to "crap" jeans.

review_title: I MISS THE GOOD OLD DAYS OF MADE IN THE US OF A :(
review_body: Ordered the RINSE color 550s. Hard to find color in my area. Found one my size a few months ago at a local retailer. A tad bit on the snug side. I wanted another of the same color. This one from Amazon is the same deal (snug fit). But I'll take it. I'm currently into the darker color 550s. I was going through some clothing I had not worn for 20 plus years. Found a few 550s made in the USA that was stored since the early 90's. The difference in materials is like night and day. The new ones are like paper thin compared to the ones from yester year.  It was heavy duty quality material back then VS a cheaper thin light feel 550s of today. IMO. I don't think these will last too long. But I love the color. The good old days of the Levis jeans are GONE! :(

I have a Levis outlet about 45 minutes away from me but I chose to order online to save time and the drive. I could have saved some money and time if I would have went ahead and made the drive. Shipping was free but it did take a while to arrive. If you are familiar with your size, style  and the Levis product you can order with pretty decent confidence they will fit. If you are not familiar then I would go to a store to try on some different styles and sizes till you find what fits best for you. I did like the fact these were not "factory seconds". The seams were straight and the zippers installed correctly. Some minor overstitch problems with one pair but a few seconds with the scissors took care of that. I might order again if these go on sale but @ $47.50 a pair all in, it wasn't really a bargain..

review_title: Levi's just ain't what they used to be!!!
review_body: I remember when Levi's were "almost bulletproof" I could buy a pair, they would fit well and last for years. Unfortunately this is no longer the case. I purchased these back in March of 2011 and the first thing I noticed is that there are fewer belt loops and they don't fit like they used to. If you are a slob who wears his jeans hanging halfway down is rear end these jeans are for you! If you are going to work or play in these jeans and and give them any kind of wear and tear at all, find another brand. Plain and simple, these aren't the Levi's we all grew up with. They are not made in San Francisco, the design and fabric used is inferior. and I cannot get even a year out of a pair anymore. Levi's used to be known for quality, durability and shrink to fit comfort. These newer ones though not tight are coming loose in the seams and popping belt loops too which is a problem caused by poorer reinforcement of the stress points on the belt loops and the seams and the fact that fewer belt loops need to handle greater stress from the belt and normal movement.  I do believe I have purchased my last pair of Levi's and will be buying Carhartt and other brands instead!!! It's truly a Shame!!

review_title: Buying jeans online is a gamble, period.

I happened to get two pairs of 550s in a row that fit me pretty well, so I'm happy.  I got lucky.  The material and sizes (regardless of size listed) vary wildly on these, that's just how it is.  It's more of a world economics issue than it is Levi's being some sell-out crappy company.
