review_title: Don't last even under light use.
review_body: Nice looking jeans but after only 15 months of very occasional wear, 2 of the 3 pair I bought from Amazon have holes opening up around the corners of the rear pockets.  My wife fashioned a good repair on one pair and then I noticed the same problem on an other pair.  See photos.  Not satisfactory.  I'm on the search for a different manufacturer.  You should be also.
CHEAP CHINESE CRAP -- DO NOT BUY!

I’ve been wearing Levi’s for years (mostly 517’s)  and wanted a loose fitting pair so I bought the relaxed fit. I’ve read a lot of complaints on them but my have worn as expected. I’ve had my 1’st pair for 4 years and have worn them a ton. Yes they have holes in them. Yes they are faded, yes the Levi’s tag on the back came off but I’ve worn them literally probably a thousand times. I love the stretch they give. Only complaint I have it the material gets baggy after a day of wear. But keep in mind I wear 517’s and they are slim fit, tight in the thighs. I’d buy a whole closet of these if I wore relaxed fit jeans

review_title: From now on, I'm only buying sits-at-waist jeans
review_body: The moment I tried these jeans on, I fell in love with them. Most Levi's pairs seem to sit below the waist, which is frustrating when browsing in a store. I just don't like that style. I purchased this pair specifically because I wanted to try something that fits at the waist. It was exactly what I expected. The whole seat area feels extremely comfortable and fairly roomy, sitting, standing or doing whatever. The back of the waistband does not fold 'open' when sitting, especially with a belt, which I really like.

review_title: Knock OFF's?????? I'm not sure, but highly suspect so.
review_body: Not sure but I think these two pair I purchased are NOT actual Levi brand. It was not till I pulled them out of the wash and noticed the cross stitching over the back pockets were "yellow" vs the typical orange stitching. On one of the pain the red "Levi" tag did not have Levi printed on it. The Levi tag on the back upper right seemed shinny as well. I compared them to my old pair and am curious if anyone has had or noticed the same.

I've been wearing Levi's for nearly 40 years. They have always fit per the listed size and were quite durable. This is no longer the case... Each pair (of the same size) I recently purchase fits different - some small, some too large. I've worn them for about 3 months now, and the belt loops have torn off, with some pockets losing stitching and failing. Levi's is no longer the quality brand I've come to expect. So unless they get their act together, it's no more Levi's for me... I have found a substitute... They are a tad more pricey, but fit well. I haven't worn them long, so I'm not sure if they are durable. They are the "Lucky" brand jeans.

review_title: Levis... not what they used to be.
review_body: They might say "Leivs" on the tag... but they sure are not the Levis I grew up with.  It's a sad comentary on an American tridition that has sold out for higher profits by going over seas.  The quality control is gone and sizing is a joke.  New Levis I have tried are 4 inches smaller than Levis I have on with the exact same size on the label.  I have grown up wearing Levis... now I must go find another jeans company that builds a quality product that is consistant and a fair value.  It's a sad day for me.

review_title: This is not original Levi's.. Keep away of this seller...
review_body: Hello .. buy two levis jeans for a birthday present. To my surprise these pants are not original, which discouraged me a lot, you buy them thinking they were original. I recommend you stay away from this seller because it is a scam. Also try making a comment about this and published it because according to them is very little information. My advice is do not buy here. I am sincerely disappointed. lost $ 100 on this and do not want this to happen at all. try to buy at other stores and check the quality of the pants. if they are really original or not

I only wear Levi's 550 jeans (38x34). I must have about 20 pairs so when I saw them advertised on Amazon for a great price I decided to buy 4 pairs. Well when they arrived I was just going to put them away until I planned to wear them. My wife told me to try them on and it's a good thing I did because the fit was so totally different from all my other pairs. I was really disappointed and had to return them all. I believe Levi's has either changed the cut or it's where they are being made. Nothing negative against Amazon. I order many things from Amazon and will continue to do so. Like I said, I think it's a Levi issue.

I've been getting these jeans size 34/30 for a long time so I didn't think there was any need to check the fit. I got new ones, put them on, and began to notice that when I had my shoes off I was walking on the pant legs, which is very unconfortable. I measured them alongside of my old 34/30 and they are THREE inches longer. How is this possible? Did I get a mis-measured pair or have they changed the length of "30" without announcing it?

review_title: Holes after a couple months of wearing Jeans
review_body: I've had the jeans for not long at all, and already I'm noticing a hole that is growing in the butt area. I'm not heavy set (150 lbs male) and I do not have a large behind. Jeans just seem cheaply made.

There isn't much to say about these except that they fit great. I wear a 29-30 depending on the brand and the 30's from Levi's fit like a glove. I have found that finding 30x30 in the NJ/NY area is sometimes a bit tough as Americans tend to wear larger sizes than other countries. Purchasing these on Amazon really simplified the equation and in general I am quite happy with these.  The quality on these is great!  After reading some of the negative reviews, I will keep an eye out for defects and post an update if these start falling apart.  As of today, there are no holes, loose threads or anything that would be construed as a defect.

review_title: Wrong colour .... Not a brand new pant !! please correct the error.
review_body: This is not about the size at all. I didn't try the pant; it is about the colour and the material.

I've been wearing Levis for over -40- years now [Dingo Boots?] - and, they really need to work on consistent cut, sizing, and fit.  These were made in Mexico, and fit like they should.  I'm not Mexican, but;  would like to say that Mexicans understand Americans and produce products that are a much closer fit to American expectations, than many far-off nations.  The other Jeans that I bought [same size and style, in Dark Stonewash], were made in Egypt, and are not even close to the fit of these North American Jeans - went back the day they arrived.

Add me to the 'belt loop ripped out for no reason' club. Minimal and easy wear on these and one of the belt loops has ripped out. This is not stitching coming undone...but belt loop ripping away from the denim and leaving a hole.  Another thing to note is that the Black 550 in the same size as Dark Stonewash 550 do not fit the same. The Black are a much snugger fit, almost not a Relaxed-Fit.

Review Summary:  I bought these for my 6 Foot 6 Inch Tall Son.  I needed black jeans which won't fade quickly and jeans that would look nice on a 6'6" frame that is medium to large.  And they LOOK VERY NICE on my Son.  Fits him perfectly in all areas - waist, hips, crotch and long enough that he can fold them or just leave them "bundled" around the top of his shoes (as most teens do nowadays) but above all, they look very nice and fit beautifully and MY SON LOVES THESE JEANS.

We have also been buying the Levi's 550 relaxed men's jeans for years. The last two pair, however, both had belt loops pull loose from one end and holes developed where the back pockets top corners attach to the jeans. I might wonder if it was just one pair but for both pair to fail in the same places makes me want to move on to another brand of jeans. Sad, but true. Goodbye, Levi.

Out of the package the zipper on these jeans stuck.  Almost impossible to move up or down.  I was about to return them, but got the idea to use a speck of garage door chain lubricant on the zipper.  After tugging on the slider I finally got it to move over the lubricant.  After sliding it up and down for a few minutes it finally started moving normally and I didn't have to return for a refund.  Nonetheless, it's inexcusable that Levi's wouldn't have better quality control on a critical part of their product.

I purchased these 550 jeans based on the superb wear I had from my previous 550's. Six years ago I purchased five pair of these jeans from A&N and have worn them weekly to work. Those jeans were thick and heavy. I expected these new jeans, labeled also as 550's, to be of the same quality. These new jeans are paper thin as you would expect of jeans half the price. So, if you like your jeans to be thinner than your PJ's for lounging then these might be for you. But for work jeans I'll be surprised if they last a year.

review_title: Levi's have sure changed for the worse the last 20 years
review_body: WOW, Levi's have sure changed for the worse the last 20 years.  The last 4 pair ( two 550's and two 505's) I have bought, one or two belt loops break after 3-4 months.  I finally changed brands and got 2 pair of Carhartts.....love them and belt loops have stayed together....so long Levis, you were good way back, but not now.
